title: I might have been raped by a ‚Äúfriend‚Äù
body:
Tw : possible rape 

I went to a weekend in a chalet for the 30th birthday of one of my best friend. We were 20 and I felt safe because I knew most of the people there. 

In these 20 people was a friend that doesn‚Äôt live in the same country anymore but came to visit. In the past, we had flirted and made out a few times but I didn‚Äôt want it to go further because I felt he was a bit too pushy and kind of brutal in his way of kissing, touching, grabbing etc. 

We partied all night long and at the end we were all pretty drunk, and he called me to bring him a cigarette so I went into his room and then it‚Äôs just blurry. I don‚Äôt know if I consented to a bit of what happened but I sure remember not wanting to do it. 
I told him I didn‚Äôt want to do it because now I‚Äôm in a relationship, I also was on my period and just wasn‚Äôt into it. 
He made me suck his dick by pushing my head and then went on to do anal. I told him multiple times that it was hurting me and that I didn‚Äôt want it but it was just as if I was talking to a wall. He was saying ‚Äúyou want it you‚Äôre turned on‚Äù. And so, as what was happening was disturbing I kind of thought ‚ÄúI might as well try to enjoy it‚Äù and get ‚Äúinto it‚Äù but truth is I just wanted it to be over, so I asked him to penetrate me in the vagina instead of the ass which he did. 
It still hurt. He chocked me so hard I was close to pass out, he was telling that he had waited a long time for this to happen. He didn‚Äôt finish and did not have condoms anymore so I persuaded him to stop there and just go to sleep.

At the end of it I was ‚Äúparticipating‚Äù in the sex act. I‚Äôm lost and sad. 


I don‚Äôt really know what I expect from this post.

title: I hate going to work on my period
body:
I work in a grocery store. Call me a baby if you want, but when your uterus feels like it‚Äôs on fire and your back feels like it‚Äôs going to crumble and break on you, the last thing I want to do is go shovel 200 pounds of ice into a seafood counter, break down 2-300 piece freight loads and sell people meat and fish all day. 

I have sick pay I can use, but I‚Äôm one of the managers and I work with a bunch of dudes who don‚Äôt understand this shit and have literally told me in the past ‚ÄúYour period doesn‚Äôt really count for sick pay.‚Äù I‚Äôm in a union so luckily that doesn‚Äôt really matter, but the flack I get the next day is really disappointing.  

Thankfully I‚Äôm off today and plan on sitting in a hot bath, but tomorrow comes quickly. Thanks for listening to my bitch fest. I appreciate this sub.


Edit: You all made me feel so validated. Thank you for being kind.

title: I‚Äôm the ugly teacher
body:
I just feel like I need to vent. I‚Äôm a TA at a charter school where my role is part teacher, part support, part paraprofessional. This year, I‚Äôm working with a teacher my age who is drop dead gorgeous and extremely charming. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about her, and the fact that I feel worse about myself when I‚Äôm around her speaks more about my character than anything. 

I feel incredibly unattractive around her. I try to do what I think is right in this situation and ask her where she gets her clothes and about her makeup tips, because in my mind, if you envy someone, you just need to learn to be like them. But I feel like I‚Äôm being creepy every time I ask because I know I‚Äôm trying to imitate her look, and I know the best thing is to strengthen your own look, but‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt think I have my own look. 

I don‚Äôt think I dress well. I don‚Äôt think I look good. I will never have the same curves she has unless I get plastic surgery, and my hair will never look as nice no matter what I do to it. When I pour all my efforts into my looks, I feel mildly pretty at best, but I also have a fear that people look at me like I‚Äôm trying too hard. And then when I go out when I‚Äôm feeling good, I get scared because I don‚Äôt want to attract the wrong attention.

This sounds very self defeating, but I just needed someone other than my boyfriend to talk to about this.

title: Would you date a fat guy?
body: I am 5'7 200 pounds and I am insecure about my weight. I have no confidence because of it and I am afraid to try asking girls out because I'm scared they will reject me for being fat.

title: Imbalance of expectations
body:
Ex husband posted a rant about how mistreated he is by me and a couple others. I responded calling him out for lies, and shared screenshots of our messages showing the truth about his behavior. 

Ex hasn't seen our child in months, has only talked to our child a handful of times since November, makes absolutely no effort to be part of kid's life. Screenshots I shared showed these facts, and he didn't deny it in any way.

Today, a woman we both know commented on the post. Didn't say one word about him abandoning our child, but accuses *me* of being a bad parent for taking part of my day to respond instead of spending that time with kid. Then blasts me for "always needing an audience" and "airing everyone's dirty laundry".

What the actual fuck? And yes, I'm looking for an audience right now, which is kinda funny considering. But how the fuck am I the bad guy here? 

I'm mostly just ranting about the lack of expectations for men vs high expectations for women, but would love other women's perspectives.

title: My ex asked me to take her to inpatient care and I mistakenly called her parents in the process. I would really like some female perspectives on this.
body:
So my ex had some serious trauma. She was raped by her abusive ex after we got together. I wasn't close with her family but they seemed nice, the problem was my ex kept a lot of things to herself, I had to work hard to get her to open up.

Things became too much at some point and she called me from her therapist's office to get her care. Unfortunately she had two kids with her ex and we needed to get them looked after. With no one but me and her family, I had to make some calls. She knew they were going to be mad but I didn't believe her.

Her parents came over unannounced and her father almost immediately attacked me at the door to get inside, mind you I only asked to speak outside and have never done anything to upset this man, but he had only recently found out about his daughter's rape.

Things became very tense very quickly. They disregarded her feelings, demanded she go with them, said she couldn't see me again, could never go to inpatient care, that mental healthcare was worthless, and told me that it‚Äôs a man‚Äôs job to tell a woman when she isn't thinking right.

I tried to stand up for her, but it's clear my ex wanted this to stop and started agreeing with him. I didn't know what to do and was suffering from some pretty serious trauma so I called the cops.

A few days later she called me over, her father was there, she told me I shouldn't have tried to keep her family from her and tell the cops she was crazy, she said she had never been suicidal and that she never wanted to go to inpatient care. When I questioned her on this her father said, even if it was true, I should have told you not to go.

After leaving her ex, her parents were responsible for her apartment, car,¬† job, and savings.

It's been about 2 months and I'm still shattered. Things got messy from there and I don't deny that my emotional state caused me to make several mistakes while trying to help her and figure out what was going on.

If you lovely ladies have any thoughts you could share, either to tell me off, give me a new perspective, or anything I would be grateful.

title: Followed by men
body:
In light of the recent videos of women being followed by men I want to share my experience with being followed and other men‚Äôs reactions to me telling them I was followed. 

I am 36, a woman, and have been followed a lot by men. Like more than I can remember if being asked on the spot. 

I‚Äòve been followed in broad daylight quite a few times. When the guy is in a car it‚Äôs really scary to me (a guy tried to smooth talk me into his van once as I was sitting on my stoop minding my business). The last time this happened, a guy in a truck followed me an entire mile after I flashed my wedding ring and told him I wasn‚Äôt interested. I was pregnant at the time and terrified because physically I was more vulnerable. 

I‚Äòve been followed at night. The last time it happened, the guy actually picked me up off my feet and walked with me and I had to fight ‚Äúplayfully ‚Äú to get him to put me down. Believe me, I still wtf? when I think back on that one. 
 
And the last time I was followed in broad daylight by a guy on foot was 2 weeks ago when I was on an errand buying necessities for my 5 month old who I couldn‚Äôt wait to get back to afterwards. 

When I‚Äôm being followed I first think, god, not again. Then I think how am I going to get out of this or I hope he doesn‚Äôt touch me. While it‚Äôs happening I am usually thinking nothing. Survival mode? After it happens I‚Äôm frustrated, creeped out and angry. Especially now that I have a kid. 

And the men I‚Äôve told just don‚Äôt get it. I assume these men don‚Äôt follow women, but they still don‚Äôt get it even as a ‚Äúcrime‚Äù against common decency. The worst reactions are the laughs and/or jokes about it. Or the disbelief. Or the non reaction like it wasn‚Äôt a big deal and obviously nothing happened. What do you mean nothing happened? A bigger and stronger person purposefully followed me and that in itself is threatening. Duh?

What gives?

title: Being nice to men always bites me in the ass
body:
I'm am extremely sweet and friendly person. Whenever I'm nice to someone, it almost always comes back to me negatively. ESPECIALLY when it comes to men. 

I'm friendly to a boy I've never met and they automatically think it's okay to hit on me and be very inappropriate. If I'm too sweet to my guy friends, they cross lines that are not okay, and of course I'm too shy to stand up for myself or say something. I had a 'friend' smack me in the ass once when we were hanging out, not even flirting, and I didn't do/say shit. I don't want your creepy compliments. I've gotten catcalled so many times when I was actively with my boyfriend. We'd be walking down the street around 8 in the evening and some jackass asks me to show him my tits as he drives by. Fuck off

At work a week ago, there was an older man who was looking really down. I got him a free coffee and chatted with him a bit. Turns out, he showed up the next day, and asked for my number from one of my coworkers. He now texts me constantly asking to hangout and talk on the phone. He's 40. I'm 18. It's so uncomfortable and I'm way too kind to say something and I'm a total doormat. But I'd rather endure the abuse than make someone else sad or upset. 

I hate that I even half to feel that way at all. I get creeped out and I promise that if I was a male in the same situation, nothing would have happened. Almost all men in my life have some sort of made-up authority over me and my body. They completely disregard how I might feel. Heaven forbid I say something about it.

If I'm too nice, they basically abuse me, but if I stand up for myself, I'm 'a total bitch and ungrateful'.

title: When is it "appropriate" to text a guy after a date?
body:
Basically Sunday night I went on an amazing date with a guy. Lots in common. Ended the night with a lovely makeout sesh. He texted me all day yesterday. But I don't want to seem clingy or anything and jump the gun and text him again. He made it clear he wants to see me again (although I've had guys do that and never text me back when I text them). I really don't want to fuck this up because he seems really nifty. I'm 21, he's 25 if that makes and difference. I've never dated an older guy. And he I know he probably is busy as he is a grad student, so I'm not too worried on that front.

Sorry if I seem all over the place. 

EDIT: Fuck it. Texted him. Success. 

Edit 2: He had meant to text me. Had it saved as a draft.  We are now texting about a comic. I was silly for worrying. Yay anxiety for no reason!

title: My sister is losing her baby, and I feel pressured to take over even though I know I can't.
body: Just looking to relate to someone, or possibly for some inspirational advice.... Anyways, my sister recently gave birth to my first niece who I have yet to meet because I live so far away. I am supposed to be going back "home" very soon to meet her. She has been in the hospital since she was born because my sister did drugs throughout her pregnancy and the little angel has had to detox from drugs for the last... almost 3 weeks. The two months before she was born my sister was on the right track, in an outpatient rehab, and staying on medications to help her not do heroin (still not good for the baby, but it was a step). But the damage had been done and DCFS and the state are all over this case and are now ready to take the baby... My mom wants to take care of the baby but would be required to quit working which isn't possible. She passively hinted at me moving home to help her take care of the baby but I kind of laughed it off. It is something that I think about often though..  what if I have to step up and raise this baby? I can't just pick up this life I've made for myself and flip it upside down... but what kind of sister/daughter/aunt would I be if I just let them take the baby away.... Is it the selfish side of me thinking that it is ME that needs to save the day? This is the most conflicting thing I have ever gone through and no matter what, the outcome is going to be difficult... help.

title: Being ‚Äòfeminine‚Äô seems to be mostly negatives to me
body:
I think so much of being feminine is attributed to being weak, submissive, etc. Or your body, like looking hot, wearing makeup, looking attractive. Either that, or it‚Äôs something related to being a mother or having babies, like being nurturing, or being able to give birth.

I don‚Äôt really relate to any of that at all. Meanwhile being ‚Äòmanly‚Äô is attributed to a whole bunch of ‚Äòpositive‚Äô characteristics like being strong, independent etc, which are completely divorced from superficial appearance and your ability to have kids. Meanwhile on instagram I see people glorifying being dumb or airheaded as ‚Äògirlhood, not being able to drive, the ‚Äògirl math‚Äô trend etc. Or they will make a joke of being incompetent as ‚Äòi‚Äôm just a girl.‚Äô Like is this really all I have to look up to? 

Basically this makes me feel at odds with my identity. It feels like anything positive I want to strive for is ‚Äòmanly‚Äô by default‚Ä¶ which I know is BS but it‚Äôs hard to feel otherwise. Society expects me to be feminine but it all feels like a bunch of negatives which serve the patriarchy. So what should I even strive to be? Sorry I really don‚Äôt know how to articulate what I feel but hopefully someone understands where i‚Äôm coming from. 

I feel lost cause I feel like I have no sense of a positive role model or an ideal to look up to.

title: Realistically, we will not get our rights back in our lifetime. And I'm just so tired.
body: I don't really even have anything else to say. I'm just angry. And I'm tired. I'm doing what I can, research, donations, but it's not enough. Nothing I can do will be enough. I'm not usually one to be a doomer but...I just don't see any other options for us right now. The cards are stacked against us. And it'll take decades to break them down.

title: Made appointment to talk to OB about sterilization. What are the chances I can obtain a hysterectomy?
body:
Hey all. As the title says, I have a consultation set up to discuss sterilization with my OB. I‚Äôm in my late thirties, married with stepkids and not planning to have any bio kids. Because of this and the recent election, I‚Äôd just prefer to get sterilized and not have to worry about birth control anymore. I also have a family history of uterine cancer and, to be honest, am not interested in menstruating anymore if I‚Äôm not going to have children. My periods before BC were very, very unpleasant (heavy, lasting weeks at a time), but I‚Äôve been on BC in some form for nearly twenty years so there isn‚Äôt a medical record of that. My periods on BC, say towards the end of the life cycle of my IUD, were also difficult but more manageable. I‚Äôd prefer to not have to remain on BC post procedure.

Is there any chance that, given my family and personal history, my OB will perform a hysterectomy? Has anyone been successful in getting this to happen? My OB is wonderful and very supportive, but I expect this to be an uphill battle regardless.

title: Can a strip club force you to work for them because you sign a contract?
body:
An employee of mine recently got a second job as a stripper, but after her first day at work she decided she wasn't comfortable with it. She tried to quit, but she claims they are not letting her  because she signed a contract. I told her that this seemed really sketchy. Does any one know if this is legal? 

Update: Thank you all for the advice. Harrassing them about getting a copy of the contract for her "lawyer" was enough to get them to let her quit without any backlash.

title: Is it so wrong to want an asexual relationship?
body:
I (18F) honestly don't really care about sex. Often my sex drive isn't even that high. 

Many people date and have relationships, I almost started to feel envy of those who are happy with another person. Yes, I know that I'm free by being single, but I have so many things to do and si few supportive people around me that I don't enjoy being so lonely anymore. People seem to care only for themselves.

I'm not made for throwaway bonds with people who only care about sex. Many men (this is also seen on dating subs) feel entitled to tell that if a woman wants a relationship without sex it's like "ordering a pizza, but not eating it" or "wanting free meals". I just want someone cooperative with me. 

**Alpha Males**‚Ñ¢ say that: "Men need sex, you're depriving them", but then proceed to call you a freak if you hypotetically mention the possibility of dating castrated men. 

Sex isn't everything in life and you cannot assume it's a good thing for everyone.

Must I think I'm doomed to be alone? Have you had similar experiences?

title: Self image, bra sizing and gaining some confidence?
body:
I've always been really, really bad at accepting stuff to do with puberty. For example, when I was 11 (I was an early developer) my mum carted me off to a (relatively) fancy clothes shop, and made me put on a bra and strip down in front of a stranger to be sized. The whole thing was very traumatic, especially since is been ignoring the fact I now had boobs. Back then I was a 32 C, apparently. 

I've never been back, and upgraded myself to a 34 D when it got a bit tight, which I felt really awful about. I'm not feminine and a D cup just sounds massive (I know that that isn't the only way bra size works now though). 

I finally plucked up the courage today to take the measurements for the website on the sidebar of /r/abrathatfits , and that says 34 DD. I don't really know, I have some really awful self body image about that. I feel like I must be so huge or something, but also like I can't possibly be that size, since surely i'd notice them all the time.... It's made me feel disgusting and i'd really like to hear someone else who's gone through this and come out accepting of their boobs.

Sorry, just a bit of a PMS and tea fuelled rant that's ended up in here, I guess.

title: I hate the fact that I was groomed. If you were, how do you cope?
body:
Tl;Dr at the bottom. 


Grooming is one of those topics I see pop up here every so often and it's shocking how common it is. I myself am just one of many cases and it continues to haunt me more than 15 years later. 

I [now 33F] was 12 and he was 22 and we "met" online. I told him in the beginning that I was 16 (as if that somehow made it better) but eventually told him the truth about my age and the "relationship" continued. Until I was 17.

My parents were getting divorced, I was lonely and felt neglected and it was nice I could have someone to talk to. Even if it often became sexual. 

He often talked about marrying me, what our children would be like and painted this whole life together. He eventually became very possessive and would often force me to stay up into the wee hours of the morning on the phone with him even though I might've had school the next day. 

More than once I tried to break it off with him and explained that I felt like I was being robbed of my childhood. His response would always be something manipulative and I would remain with him. 

My parents knew. Maybe not the full extent of things since I wasn't comfortable to come out and say these things aloud (I'm still not). After my parents divorce, I stayed with my mom. She never tried to put a stop to it or explain why this relationship was wrong. I don't think this was due to negligence or shitty parenting - I think she just didn't know how to handle it and had so many other things going on at that time. And I wonder, if she had taken the time to sit down and talk to me about it, would I have listened? I don't know.

Years later it still bothers me. Most days I don't think about it. I'm in a much better place in my life, in a good and healthy relationship, and have a better relationship with my parents now that I'm older and they're thankfully long divorced. We never talk about it and tbh I don't want to talk about it. It always makes me feel a little nauseous and dirty.

Since it's disgustingly common, if you or someone you knew was groomed, how do you live with it? How do you forget about it and move on with your life? All I want is for it to be buried so deep it becomes forgotten. But here I am - 5:30 in the morning making this post because I woke up and for whatever reason, the memory of this horrible experience popped into my head.

Tl;Dr - was groomed. Scarred for life. Asking others that might've been in a similar situation how they live with these *feelings*?

title: Is birth control really that bad?
body:
I just started birth control (the pill) yesterday because I am 19 years old and having a child right now would be an absolutely terrible idea. I  have seen so many posts for the past few months about how horrible birth control is and some women are swearing up and down that it is so awful for your body and that you need to stop taking it immediately. It‚Äôs really stressing me out because every post I see on social media is scaring me about BC but I feel like I don‚Äôt have any other choice. I have ALWAYS used condoms with my boyfriend but I just don‚Äôt feel safe and I don‚Äôt want to take that risk anymore. I know abstinence is an option and women are always being shamed for having sex but I just want to be able to live my life and be happy, I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs so bad about that.

Can someone reassure me that it‚Äôs not so bad after all? Because at this point I‚Äôm going to continue taking it to prevent something that could change the life of not just my boyfriend and I but also our families. I just want to know that I‚Äôm not actually permanently ruining my body.

title: Almost 26 and never had a relationship, would appreciate some advice if possible
body:
Basically, I‚Äôm a 25 year old guy (almost 26) and I've never been in a relationship. I really wanted to post here because I don't feel like any of my friends really understand my situation. Some of them think I‚Äôm desperate for a partner, when in reality I‚Äôm just reflecting on where I‚Äôm at in my life.

I don't sit around crying about being single, I‚Äôm very happy with my life in general. I absolutely love my job, I have hobbies, great friends, a wonderful family and an alright social life. I‚Äôm told I‚Äôm funny, I‚Äôm easy to talk to and I wouldn‚Äôt say I was ugly (but obviously I‚Äôm no model haha). I just can't shake this feeling of inadequacy. Like time is kinda running out.

I spent my early 20s focusing on my studies, my friends and myself. I never cared about being in a relationship, I always just figured it was one of those things that would happen. Then I turned 25 and it dawned on me that I wasn't where I expected to be in life. I'd never had a gf. I'd never had sex. I'd never even kissed a girl.

This past year I set about making an effort to put myself out there more. I went on about 5 dates (I can now say that I have actually made out with a girl haha) but none of them really went anywhere. Either they weren‚Äôt into me, or I knew it didn‚Äôt have much of a future. I also struggle to escalate things on a date to touch or kissing. On top of that I‚Äôve never really felt comfortable with the idea of casual relationships or casual sex just to have an outlet for sex. I guess I just feel like waiting for someone that I really want to have sex with, not just someone that I'd be okay with having sex with. But again, as the clock rolls on and I‚Äôm on the verge of 26 I‚Äôm starting to wonder if I‚Äôm holding myself back in that regard.

I keep trying to make positive steps to improve myself as a person. In the next couple of months I‚Äôm moving out of my parents to have my own space and independence, regardless of the money side of things. I‚Äôm going to go to cooking lessons in the new year to learn a skill I‚Äôve always wanted. Basically, I want to be the best version of me that I can be. 

I don‚Äôt think being in a relationship makes you happy. It annoys me that society basically says that, if you are single, you‚Äôre somehow lacking. But with all that said I still circle back round in my mind to this question ‚Äòwhy hasn‚Äôt it happened yet?‚Äô and with each failed date, or rejection, I have to try harder and harder. Every so often this past year I feel a bit hopeless even though I know I have a great life‚Ä¶

Basically, I‚Äôm not really sure why I‚Äôm posting‚Ä¶ I guess I‚Äôm wondering if any of this is something that would put girls off a guy? Should I just get over my hangs ups about casual sex and just do it when I get the chance next to get it out the way? Or is it worth it to keep waiting for somebody I see real potential in, or feel a connection to? Is that something that girls would even care about/appreciate? I also don‚Äôt even really know where to meet girls? I hate clubs and don‚Äôt really have a friend group that is single to help me meet girls so I feel alone in that respect too.

title: I don‚Äôt want my dad to walk me down the aisle
body: I met the most wonderful man, he‚Äôs my best friend and after two years we‚Äôve been talking about getting married. We‚Äôre both in our thirties, and I have built a beautiful life for myself basically despite my parents. They are extremely Christian conservatives and while I grew up in that, I left the church, got an engineering degree and a great job all on my own. My parents are older and had kids prior to getting married and having me, so they weren‚Äôt all that involved, especially my dad. I love him but I hate the idea of him ‚Äògiving me away‚Äô. I do not feel like I‚Äôm anyone‚Äôs to give but my own. I was thinking maybe my husband and I both walk down the aisle together? I love my dad but I‚Äôm a grown woman and we‚Äôre not close and I don‚Äôt want to feel like chattel. Has anyone else delt with this?

title: Gosh i need some help here, ladies
body:
So, to make a long story short, me and my fiance have been together for 9 years. We have a son whos 3. 
Ive finally gotten a job i really love after two years at home with my son. 

I really feel ive grown so much these three months that ive had the job. Its like ive found my old self again and Im good at this job! 

So, i work in a male dominated field. And ive met someone, hes a coworker and were the two youngest here, so naturally we talk. 
I feel like theres this strong chemistry, and I think about him a lot. We were at a work thing two weeks ago where we talked a lot, probably flirted a bit too... We were two of the four last people to leave. 

Right now its truly only a work crush, we chitchat and glance at each other many times in a day. 

I believe that this crush has happened because things at home isnt the best right now. We are both so busy and tired at night. We never have sex anymore and when we do, i have to initiate. I feel like we have become roommates. 
Im sure that if things had amazing at home, then my crush probably wouldnt have happened. 

Im so frustrated and sad right now, and I dont have anyone to talk to about this. Has anyone been in my shoes? Like, what do I do?

title: A boomer told me after showing me art stamps of her vagina that ‚ÄúWell, you won‚Äôt get it because your generation is sexually repressed‚Äù
body:
I couldn‚Äôt even say anything about it I was so shocked.

Not only had she sprung on me without my consent pressed imagery of her vajayjay but all I could think of was how her entire generation openly mock women wearing short clothes or low tops as sluts, or how anytime they meet a trans woman they have to ask what she has between her legs. 

I couldn‚Äôt help but think about how they encourage their men to be careful around women incase they poke holes in condoms or lie about being on the pill to trap their precious sons into marriage. 

I couldn‚Äôt imagine calling a whole generation who is encouraging clear consent prudish when your generation condone marital rape and joke about laying there hoping your husband finishes soon so you can get to sleep.

This woman really thinks that slathering her labia with paint and pressing it to a page makes her sex positive when five minutes before over tea and biscuits she was telling the group how her sons penis no longer works after his car accident. 

I could not believe what had entered my ear canals when she said that. Boomers make me crazy.

title: On month 3 of my period, and it sucks
body:
I‚Äôm on the third month straight of my period and it sucks. I‚Äôm always bleeding profusely, my body is starting to get discomfort from wearing my diva cup so much, I miss my sex life and not constantly cleaning blood off myself and sleeping without waking up in blood and not feeling like I need to snack constantly, pooping without my cup moving, having a handle on my emotions, not getting blood on my clothes. 

I went to the doctor and she prescribed me birth control pills even though I told her that the last time I was on the pill it triggered a period like this. She changed the brand of pill and I‚Äôm taking it because I need to do SOMETHING about this. But I‚Äôm on day 6 of the pill and the flow feels even heavier for some reason. 

I just need to vent to someone other than my fianc√©, who is a man and will never understand.

title: 3 days after being single, I got humiliated at a party for being overweight.
body:
My boyfriend and I broke up this past week (we ended on good terms, but it's been hard), and I decided to go to a party with some friends to distract myself. Within a half an hour this guy was chatting me up. I wasn't really looking for anything, but the validation and compliments were nice. After a couple hours, a friend-of-a-friend comes up to me and says 'Hey, I gotta tell you something'. She told me that the guy talking to me had been targeting me all night. She overheard his friend and him talking about 'trying to f*ck a fat girl because it would be funny' and they picked me.

There have been very few times in my life I've felt that dehumanized, objectified, and degraded. I looked at all the size 2 girls in the room and felt stupid for even considering the fact he was serious. I've gain about 50 lbs over the last 2 years, so my weight is really sensitive. I've felt the erasure that comes with gaining weight, but I've never been the blatant end of a fat joke. 

My friends were super cool, word got around that it happened and the party dropped from 25 to 5 people in like 5 mins. The support I got from my friends was incredible, and I'm so thankful things couldn't go further. 

I just can't help but say to myself over and over "You used to be attractive, but now you're fat and alone". Not the happiest post, but I figure it's better to get it out then keep it in.

Edit: Wow. this is the most interaction i've had on a personal post, and i never expected so much kindness. thank you all.

title: MIL said we live like slobs, advice?
body:
So before we got married, my husband bought and now owns a house. He had 4 roommates living with him, all male. The house was basically a frat house and not kept clean. I moved in and the roommates moved out. I have been slowly making it better. Painting one room at a time, getting new toilets, new blinds, when we can afford it. 

His mother came over sometime two years ago (about the time I moved in) and realized the house had went really down hill from the guys. She complimented me on what I was doing and for Christmas last year said she would pay to re do our outside patio. Nothing has come of that but that‚Äôs not this story. 

So I recently started on a new project to paint a small bathroom. It had wallpaper in it and I‚Äôve never dealt with wallpaper and I got all of the things to remove it and it was just not coming down so my husband offered to pay his moms boyfriend to come get it down for me.

They said no need to pay and that would come help for free. So thankful! So they came and started to take it down and his mom decided to do a total makeover on this bathroom. New floors, lights, sink, all the stuff. I‚Äôm so so thankful and it‚Äôs turning out way better then if I had just painted it. 

So I am a stay at home wife(hoping to be a stay at home mom some day.) Anyways, I do all of the cleaning and all of the cooking. I‚Äôm on a pretty strict schedule and I like for my house to be clean. No dishes in the sink, laundry done, stuff like that. 

So she‚Äôs been in our house the past week working on the bathroom with her boyfriend and there‚Äôs soo much construction stuff laying around. Just everywhere. So I‚Äôve decided to sit back for these days and not clean like I normally would until everyone is out and I can get back into my groove. I am already someone that needs space and I don‚Äôt love having people over for long periods of time so I‚Äôm kinda of just taking a week off of work basically.

Today they were over here end she walked by the dishes in the sink and said y‚Äôall live like slobs to my husband. I wasn‚Äôt there. He stood up for me and said it‚Äôs normally really spotless in here, it‚Äôs just because all of the bathroom stuff is everywhere and she shrugged it off.

So my question is, should I confront her? We have an okay relationship. She has a strong/loud personality and I‚Äôm more of an introvert so I haven‚Äôt always went to an event or dinner she‚Äôs asked me to attend and that‚Äôs hurt her feelings in the past. 

My feelings are hurt right now though because my house is normally super clean and organized and I just feel like it was uncalled for.   I don‚Äôt know. Help?

title: Please stop saying I can ‚Äújust have another kid‚Äù
body:
I know those who are reminding me that I can become a mother a different way aren't saying so to hurt me. It's nice to be hopeful and positive, to be aware of the other options available. Sperm donation, IVF, surrogacy, fostering, adoption, are all amazing options for women to become mothers. 


After multiple miscarriages and just recently a stillbirth with a hysterectomy, my body gave up. My heart gave up. My brain is now taking over and the fairytale of having a family is over. I got a lot of comments saying "why are you pregnant if you are poor?", "why were you trying to have a baby homeless and single?", "Thank god you got sterilized, now get a job!". I was trying and conceiving my pregnancies I wasn't who I am right now. I was with a partner of many years, living in a beautiful 2,300 sq ft home, a baby fund ‚Äúnest egg‚Äù, my ‚Äújob‚Äù was becoming a mother. I didn‚Äôt know about the extreme manipulation going on, literally oblivious. I didn‚Äôt know how vile he and his family were.


I didn‚Äôt mention this next part but after my trip to Maine not being what I thought it was going to be until I got there, I went back ‚Äúhome‚Äù. I needed shelter and I needed my money. I needed shelter and I needed my money and I was so angry that he manipulated me for so many years. I felt brave and wanted to stand up for myself. He assaulted me so badly that he is sitting in the Regional Justice Center with his bail denied, despite his mother trying to get him out and threatening me to drop the charges. After my motel days are up, I have nowhere to go to continue recovering. 


The shelter I was at was only for expecting mothers and mothers with children, which I no longer am. I'm terrified. I don‚Äôt have a car anymore. I don‚Äôt know where my next meal is coming from. I don‚Äôt have family. I haven‚Äôt worked in over 5 years, by choice which doesn‚Äôt entice pity for help locally. Recovering from a traumatic medical procedure. All of this means I can‚Äôt try adopting a child, disqualified, unfit, denied. It would be extremely irresponsible to even try as I'll be rebuilding my life for the next couple years. I have to let the fantasy of motherhood go. 



I know my life isn‚Äôt over, I have a tiny bit of hope that I‚Äôll get back on my feet but having ‚Äúanother‚Äù child just isn‚Äôt going to happen. Pouring my heart out here was more for me than it was for having a bunch of strangers know how big of a failure I am. Again, I know suggestions are coming from the heart, I just can't keep dreaming.

 Tl;dr: Screaming my newfound realizations into existence even if no one cares.

title: Best friend (22f) about to start seeing the guy I've been in love with. Is it immature of me (21f) to want to walk away from this friendship?
body:
She is a 22f, I am a 21f and he is a 25m. 

I met him over a year ago in class. We were friends who I thought were pretty close. We hung out, I knew his friends and have met his family, and knew each other really well. We shared a lot of personal stuff. I considered him to be one of my best friends. I fell in love with him a few months after becoming friends with him. However, I knew he wasn't into me like that, plus I'm working through a lot of issues (PTSD and trying to get a bachelors [also a mental illness, imo]) so i know any serious relationship isn't right for me right now. Fast forward a year. He met my best friend. Had a crush on her instantly. My best friend knows how much I was in love with him. Just every choice she's made since then has been selfish from my eyes. Such as, being all over him in front of me. He cut me out of his life shortly after, completely shocking and devastasting me. He essentially told her (paraphrasing) when they afterward went on a date, "I'm not attracted to her. Never have been. I knew she liked me but i like you so I dropped her. She was trying to make you look bad to win me over anyway, I want to date you."  She seems to be ok with this and is giving him a chance. I am devastated. I don't even know what to feel right now. She says I'm being immature and dramatic and I should just be happy for her. But I'm reeling from the loss of who I thought was one of my best friends-and his false accusations of me. And I'm also feeling shocked and kind of betrayed from her as well. Am i being immature or is this a bad friendship?

Edit:
If this detail matters, she doesn't have a crush or any real interest in him. part of what makes it feel selfish to me. She is moving next year and just wants to have a "fling" relationship in the meantime. She gets plenty of male attention so I feel it's insensitive.

title: Rape in movies
body: I (20F) was raped by my then boyfriend at the age of 16. I don‚Äôt remember everything, but I remember how I felt during the ordeal. How panicked I felt, my heart racing, how I froze on the spot. How disgusting and used I felt afterwards. When a rape scene is shown in movies, it‚Äôs always violent. The rapist pins them down while the victim tries to fight. Watching these scenes makes me feel less than. I wasn‚Äôt pinned down, he wasn‚Äôt violent. I didn‚Äôt fight, I just laid there and let him rape me. I don‚Äôt have horrible nightmares or constant flashbacks like the characters on tv. I feel so invalidated, like what I went through wasn‚Äôt that bad. I hope someone can relate to me. I feel so alone.

title: Why am I a bad person for not wanting to be sexualized for every little tiny thing?
body:
I don't understand why I get so much pushback from other feminists and women about this. 

Every little part of me, every little part of my body, every little interest I have or characteristic I harbor is sexualized in some form. My legs are sexualized, my shoulders, my stomach, my hobbies, my interests, my career. Everything just seen as another porn category or flavor of woman for the men's picking. I can't talk about my interests without "that's so hot" or "men like that". Can't have a career without it being expressed to me how attractive it is to men. Can't have a body without unsolicited comments and leering over just existing. 

And when I express this I always get yelled over about how I'm trying to control people's minds or that I am a puritan or something and it's so tiring. Yeah, I can't control people's thoughts, but how is it not bull crap to anyone else that women can't exist in any way that *isn't* relative to sex. Even if they're "unattractive" everyone focuses on the *absence* of sex appeal. And it is no secret that this incessant sexual ranking of women is used as a means to disrespect them.

I shouldn't have to overhear my male colleagues breaking down the sexual desirability of my female colleagues and talking about them as less-than because of it. I shouldn't have to worry about my voice and skills not ever mattering because people will look at me and only see me as a ranked list of sexual appeal. Its hard to see female political figures and professionals get pornified (even a young girl like Thunberg) as a means to dismiss them as a sex object that can't hold thoughts or power. I shouldn't have to see women get sexualized because men are *angry* at them and want to remind them they're things to be used. I shouldn't have to worry about men taking pictures of me or women I know to "use" later like I'm some species or thing that only exists for them.


It doesn't matter if there's women out there that find empowerment in sexualization. They are allowed to do that voluntarily with their consent. That doesn't mean that every single woman on this Earth should be looked at only through a pornographic lens. It doesn't matter even if these thoughts are kept to themselves if it still means they see women as lesser because they're always reducing them to sex in their heads.  A racist can keep racist thoughts in their head but they're still horrible feelings to harbor and possibly act upon. 

I'm not a bad person for not wanting to constantly be reduced to this in the gaze of men or even women. I don't know why this is controversial even in feminism and it makes me feel like I will never, ever be able to exist as anything other than a *thing* that represents sexual use.

Edit: This got more support than expected, so thank you to those who commented. It really helped my mental health. I felt alone with this concern. Let's all hope we can see the changes we want to be.

title: Friends with sisters, have you ever experienced this?
body:
Sorry for the clickbait title but I couldn‚Äôt find a way to word this experience so that it would fit

I‚Äôve been thinking about some of the guys I have dated or even just talked platonically with in the past and I‚Äôve noticed this weird pattern of them trying to talk about my sister in a weird/sexual manner. For reference my sister is 7 years older than me. Some instances:
- once in college I was telling a friend how my sister is very particular about how we keep the kitchen clean (we used to live together) and I used the word anal to mean that she is very strict about it. My friend said ‚Äúdoes that mean she likes to do anal?‚Äù I asked him to apologize immediately because I thought it was a disgusting thing to say. He refused citing ‚Äúfree speech‚Äù and we ended our friendship then and there
- a guy I was dating recently told me he fantasized about me talking to my sister on the phone while he was f*cking me from the back. I told him to stop immediately, and he apologized (I dumped him later because of this and other reasons)

There‚Äôs other little instances that I‚Äôd rather not relive right now, but these were the major ones that still irk me. Has anyone else experienced this? How do you recover from the uncomfortable feeling?

title: My boyfriend of 7+ years broke up with me. What did I do wrong? How do I handle everything?
body: Very sorry if this is long tried to give as much backstory/detail without being overly detailed. My boyfriend (26 M) and I (26 F) have known each other since we were in 8th grade. I had a crush on him however he wasn‚Äôt ready date. A year later we were freshmen and he was my first kiss when we got to HS. We didn‚Äôt date in HS but we kept contact and I ended up getting into another relationship. Our senior year we decided to do all of the dances together, and went on our first date. At this point I wasn‚Äôt ready to date since I had just gotten out a relationship. However, after senior year we were both ready and We officially begin dating after high school ended. We moved in together October 2023 and I feel that‚Äôs where a lot of our issues began. Within the first 3 months of us living together he began changing and saying the opposite of things we had both been in agreement to prior to moving in together Examples: 1. buying a house, something we had not talked about, and thought was at least a year away conversation, since we had only lived together 3 months. However he went ahead and signed us up for a home buying seminar and took me to it. I had no clue we were signed up until a week before. 2. He then began talking about kids. Throughout the whole relationship I emphasize I didn‚Äôt want to have kids. He even voluntarily suggested him getting a vasectomy within the last year. I didn‚Äôt push him to it or anything and he never brought it up again. But now he was saying he might want kids. Specifically 5. 3. He also began talking about us moving out farther where there‚Äôs a lot of land even thought we both said we wanted to stay in area/surrounding area we grew up in. 4. Purchasing a firearm. He brought it up one night and I said okay let‚Äôs go through gun safety classes, getting a gun license and finding the best fire arm for both of us. When I had to retake the home buying class he went and bought a firearm without the previous agreed upon steps. He texted me‚ÄùI‚Äôm heading to the gun store‚Äù I responded ‚Äúare you looking at guns‚Äù. to his response ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll do that too while I‚Äôm there‚Äù. It just seems that the person I thought I knew I no longer know, we have argued a good bit since living together. My main grievance is that we don‚Äôt spend time together. I go to bed by myself 4/5 nights out of the week. He goes to record podcasts with his friends two nights a week and then works on stuff for his new business in the evening since he works full time during the day. We don‚Äôt go on dates except for specific occasions (Valentine‚Äôs Day & Anniversary). We didn‚Äôt even go out for my birthday this year because I didn‚Äôt want to change dresses- so he cancelled the reservation. Prior to us moving in we spent quality time together and I was pretty happy with the relationship. However even through all of this he still said he wanted to go through premarital counseling and that we need to get married. There were multiple occasions were he said we need to get married within the next two weeks. He emphasized just going to the courthouse to get married. I had no problem going to the courthouse compared to a wedding but why the urgency all of a sudden? He said he didn‚Äôt feel he needed to buy a fancy ring. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever wanted anything to crazy just a ring letting me know he was committed. On Tuesday night my boyfriend broke up with me. He said it was because he needed to work on giving himself self love. I asked him if there was anyone else. He said no. I asked if he saw us getting back together after he worked on self love and he said he didn‚Äôt know what the future held. He then offered for me to have his dog. I told him ‚Äúno that‚Äôs your dog ‚Äú and he said‚Äù I think God wants you to have her‚Äù I said ‚Äú well we have 6 months to figure it out‚Äù since we have six months left on the lease. The rest of that night went great. We got dinner together, did puzzles, played uno, and had sex (I know we shouldn‚Äôt have done that one). I asked him how he felt about the evening and he said he enjoyed it. I asked if the next couple of months went like this would he consider getting back together. He said yes. The next morning I double checked because I didn‚Äôt want him to feel pressured he said he thought it would take more than 2 months, but probably not. I said I understood. The rest of the day we didn‚Äôt speak. The next morning I had a dream about him dating another girl. I asked him again if there was anyone else and he said yes. This crushed me. He then went on to say he hadn‚Äôt had contact with her and he had just been thinking about her a lot. I asked if once he feels okay to be in a relationship with this. Be the first person he reached out to and he said ‚Äúlet‚Äôs say yes‚Äù. I asked where they met and he said back in 2017/2019 at our college however he claims not to have her number. And that she no longer has an Instagram (apparently he tried looking for her recently since they use to follow each other). This crushed me because he‚Äôs saying he‚Äôs been thinking about her for the last month but in the same hand was saying we need to do premarital counseling and get married. It just...

title: I'm afraid of my rapist, I'm sorry I get downvoted on every sub but I REALLY need advice someone help me

title: A gamble paid off for my friend; reported her husband's boss for telling her to keep her voice down
body:
A friend of mine shared this story with me, I got permission to share it here.

My friend and her partner work remotely now due to the pandemic. Previously they were working in-office jobs in their area and own a small 2 bedroom condo. Due to the pandemic they haven't been able to move to a bigger place. My friend works out of the living room. Her husband works in the 2nd bedroom.

A couple weeks ago my friend was on a meeting with some coworkers. At the same time her husband was on a meeting with his boss. The bedroom door was closed, she didn't think anything of it. After work her husband came into the kitchen to talk; apparently his boss could hear her talking and asked if there was a way my friend could keep her voice down, or work elsewhere. When her husband mentioned they haven't been able to find a new place to move due to the pandemic, his boss suggested he should probably move to where their headquarters is located and he'd get the paperwork started. Her husband said he got an email from the boss regarding his relocation to start working in the office.

She and her husband didn't want to move to the city so they took a gamble. An email was sent to the company's HR representative, giving them a blow-by-blow of what happened and the notes her husband took during the meeting. Her husband provided a cost/benefit analysis for the HR rep in regards to them being relocated to their headquarters. They live in a low-cost area, while the headquarters is located in a high-cost living area by a major city. My friend and her husband do not make enough to live in said city, and this fact was pointed out to the rep.

My friend said there was an immediate reply from the HR rep, thanking them for bringing this to their attention, and they would be speaking to said boss that made those comments.

The following week the husband received an apology from the boss regarding his comments, and said he would not ask the husband to relocate to major city. From what my friend shared with me, this man hasn't made any more comments about her voice or the noise in the condo.

She's pretty happy with the outcome, now that she doesn't have to move or worry about some other man's opinions about her voice. Makes me wish I had the ability to be that gutsy, or professionally petty.

title: Mary Kay ripped me off?
body:
Not sure if this is a good place to post this. 1/2 rant, 1/2 advice I guess.
 
Some women from Mary Kay came into my work (a pizza place) a few weeks ago saying they were "empowering women in the community." They gave me and female customers one of those dissolving skin things and ask if they can enter me in a drawing. I should have said no but I'm 18 and dumb and didn't think I'd win so I said ok.

Flash forward a few days and I "won.' I get an enthusiastic text from the lady I saw at my work and she says I have to come to a class to get my gift card. I'm busy and getting ready for college but I reluctantly go to this shady strip mall location and attend the damn class. I have no interest in makeup, and very little in skin care products. I have no money to spend on Mary Kay (why do you think I'm making pizza?!).

The class was two hours (should have been one) of chaos and some embarrassment. There were some other girls there who were actually interested in makeup. I felt the entire time like the women working for Mary Kay were shaming me because of my skin. I don't have perfect skin, but it's a hell of a lot better than it used to be, and I'm allergic to a lot of products so there is only so much I can do. I'd also spent part of the day crying my eyes out for unrelated reasons. The whole time they're recommending the more intense "treatment" stuff for me to sample while telling everyone else, "you have good skin, you don't need to use that." They also spent forever scanning my face with their phones just to tell me I have acne and an uneven skin tone. Thanks.

Finally, the appointment was over, and I was allowed to spend my $25 gift card, which I guess was imaginary bc I never saw a physical card. I "bought" a charcoal mask ($25) and nothing else. I'm told it will be delivered the next day, and here we are ten days later. It's not here. 

I'm pretty pissed. These women manipulated and humiliated me, and I would like to receive the product I was offered. I have texted the woman a few times with no response.

Anyone have a similar experience? As stupid as it sounds, I really want the item I got with my gift card. Even if she's not going to make a buck off of it. I wasted a lot of time that day just for that product, and I feel ripped off. What's worse is I made a DELICIOUS pizza for that woman that day, just because I try to be a good employee and a good person when I wake up in the morning. Why is it that I can do my job without hurting others and she can't? And her job (harassing women) seems a hell of a lot easier than mine. 

Tl;dr: Mary Kay sucks. Don't fall for it.

title: I think he‚Äôs hiding something
body:
Ok so I‚Äôll try cut to the chase. I‚Äôve been with my partner for half a year, he has two kids with his previous partner. Late last year she offered up herself to him, while knowing I was in the picture and according to him he declined. He says that they‚Äôre not really friends and only really talk when it comes about the children. 

When he is at my house, he always goes to the shop‚Ä¶ i perked up because 9 times out of 10 this could be avoided due to us or him being near shops maybe an hour before hand. I never go with him due to anxiety at times, but every time he comes back, he has information about his kids. Which has led me to believe that he has phone calls with her while he is at the shop.

One day, he got here, and within 30 minutes said he needed to go to the shop, I spontaneously said that I will come with, so I got dressed and we went to the shop. On the way back, he received a phone call, from his kids mother‚Ä¶ this strikes me as odd because I don‚Äôt believe in coincidences and thought it was weird because he received a call at a time when he was out and when he knew that I usually would not be with him. 

He NEVER asks me if I want to go shop with him he just says he‚Äôs going to the shop and if I want anything. I know why I mentioned the anxiety beforehand, but he knows that I am trying to get out more and said that he will help with that and we agreed that I should start small. I.e the shop. 

I don‚Äôt know if he is cheating, but this feels like some kind of emotional type cheating or he is trying to not let me see that he is more friendly with her then he let on.

title: Does anyone else hate female friendship?
body:
OK, before you guys call me, pick me, girl, just hear me out alright. I‚Äôm not saying that women are shallow or 2-faced bitches; I just don‚Äôt like female friendships.
¬†
I‚Äôm going to start this by saying I have empathy issues. I‚Äôm not like a heartless #sigmamale Patrick Bateman type, but I just can‚Äôt feel empathy for people. I‚Äôm not an asshole; I try my hardest to be a good person, and I‚Äôm sympathetic to people, but I‚Äôm just not empathetic (it‚Äôs similar but different).¬†
¬†
Female friendships always felt super fake to me. Not because women are fake or something, but because I needed to be fake in them. I didn‚Äôt care about my friends issues, but I was still a shoulder to cry on. I hated going out, mainly because I don‚Äôt like going places with other people, and I am an extremely fast walker, so it always felt like I was being held back by a leash, but I still did it because that‚Äôs what friends do. I held my tongue like a goddamn elementary school teacher even though I wanted to just fucking curse them out because I didn‚Äôt want to start a fight because I knew they would start crying and playing the victim even when they objectively were in the wrong (like, ok, that makes me sound like a dick ¬†but, for example, one of my friends was being really mean to her sister, who was like 4, because she wanted to play with her. I told her that was wrong and that she should really just be nice to her sister and she started playing the victim and talking about how hard it was to have a little sister who was slightly annoying sometimes.)
¬†
I did everything right. I was the perfect friend who was always supportive and kind. And what did it get me? Absolutely nothing at all. They never supported me; they would constantly talk over me, and any time I would confront them, they would tell me that they were very sorry and then go back to doing the same shit. It‚Äôs so draining having to constantly fake your emotions around people, every time I talked to them I felt so exhausted afterwards.
¬†
Every time I was with them, I would envy men. Because their friendships are superficial and shallow, but it seems so much more fulfilling. You could just shoot the shit and have fun, and you wouldn‚Äôt have to be a god damn unpaid therapist for someone.
¬†
I wish I was a guy.

title: I‚Äôm scared of sending the wrong message to an older guy.
body:
I am 20F, during a social event I worked alongside a 30yo guy and some other people as well. He wanted to see the things I made and so he followed my account. I also started chatting to him to ask him for his knowledge on things we both work on, interests we share. Ended up talking late into the evening for many days because neither of us has self control. He reminds me of my big brother and I can totally befriend him. We‚Äôve often joked about how young I still was when he himself wasn‚Äôt much different from now. He seems respectful enough. 

But I am very timid of the possibility of him catching romantic feelings. I want none of that with anyone, I still feel like a child and I have no need to give up any freedoms to go spend time with a boyfriend or even a date. I am as dense as a brick, and totally naive, and I never know if I am secretly missing signs. He is clearly not over his ex at all, and he has also confided in me after a rough day, I felt weird because I am barely more than a teenager and don‚Äôt know him that well.

But I also don‚Äôt want to fuck up a new friendship because of my paranoia. 

And sorry but if a 30 year old would genuinely consider dating someone who was still 19 a month ago, I want nothing to do with them, that‚Äôs super inappropriate.

I don‚Äôt want to speak it into existence. I‚Äôm scared of the idea having to reject a whole ass man, too many horror stories. I would just be passive and ignorant. He doesn‚Äôt mind the idea of going somewhere alone to do our hobby because he‚Äôs a man and I think like DAMN I would never just go off with someone I barely know.

I just really hope he DOES see me as the kid I feel I am. But I am considered beautiful and mature and that‚Äôs why I am always frightened of the possibility. 

He doesn‚Äôt seem to push anything and I do feel comfortable when we actually chat but again, I can‚Äôt be trusted. He‚Äôs also spoken about taking a day trip some time and showing me some stuff related to the hobby we both share (which landed us at the social event), which he also does with other friends. So luckily doesn‚Äôt feel like any real hint.

I hate myself for talking so easily to people, even though I‚Äôve been mostly professional or superficially friendly/casual. i didn‚Äôt tell him anything actually vulnerable or deep about me.

 still idk wtf I have to think or do! I‚Äôm totally paranoid right. It‚Äôs just that guys see me as so approachable and always take their shot‚Ä¶

I bet it‚Äôs just trust issues.

title: Even Female Medical Providers Can Positively Suck at Treating Females
body:
2020 sucked for everyone, but mine started off a bit tougher than most. In January, I had just separated from my husband after an extremely traumatizing end to our relationship.

I was in total survival mode. 

About three weeks after my separation, I had my annual OBGYN exam come up. I was already nervous because my provider knew I was married, so I was expecting her to ask me if I was planning on children in the near future. I did not want to have that conversation because it was so raw, but I was ready for it. 

What I was NOT ready for was for my provider to insist that I begin taking prenatal vitamins even after I clearly stated that I had absolutely no plans to have children. None. Zero. Not happening anytime soon whatsoever. 

Twice, I clearly stated that kids were not a part of my current plan. And twice she told me that ‚Äúaccidents happen so you‚Äôre better off being ready.‚Äù 

I left that appointment and wept because I had never felt less listened to by a medical provider, and never felt that my choices surrounding my own body were respected less than what she had shown. I thought, ‚Äúmaybe I should have told her about my divorce. Maybe this is my fault.‚Äù No. It wasn‚Äôt. Me saying that kids weren‚Äôt in the plan should have been the end of it. No questions asked. 

Looking back, there were some other red flags. She was also the one who asked me why I was using condoms with my husband. When I said ‚Äúbecause I really really don‚Äôt want to get pregnant‚Äù she responded that I really should stop using them. 

This lady seemed to view me as simply an incubator whether I wanted children or not. Needless to say, I did not return to her this year, nor did I start taking prenatal because what the actual fuck. Instead, I take good old Flintstones vitamins because fuck your prenatals.

title: Pap Smear Brought up SA feelings
body: I just had my 1st pap smear. I started crying because I was reminded of how violated I felt when I was sexually assaulted a year ago. I feel really embarrassed for crying so uncontrollably. :( They asked what was wrong and so I told them something happened to me related to consent. They offered comfort but I‚Äôm still embarrassed and just sad about the whole situation. The nurse was sad I didn‚Äôt tell her before the exam began, but I didn‚Äôt think I would be upset. Now I‚Äôm crying in the car while waiting to go get some pok√©. :(

title: My new tubal ligation surgeon is the best doctor I've ever met with
body:
I'm a childfree woman in my mid 20s, and I've wanted a tubal ligation for a while now. Like some of you may have predicted, finding a surgeon willing to do this procedure was difficult for me. The first doctor I met was horrible and rude to me. I don't want to go into too many details because it was a traumatic experience for me, but the doctor basically acted like my only purpose as a woman is to pop out babies for any man who asks me to. I was ever more disappointed because this docotor is a woman and she was even recommended as good for tubal ligations by r/childfree. I'm happy some women had a good experience with her, but my experience was horrible.

Next I scheduled an appointment with a doctor a three-hour drive away from me, because all the closer OBGYNs had months long wait lists.

I was extremely worried going into this appointment, especially because this OBGYN is a man. I really hoped he would be able to help me.

My fears were completely unfounded. The doctor asked me a few simple questions and then scheduled my surgery without ever making me feel dehumanized.

Here are the questions the doctor asked:

He asked if I had considered using other types of birth control. I told him yes but I want tubal ligation because it's permanent and almost never fails.

He told me the "regret rate" for women who get tubal ligations in their 20s is about 30%. He asked me if I was willing to take that risk. I said yes because I am extremely confident I won't regret it.

He told me if I have a long term male partner, we may want to discuss my partner getting a vasectomy instead of me getting a tubal ligation. I told him my partner and I have already discussed it, and we both agree it would be better for me to get the ligation.

And that was it! The doctor said I'm an adult capable of making my own decisions, then he told me the dates he'd be available to perform the surgery.

I almost wanted to give the doctor a hug because he made me feel like an actual human being. He made me feel like an equal. He NEVER asked me about the opinion of a man. He asked me if my partner and I had considered a vasectomy, but he NEVER asked for my partner's "permission" to get the surgery.

 In contrast, the first doctor I saw tried to demand an interview with my partner to ensure he gives "permission" for me to get sterilized. She also tried denying me the surgery because "what if I meet a man who wants me to have kids?" This is despite me telling her I would never date someone who wants kids because that's fundamentally incompatible with the way I want to live my life. Also, I plan to be married to my current partner for the rest of my life.

I'm happy I found a good doctor but I'm disgusted that "the doctor treated me like a human being" is considered a high standard in the medical field.

title: Why do we have periods all our life just so we can get pregnant, so we can ruin our bodies/mental health with delivery/post pregnancy JUST to give them his last name?!?
body:
Someone actually help me out here, because I‚Äôm tripping out. I always said I don‚Äôt want kids, but I entertained a convo with my boyfriend about the prospect. I said, obviously, they would have my last name... and he was was so confused as to why I would think that. 

How the hell did we get the short end of the stick here? I know it‚Äôs just a last name, but I need to know WHY we do all the work just to let them keep his last name. How has this not changed yet, seriously, if there is some obvious reason; please enlighten me

I‚Äôm not even an ‚Äúextreme feminist‚Äù or whatever, but this seems like such a trivial and necessary step towards establishing equal rights... screw all the other bs people complain about in first world countries, this is the shit that needs to change. I‚Äôm so pissed, can we blow this up or something. I feel we deserve this.

Edit: some typos, I‚Äôm just so livid sorry üòÇ

title: My Tinder date said he hopes my dog dies fron carbondioxide poisoning after I had to cancel last minute because there was a massive fire in my apartment building
body:
Im laughing so hard right now. 
You can't make this shit up. My stomach hurts so much from laughing lmao. 

I was supposed to meet a guy for coffee today and while I was getting ready an electrical fire broke out in my downstairs neighbor's apartment. His whole apartment burned out, we all had to evacuate because the entire building filled with smoke and toxic gas

I was literally standing on the side of the road with my dog, wearing a fucking bathrobe and slippers when I texted my date that I wouldn't make it because there was a fire and that I was really sorry to cancel last minute.

I even sent him pictures because I thought that it was just too crazy to believe. I didn't want him to think I made it up to get out of the date last minute. I actually looked forward to it because he seemed like a genuinely nice guy. We didn't talk for long because he suggested a meeting right away which might have been a little suspicious but I had nothing else to do so I thought why not and started getting ready to meet him after just 3 hours of texting. (Don't worry we were gonna meet in a public space, Im not that crazy lol)

Anyways, he got mad, called me 13 times because he had "already arrived at the cafe and now drove all this way for nothing". He literally lives like a 10 min car ride away. I told him off for being angry and said it's not my fault and to stop calling me, that I didn't have time to talk to him right now because I was consoling my neighbor who had a breakdown because his cat had not been found by the firefighters yet. (The cat was found later on and is now in emergency care at the vet)

My dog was shaking really hard because of all the noise and excitement and smoke and my sobbing and screaming neighbor. All of it really traumatized him. That's why when my date suggested to meet up a few hours later I declined with the reason that my dog is super panicked and I didn't want to leave him alone after going thru this scary experience. Also I didn't even know when/if I could even get back into my apartment because it wasn't clear whether they would allow us all back inside.

Well that's when this guy decided it was a good idea to say that he hopes my dog dies from the smoke inhalation because apparently my dogs mental state shouldn't be more important than the dates I set up with humans. I laughed so hard and blocked him everywhere. I still cant believe this all happened today within the last 4 hours but I guess it's good that I have something ridiculous to laugh about that distracts me from this whole disaster because I would probably cry otherwise lol

EDIT: I of course meant carbon monoxide, not dioxide. Lmao I'm sorry for the mistake.

title: After 3 years of blissful peace, I got my reminder that disgusting men are well and around.
body:
Freaking hell. I have been living in a country known to be "safe", and yeah, I've gone home piss drunk, walked around a night alone without looking behind my shoulder, I don't take detours to go home. And I also go running in the evenings along a river that crosses the city, it's so incredibly beautiful there, especially now with the flowering trees.

While I was running tonight with a friend, we passed by a guy wanking with his phone light directed toward his crotch.

I'm. So. Pissed. I can't stop thinking that I should have punched his disgusting face, or brought him to the local police with his pants down. Like, I'm a pretty vocal person, I'm not shy, and I'm at ease being confrontational. I should have done more than just say "disgusting" and continue running. Or I shouldn't have said anything, make him believe we didn't see him. Maybe he got off by the attention. Ffs. 

And now I'm worried. We're both visible minorities in this country, there's lots of rumours that it's sought after by the weirdos here. Never had an issue until a couple of hours ago. But he was clearly waiting for us, stayed close to the path and his body was turned toward us. Does he know we go running there regularly? was it us specifically? will he be here next time?


I'm home now, and I'm in aggression mode, but no direction to give to it. I feel like in a cage, I'm so frustrated. I hope you die you raclure de merde.

title: You don‚Äôt know what that word means.... do you?
body:
Sometimes, the most infuriating kind of sexism is casual sexism. The kind that could almost be construed as a joke, or just a weird comment, but you know deep down that it‚Äôs sexist. 

I used to work at a fairly elite, extremely upper class country club as a waitress. It was sexist in so many ways: the men‚Äôs change room was way nicer, only men were allowed on the board of directors, only men could become ‚Äúfull‚Äù members, etc etc. The male members were also... not very progressive. Lots of old money, old people, old-fashioned ideas. As a young, female server, I had to deal with my fair share of condescension and sexism. This was one of the most frustrating instances. 

It was a fairly slow day so I was able to make conversation with my only table: one older gentleman. Throughout the meal, he asked me odd, prying questions about myself. How old was I? Sixteen. (‚ÄúI would have thought you were twenty for sure, looking like that!‚Äù was his answer.) Did I go to school? Yes, high school. Do I like working here? Obligatory yes. He also asked me what size clothing I wear. Taken aback, I told him small. (I know, I shouldn‚Äôt have told him. I was young and didn‚Äôt know how to deal with guys like that.) 

The worst part was during a quality check. I will be Me and he will be Old Dude (OD). This is our conversation, as best as I can remember. 

Me: how is everything so far?

OD: everything is copacetic!

I was slightly taken aback. Yes, I knew what ‚Äúcopacetic‚Äù meant ‚Äî it‚Äôs basically a fancy way of saying good. However, it‚Äôs not exactly the language of casual conversation. I hadn‚Äôt ever heard someone just casually use it in a sentence before. 

Me: [after a surprised moment] well, that‚Äôs good to hear! I‚Äôll leave you to it. 

OD: Wait. You... don‚Äôt know what that word means, do you?

What is this, a vocabulary lesson? He‚Äôs smiling at me in this leering way. He thinks he has me trapped. He thinks I‚Äôll shamefully admit to him that no, I don‚Äôt know what it means. 

Me: [trying to stay smiling] yes, I do, actually. 

OD: oh YEAH? So tell me, what does it mean?

Me: it, uh, means good. Copacetic means everything is fine. 

OD seems to deflate a little. It‚Äôs clear he‚Äôs EXTREMELY surprised that I knew the answer. 

OD: huh. So you‚Äôve got brains and beauty, what do you know?

Me: I‚Äôll leave you to your meal. 

I quickly walk back into the kitchen, fuming mad.  I know, I just know, that if a male waiter had been serving him, Old Dude wouldn‚Äôt have asked that. His weird condescending test wouldn‚Äôt have happened. He thought, because I was young and a girl, that I wouldn‚Äôt know as much as him. 

He was wrong. I know it‚Äôs a small thing, hardly worth thinking about. But that stupid ‚Äútest‚Äù makes me angry to this day.

title: I bombed my job interview today.
body:
I have a job, I take care of people who can't take care of themselves. Recently they fired all of the staff, leaving two employees - me and another guy. We worked overtime trying to fill the gaps until we got new staff trained. Well, I'm burned out, and decided to try a serving job. I have serving experience. 

So I go in for my interview at a bar/restaurant in my town. It's a cozy place and I really like their brew selection. The general manager is interviewing me, asking me to tell her about myself. I go on, I'm a student, I work full time, I am patient, I can handle stress and I don't take things personally. Blah blah.

She asks me if I have any questions for her. I hadn't thought about it, so I asked menial questions, what is your biggest pet peeve? What do you love employees to do? Why did you choose this line of work?

I wanted to know more about who I would be working for, I asked her if she got a degree for this career, she said she went to school for many years. I asked her what she studied, she said political science. She then abruptly ended the interview. She said "We're done." 

No goodbye, no "we'll call you," just a simple "We're done."

What did I do? I have a feeling she threw my resume away as soon as I walked out the door.

Edit: This was my first job interview in over 2 years, I totally blew it.

Edit 2: I did ask about the job itself. What hours I was available to work, how much we get paid, if there were any benefits.

title: Just a vent... Really kinda mad
body:
Hello , I want to preface this with the fact that my normal massage therapist is a man and he is incredibly kind and listens to me that being said, he is booked up until March because I forgot to do my follow up appointment.

I have large breasts. I wear a high support sports bra everyday. I cannot wear other bras anymore. I have gone to physical therapy to try and fix my posture, but having large breast kinda pulls at everything and it didn't help. Yes, I did all the exercises too. I actually lift and run a lot so I understand the importance of "a body in motion stays in motion." I have been referred to a surgeon for reduction.

Welp, I tried a new massage therapist and honestly, I try to avoid men unless another woman tells me they are good (this is how I found my regular massage therapist). He had a name that could float both ways and so I wasn't completely surprised when a man greeted me. 

I explained that I prefer deep tissue and that if we could work for a majority of time on my neck, shoulders, and back it would really help me with pain management. I explained my experience with massage - I basically go every month and that I get a deep tissue massage. He's like, "I'm more so about total well being. So I'm going to do a full body, but I'll give your shoulders and neck some extra love."

Me- "No. I don't think you understand. This is literally a form of pain management for me and it's important that when I'm really suffering that these knots are worked out otherwise I'm miserable."

Him - "Ok." He then proceeds with his plan anyway. He keeps asking me if the pressure is ok and I say it's fine but he could go a bit deeper and he remarks how tight my muscles are in my traps. Comments on all the knots in my shoulder blade area and that he can feel the tension in my neck. I just respond with a yep. I'm very aware of how it feels. "Does this hurt?" "No. Not at all. You could work in a bit deeper tho if you are able." He does movement work with my fucking legs for some weird reason, but doesn't ask me once to move my arms or hands so he can have better access to my shoulder blades (example - putting your hand behind your back).

Needless to say, I'm still in a lot of pain rn because he did a Swedish massage or some combo, but he threw in a free blah blah blah with my next visit. Sir, there won't be a visit. You suck.
