Ugh. It just sucks because a percussion gun, heat and cold therapy just aren't cutting it right now. Sad day. I just know that in general women massage therapist are better at understanding this problem and that they believe you when you tell them that you have a problem.

title: What are the biggest challenges you have experienced with birth control and access to birth control?
body:
A lot of women in the U.S. and abroad are on birth control - I'm curious what the average experience is for all of us! For me:
 
* As a teen / young adult, I felt I had limited access or even if there were laws in place that would have supported access to it, I was worried about my parents finding out. 
* Since then and starting on the pill and moving onto the nuvaring and then off it again, I feel I still haven't found the "right" birth control for me.
* In dealing with my prescription being successfully being sent to my pharmacy it's really been a hit or miss experience. I understand insurance companies mandating mail-order pharmacies are becoming the norm, but still my experience with their customer service has been hit-or-miss.
* I think the cost of Plan B / emergency contraceptive is really high - seems the price could be prohibitive for a lot of people.

Anyone else have the same challenges? What are yours? Or, if your experience has been awesome, what has made it so great?

title: Advice and Confusion: The Misunderstanding and Disgust I've gotten for being a Little, in a partially Daddy Dom/Little Girl relationship is starting to get to me.
body:
Hello everyone... I've commented here before, but this is the first thread I've made. The name is a pretty good TL;DR of what this is about, but I'm of course going to explain further.

I'm 19 years old, and I'm a part of a Daddy Dom/Little Girl Ageplay relationship. Well, more or less. The relationship switches between that and a Mommy Dom/Little Boy relationship sometimes. Anyhow.
My boyfriend, who from here out shall be referred to as my Poppa, just turned 24 last month, and is the sweetest thing ever. We've been together for what will be two years on Saturday (Valentine's Day, yuck!!) and it's the happiest relationship that I've ever been in.

But like I've said, he's my Poppa. I sometimes call him that in public, I get into my "Little" side a LOT in public as well. I get clingy and cutesy and extremely childish.
Maybe I should explain what exactly a Little is quick, before I go any further, for those who might be confused.
Basically, a Little is someone who is innately childish, and feels as though at least a part of them has never grown up. The age range of Littles varies, though the most common range is between 3 and around 6. Some Littles like to draw, colour, play with toys, and dolls ,sleep with stuffed animals, watch childish cartoons, dress childishly, etc.. Some wear diapers, training pants, drink from bottles, suck on pacifiers, etc. (though as their personalities are older, they are not to be confused with Adult Babies, although there are quite a few who overlap into both).
For some it's sexual, for others it's completely innocent. It can also be related to Ageplay.

Now that my explanation is out of the way, here's where my dilemma and feelings come in. 
While a lot of people I've told about this side of me have been surprisingly supportive (some even going "Oh really, no shit. Kinda figured it out already. :p"), some have been... The exact opposite. While this hasn't happened specifically to me yet, it's happened to a few Little friend of mine... People tend to accuse us of being Pedophiles, of being creepy perverts that get off on hurting children. They don't realize that Littles *are* children. We don't want to hurt them. We want to be them. And no, that doesn't mean that we condone child abuse either. I've heard that before as well. Just because some Littles may be in their Little personas during sexual activities, does ***not*** mean they would ever be okay with anything happening to a real child. We're adults. Inside, we know what we're doing. 
And often, female Littles get accused of all having "Daddy Issues" or wanting to fuck their real fathers, etc. etc.
Also very false.

There's nothing wrong with Poppa and I's relationship. Honestly, I think we're a lot closer than other couples, because we have a different type of bond on top of just our "standard" romantic one. He takes care of me. He cares about me an insane amount, and the smallest things he does make me extremely happy. He can get me to cheer up just by wiggling a plush around in my face. 
I don't understand what's wrong with it.

But other people just don't understand. And the hurtful comments are starting to get to me. I just don't know what to do anymore.

title: All girls school?
body:
So I'm going to an all girls school, and I don't know how to prepare for it. My home school is a really bad school, so that's why I had to end up going to the girls school. The only thing I'm bummed about is that there are no boys. I'm not boy crazy, but I like hanging out with guys because I've been surrounded by guys my whole life.

I also wanted to start dating at around 15 or 16, because I just want to know what it's like having a boyfriend. 

Edit: I know I don't NEED a boyfriend, and I won't be all heartbroken after a break up. I'm not the type to cry or mop around if something sad has happened to me. I just think about it for a few hours, and move on.

title: What the heck is with men who don't know me or my abilities telling me I can't do what I do?
body:
Some context:   
I work in the film industry in an Asian country. I'm a western foreigner, the regional industry is relatively international meaning people often fly around to neighbouring countries to shoot. I built my career from 0 and I suffered a lot to make it happen. I dedicated my entire 20s to learning how to culturally integrate in a foreign country WHILE ALSO climbing the ladder / learning from scratch how to do what I do WHILE ALSO supporting (my now ex) and working to burnout to make it happen - I worked 2 jobs on top of my "career job" in order to build my skills and still bring home enough money to eat. I gained the respect of my team and a lot of people in my industry. I'm trusted and respected and that was all me - I moved here alone with a few hundred dollars in savings and a couch in a sharehouse with 11 people to one bathroom. It was HARD.  


Present day - I am moving to a neighbouring country (sharing many industry contacts, only a 1 hour flight away but a different culture) with my boyfriend who has gotten a job there. I already have the skills I need to work in this new country, and I KNOW that I can do it - there is no reason why I can't learn another language, and work with people from a different culture, I've already done it once and this time I won't also be learning how to do my job at the same time while navigating all of this, I'll have an equal partner who can share the load and a stable housing situation, enough money in the bank to not worry too much about working right away, and the industry is structured the same way as here.    


Scenario 1: I just met a director yesterday and mentioned to him that I'm planning on moving to X country soon - he had known me for all of 10 minutes and flat out said that I should probably change departments because he doesn't think a foreign woman would be able to work in my department (I work with a lot of suppliers who are older men - construction, electrical, manual labour, sometimes a bit traditional but I'm a strong communicator) despite the fact that we were sitting in a production house where nobody speaks English where I had clearly already established myself in a country with LESS foreigners doing what I do. When I politely pushed back on that suggestion (did I just spend 10 years learning my career to change it again?) he doubled down on how I wouldn't be able to work there despite having loads of industry connections already - he didn't ask me any questions about myself or my background before making this huge call about my life and abilities.   


Scenario 2: Another man who I had just met heard me mention that our longterm plan (me and my boyfriend) is to return to my home country in the next 5 years to be closer to my family. He then told me a different version of the same thing: that I wouldn't be able to work in the film industry OF MY OWN COUNTRY IN MY OWN LANGUAGE because it would be too competitive so I should have a backup plan - um, it's competitive sure, but you have never seen my work, and you have never worked with me, so why are you telling me I cannot compete? Also, I've never worked full-time in another industry, does he actually believe it's easier to do a complete pivot in your 30s when you already have a stable career to something completely new?   


Scenario 3: during covid, the various departments in our industry and set some maximum working hours for worker safety (before that there were no protections, you could shoot for 30 hours straight with no break and clients would just pay 1 day rate no OT) it was a big win for all of us. I was quite vocal in these meetings, about how important it is for us to walk off set after X amount of hours to hold productions accountable and NOT take triple OT instead - this is for worker safety not for money. A guy in the meeting who I have never worked with before (French/European) told me he gets it because the reason  we need these new rules is there are more women in my department from before and obviously we can't handle the long working hours like the men can so that's why we have his support.   


These are just recent work related scenarios, but the thing that strikes me is that the men that I work with day to day don't question me at all - they are 100% on my team and respect my leadership. But random ass men I meet on any given day are willing to discount 10 years of hard work to one way or another call me weak or incapable. It is ridiculous and I honestly feel attacked.

title: I think being a woman sucks and we get the short end of the stick a lot/most of the time.
body: We have periods, have to deal with childbirth, men are stronger than us and tasks that I struggle with a man can easily accomplish. We get menopause as we get older which brings a host of issues?! Generally, it‚Äôs more difficult for us to orgasm during sex, we‚Äôre expected to take care of cleaning, most of the childcare falls to us. Disparity in jobs, especially in STEM fields where there aren‚Äôt many of us and dealing with working with male-dominated fields in general. We‚Äôre generally more susceptible and defenseless from assault, abuse, and rape. I‚Äôm sorry but I‚Äôm fed up with being a woman. I wish I could‚Äôve been a man

title: Another day sick of being a woman‚Ä¶ Just had a man stick his head out the car and angrily woof at me like some kind of deranged dog as I walked home from gym
body: Like, cmon. I‚Äôm used to honks and stuff though I don‚Äôt love those either. This was genuinely aggressive, scary, and downright weird. What do they get out of doing this?

title: Fake Hymen Kit...WTF
body:
I was watching an informative TedX talk about hymens and the two presenters mentioned "fake hymens" being sold online. I'd heard of hymen-restoring surgeries but never artificial hymens. I searched and immediately came across this company called "Zarimon." (Though there's many others, apparently?!)

The Zarimon website is a hellscape of "Artificial Hymen Pills" meant to simulate the blood loss that SuPpSsEdLy occurs when a woman has penetrative vaginal intercourse for the first time and "Vaginal Tightening Pills" so that men can't tell it's "not your first time." They give their customers an out by saying they restore your virginity whether you "lost it due to sports or due to sexual activities." They're basically saying virginity = hymen. 

Besides all of the products being based on utter BS, they also have Video Testimonials of women saying "Zarimon worked for me!" The worst part is these women have blocks over their eyes to protect their identities, but these disappear for a split second each time the video switches to a new clip, giving you a full view of everyone's face. 

It makes me so sad that people still have these outrageously inaccurate ideas about women's anatomy and that they place so much of a woman's (or even young girl's) value on if she has a flap of skin and what it happens to look like.

So I'm going to say these things so I can start to feel better:

\-Some people don't have hymens or have hymens that come in shapes/sizes/holes that make it impossible to judge if something has penetrated them

\-Hymens can break due to a number of activities

\-Sex doesn't have to be painful the first time, nor result in blood

\-Virginity is a social construct

And to anyone who is having to resort to using kits like Zarimon's in order to survive in this world...stay safe and I hope your situation changes.

title: A little kindness
body:
I had been having quite the day at work. One particularly mean customer had even called me retarded when I failed to give him his receipt. Another woman yelled in my face and accused me of trying to steal her money after I forgot to use her senior discount.

Needless to say stopping to run a few errands after work, I was feeling pretty low. 

I was going to Ace Hardware when an older, Indian man standing inside held the door open for me. He greeted me so nicely and I tried to smile the best I could. I walked around looking for one of those hair drain catchers but was getting frustrated quickly. The same man asked me if I needed help finding something but I was so near tears at that point (and I hate crying in public) that I just shook my head and wandered away from him. 

My sister called a few minutes later and, after asking what was wrong, I just started crying and let everything out. And mustve mentioned something about not being able to find the hair catcher thing to her. I just was so upset. 

She calmed me down a bit and after 10 minutes on the phone, I concluded they didnt have what i was looking for and started to leave. The man that had greeted me earlier was out front, arranging some gardening equipment. "Have a blessed day, miss," he said as I hurried past.

Then I got to my car and there was a bag hanging on the side mirror. The hair drain catcher was inside with a blank receipt paper that had this note written on it: "You are kind and good and have lots of people who love you. Do not let bad people take that away from you."

If I had cried hard before, I was now crying for a whole nother reason now. I looked up and saw the man cradling an armful of garden statues. He just smiled and waved.

I cannot thank him enough for his kindness and reigniting the strength in me to take my life one day at a time and do the best I can.

A little kindness really does go a long way.

title: Men can't take no for an answer, and sometimes ghosting is the only option.
body:
I often see people complaining about "ghosting" in the dating community. Unfortunately, it is often times NECESSARY for women to ghost men in the dating scene because far too many men can't take no for an answer. I've had to ghost men more times than I'd like to say because after initially telling them I'd like to stop seeing them they would argue with me, try and convince me that I'm making a mistake, or downright verbally abuse me. Why are men like this? Why don't they think no means no? Oh yeah I know why! Because our culture tells them that they get what they want, and that no does not mean no. Lol fuck I'm so fucking angry right now for having to feel like the villain and bad person for ghosting when in reality I'm just trying to protect myself and set up healthy boundaries. I really wish it didn't have to be this way. No means no people! Get it through your heads and stop trying to convince me I want otherwise. FUUUUCKKK 

Rant over I'm sorry.

title: Even masks won't stop the "smile" BS.
body:
This happened the other day and it still pisses me off. I was getting out of the car to do some grocery shopping and the guy next to me asked why I didn't park in a handicap spot (I use a cane/forearm crutch) and I replied that I don't have a placard but I can make it to the electric carts just fine. Then it happened, he said "that's the bad thing with these masks, I can't see the pretty smiles anymore" as I was putting mine on. Y'all, I was tired, my back hurt, and I was fighting a migraine so I just didn't have the energy so I just rolled my eyes a bit and said "well, I rather not die, so?" and walked away.

Also, I'm *loving* the whole masks thing. My allergies aren't as bad, I haven't been sick (other my chronic illnesses) since the first lockdown, and my masks are hella cute. The one I was wearing that day is a mama and baby sloth on a green background, it really makes my green eye pop and is absolutely adorable, I get so many compliments on it! So I'll keep wearing masks even when the pandemic actually over because I already feel like crap 99% of the time, I don't need to add allergies, colds, and the flu on top of it.

title: My ex is refusing to go to therapy because of Andrew Tate
body:
It is so incredibly embarrassing to be hopping onto this train lol. My ex and I had been together for about 3 years. We broke up two months ago because he was struggling with unresolved trauma and self-image issues. He told me he wanted to go to therapy because he disgusted himself and couldn't keep living like this. Well, we broke up so he could focus on healing with the possible prospect of getting back together once he was "complete" again.

Last week he reached out to let me know he was doing better, so I went over to his house and stayed the weekend. He was scrolling through YouTube shorts and *every single* short was some redpilled bullshit like Ben Shapiro and Jordan Peterson. I started a conversation about it because he had never listened to shit like that before. We got into a debate and he shut down because he knew he wasn't getting anywhere. I asked him how therapy was to try and ease the tension when he revealed to me that the gym is his therapy...

He has been going to the gym ever since he was 20. He was going to the gym during our relationship, and it evidently did nothing to help him with his issues. He said Andrew Tate inspired him to believe in himself. I asked him to explain to me how the gym has been helping him resolve his issues, like what steps he's taken in the gym to get better and he couldn't answer me. I snapped at him and told him he had to face his issues at some point, he can't just keep avoiding them to which he started crying and said I was right. I went home because I couldn't stand to be in that kind of environment, and he again has made no effort to start therapy or to stop watching that garbage. I am just... disgusted and heartbroken all over again. Fuck Andrew Tate for preying on vulnerable men and fuck YouTube for pushing redpill garbage.

title: I saw this on tik tok and it just really got to me
body:
'people (men) downplay and dismiss coercion and don't want to admit that coercion is sexual assault because then a lot of men would have to come to terms with and admit to the fact that they have victims/are predators‚Äô

Edit: Coercion is rape. Full stop. No negotiations. No exceptions. Stop invalidating real sexual assault victims. Some of you disgust me. I give up.

title: [Rant/Sigh] Anyone here ever played airsoft before?
body:
I went for the first time yesterday with my friend 'Carl'. He's pretty into it, and he knew most of the guys there and it started off really fun. They break the whole group (roughly 40 people... also, it should be noted that I'm the only girl there) up into two teams, and you're on the same team throughout the day. They play different scenarios with different objectives, and each scenario lasts between 20-40 minutes. I was crawling around in the underbrush and dirt and shooting dudes in the ass with the best of them and having a blast. 

So here's where the rant part starts. As we were standing around getting instructions for the next scenario from the dude who was running everything, he asks for three volunteers from each team. Carl looks at me and says that we're totally volunteering and I'm all right on let's do this. So we step into the clearing. Dude giving instructions looks at me briefly (for the record, I'm 5'10 and 135lbs, but I lift weights and my arms [which were the only part of my body not covered by gear/stuff] are actually pretty impressive, if I do say so myself) then looks at Carl and says "Carl, you probably shouldn't let your wife do this part." Carl looked back at me because he knows me and he knew that this comment would likely not garner a positive response from me. It didn't. Carl looks back at the dude and goes "she's not my wife, man" and I interject with "and why exactly shouldn't I be ALLOWED to do this part?" The dude looks at me, obviously not super comfortable, and says "it's just really hard and you'll be getting shot at a lot." I respond with "And you don't think my delicate, female sensibilities could handle it?" He just sort of says that it's just really hard again but moves on, and I stay exactly where I am and remain with the volunteers. 

That's not all. 

As we (the group of volunteers) make it to the opening where we're supposed to set up for the scenario we notice that there's an extra guy. Carl looks at him and says "hey dude, we've already got our six. what are you doing here?" and I shit you not, the guy responds with "now we have six MEN." I lost. my. shit. I took two steps toward him and said "are you fucking KIDDING ME right now??" and I would likely have said more if Carl hadn't grabbed me and the dude in charge hadn't walked up and started telling us what we were supposed to do. 

So here's the sigh part. 

I feel like I could have had a potentially positive impact on these guys if I had not lost my temper and been able to calmly explain why/how they were being asshats. I'm really annoyed with myself for the way I reacted, and I'm trying to go over how I could have handled it better. I think I was just shocked. 

Thank you for listening. You ladies are the best. 



EDIT- Not sure why downvotes :[. Maybe I'm taking myself too seriously?

title: My father told me to break up with my bf beacuse he has no money
body: So, I'm hanging out with my dad, having a chill conversation about life when he drops this unexpected bomb on me. Out of the blue, he suggests that I should  break up with my boyfriend because he doesn't have much money.  My dad, with all his well-meaning concern, starts outlining a future of potential money woes and stresses about being with someone without a fat bank account.  It's like he's handing out relationship  advice from a financial planner's handbook. Now, I get that he wants what's best for me, but it's a little baffling to hear him equate love with a hefty paycheck. It's not that I don't appreciate financial stability, but isn't there more to a relationship than just the digits in a bank statement? I'm left torn between trying to understand his perspective and defending my partner, who I care about for a million reasons beyond his financial status. Love, as they say, is supposed to conquer all, right?

title: The ONE Minority Whose Rights Have Never Been Considered‚Ä¶
body:
There is a minority on this planet whose rights have always been ignored.  As a matter of fact, it was once considered evil to be a member of this minority.  Members of this minority can be male, female, black, white, etc.

The minority I am referring to is left handed.  We are constantly harassed, laughed at, called ‚Äúbackwards‚Äù.  We are constantly being told we are ‚Äúusing the wrong hand‚Äù.  We are considered ‚Äúawkward‚Äù.  My dad considered me ‚Äústupid‚Äù and ‚Äúunable to function in the normal world‚Äù.  There was a time when schools and parents were actually allowed to force convert their left handed children into right handed people.  Is this not child abuse?

When I was seven years old, my right handed sister couldn‚Äôt stand the fact that her little sister was left handed (different).  She tied my left arm and forced me to do everything right handed.  I became so frustrated, I lashed out at her.  I asked her why she wasn‚Äôt allowing me to be who I was born to be.  This is the same sister who accused me of letting our older brother molest me.

Society has forced us to use our right hands for everyday, mundane tasks.  We get one day a year to try to explain our daily frustrations to the right handed majority.

I apologize for the rant.  I just wish everyone had the right to be who they are without ridicule.

title: My experience with Paragard IUD: Insertion and 6 months later.
body: Because this is the kind of information I wish I'd had going in! Not that I didn't read my fair share of forum posts, but the more there are to read, the better in my opinion. Here's my lengthy experience! Some background: I'm almost 30, I've been on the pill since 14, and I've used so many kinds I can't remember them all. I'm sexually active with my 3+ years boyfriend and have no real interest in having kids at the moment (nor do I have any). I can't afford real health insurance and am being assisted by the state (for which I will be forever grateful, truly). However, the state would only cover the generic birth control pills, and I have had issues with generics and so I preferred my Ortho Tri-Cyclen Lo. The cost was $90 per month and being raised to $120 per month. For reference, that's three times the cost of my phone bill. Yikes. I go to Planned Parenthood for my everything-associated-with-being-a-woman and they suggested I get an IUD (I had started asking whether or not taking hormone pills for 15 years is good for the body. This led to the discussion of Paragard). The state would completely cover the cost of the insertion, and that meant 10 years of not having to pay for birth control. What! Sign me up. So ok. Commence a lengthy period of research about the IUD. I read the pamphlets, I read the reviews online, I read the news articles, I talked to my Nurse Practitioner at PP at least two more times, I had a private conversation with my sister (a Mirena-hater for life, now) and my good friend (a lover of her Paragard IUD). I'm thorough, but once I made my decision I did not look back. It was the right choice for me. I mentally prepared myself as much as I could, because I had read some horror stories, but I tried to remember that people only post online for terrible things, so things are skewed. How bad could it be? I made my appointment for a Friday afternoon because I knew it would take a day or two for recovery. I took 800mg of Motrin, arrived early and listened to my meditation app for a few minutes to quiet myself. I had brought a pad because I knew to expect bleeding (no tampons for the first month, either!). I even brought pop-tarts because I have what is known as vasovagal syncope -- I have been known to completely pass out in situations that my brain finds high-anxiety (for me this is any time my blood is involved [except my period], such as a blood draw at a doctor's office, or if I accidentally cut myself). Sugar helps afterwards. I was taken to one of the clinic rooms and had to undress and put on the gown. People forget that you have to wait in that room and to me the wait is agonizing. When the NP finally came in, with a nurse to assist, I felt a little better. I asked her to please talk to me during the procedure (I wanted the distraction). I really just meant to have a casual conversation about like, the weather, but instead she told me what she was doing every step of the way. I wish I could remember it for you, but, well.. Firstly, yes, I was on my period when I went to have it done. They recommend that so that you're already a little open and it's easiest to get in. So that's a little awkward. They have to use a speculum, of course, which I never find pleasant but am used to from the PAPs. She had to measure my uterus to make sure it would fit (for some, the uterus isn't large enough). That is not a comfortable experience, since something has to be inserted up in there to gauge the length. At this point I remember getting quite light-headed but trying to focus on the conversation I was having with the nurse. I was then told that she was going to insert it, which required (slight) dilation of the cervix. I would love to tell you I handled this with dignity, grace, and composure but that would be a lie. I anticipated pain; I did not anticipate this level of pain (maybe not excruciating, because I endured it, but darn close!) coupled with how uncomfortable it made me feel both physically and mentally (there is something not quite right about things going IN there, as opposed to OUT of it). I remember repeating "I don't feel good, I don't feel good" over and over; I remember the NP asking me to be more specific. "Stay with me, what doesn't feel good?" And then I remember swimming back up to consciousness, finding two women pressing me down to the table with their forearms; apparently, I had passed out and begun seizing on the table. It sounds more traumatic than it was, because I've passed out and seized before. It was just a vasovagal response and I am known to have them. The rest is kind of a blur. The NP informed me that she had just finished inserting it before I passed out, so at least it was in. The nurse was straightening a lamp that I had kicked when I was unconscious, and she was handing me tissues because I was crying (I don't remember having started to cry), I was shaking from cold (my blood pressure dropped), the NP still had to get the speculum out of me (I'm told I was fortunate that I didn't hurt myself!). She had me put my legs back up so she could go in and trim the strings before she could remove it. Bless the NP who kept telling me that I was fine, this was fairly normal, I was just fine, everything was all right, I shouldn't be embarrassed. She left me with...

title: Fix Yourself
body:
Two months ago I learned my fiance had been having an affair. This news came a months after we had lost our puppy.

I was a hot mess and If it wasn't for my dogs I would not have gotten up the next day.

But I did. I got up. I joined a gym. I went hiking. I got my hair done. I took myself and my kindle to the bar. I went on a date to a museum. And by date, I mean it was me, myself and I. 

I did lean on family, friends (chosen family),coworkers and even strangers. I leaned hard.


But I didn't want them to fix this. I wanted to heal and grieve for what I lost and the person and puppy I lost on myself.

I can't say for sure why I felt that way, I just knew I had to do it for myself.

My point here is that whatever you are going through, you can do it. You can get through it and you can do it yourself. Lean on others when you need to and when you can. But don't sell yourself short.  You are amazing and through pain and change comes beauty.

So I did. And while it's only been two months, I can saying doing that, I am happy. I'm grateful for feeling those emotions and that I was able to get myself to genuine laughter and happiness.

I'm grateful it happened because I found my strength.

I still have days where I am very angry with him. But I'm not sad and don't want him back.

title: I‚Äôm male and I was sexually abused by a woman 10 years older than me when I was 16.
body:
This is more a confession maybe.. or vent.. I dunno. 

It was non-contact.. which maybe isn‚Äôt a big deal, but lately I‚Äôve been thinking a lot about it. 
I was at this church retreat thing, and I met a woman who took a liking to me. At the time, I never really noticed that it was anything like that until she later contacted me on Facebook. Anyway long sorry short she began talking to me in a sexually charged way and sent me pictures and things and I reciprocated. Now, I‚Äôve been struggling with porn addiction for a while and even back then, so it never really seemed that bad at the time. Heck, Most guys would high give me or something for that, but in reality it actually added to the severity of it all, that was the first (if you like) sexual experience I had with another person. I realised when I got older the kind of influence she had, when I started to notice that I had that same influence on the younger kids around me at church and similar things, it was then that I started to see how messed up it was to use that influence to pursue a sexual relationship with a child. 

I‚Äôve never really felt the need to report her. She cut things off, which broke me at the time, but she seemed to regret what she did. 

It‚Äôs not something that I ever talk about so I thought I‚Äôd just share.

title: "Flowers" by Miley Cyrus is apparently "woke"
body:
INCOMING VENT: I was at a country bar in Texas and the song Flowers came on. I'm not really a fan of Miley to begin with but I find the song incredibly powerful. For me it's about finding self love, realizing that you will be fine alone, basically you don't need man to be happy. 

Anyway, song comes on and the guy next to me (who is a traditional Latino AKA machismo man; woman belong in the kitchen type shit) immediately says "oh it's that woke song." To which I responded with, "WHAT?!" (Insert hysterical laughing) "This song is wOkE?! Because it's about not needing a man to be happy?!" (Insert more hysterical laughing). He made a disapproving, scrunched face as I very obviously laughed at him in front of his friends. I laughed but I remember feeling kinda angry thinking to myself like wow. Is this what the world has come to. Women can't even be empowered by a song without it being considered woke??? Woman's struggles have been around longer than the term woke has even been said but nice to know it's being lumped in with the "radical liberal agenda". As if it's something so unfathomable. I can't anymore. I can't even date my own race because I gotta deal with some machismo bullshit. I will definitely be buying myself flowers for a very long time. End rant.

title: My sister suffers from self destructive behavior, I have no clue what to do anymore.
body:
I suppose it isn't really a surprise that this happened. Her birth was the perfect recipe for disaster. First off, my baby sister is adopted. One day, her biological mother just came into my mother's office, unceremoniously plopped a baby carrier onto a desk and asked the people there if they wanted a baby. None of them wanted the baby, but then my father walked in, took one look at the baby and decided to bring her home. 

Everyone in the family knew, but I suppose there's some kind of stigma in being adopted (I don't get it myself) somehow somewhere it was decided that we wouldn't tell her. -I suppose that was mistake number one or was it. I have no idea. 

she was a good kid growing up. A little bit of a quick temper but nothing that really stood out. I was around 13 years old and she was 3 when my father left to work overseas (it's been 15 years since I've last seen him) we talk on the phone every few weeks but he's never been much of a talker and never been much for displays of affection.. so I guess she never had a father figure- that probably makes it factor no. 2.. 

then in 6th grade something changed. Suddenly she was cutting school and drinking with older boys. 12... 12 years old... it was such a sudden shift, I didn't know what to make of it. One reason I think (I only learned this years after the fact) was her varsity volleyball coach- who got a little bit handsy. He tried to kiss her and get her to do things.. (I never knew what else happened since she just stopped talking) so this might be factor number 3.

when she was 14 she came out as a bisexual- and our entire family is hardcore catholic... so I guess that's factor number 4

So to recap, she somehow found out she's adopted, then hits puberty, got molested by her volleyball coach, found out she was bisexual- in a family that doesn't really care for it.. poor kid never stood a chance. 

After that (sixth grade), it has been a parade of trouble. Cutting classes, talking back to the teacher. Drinking. petty theft.. in 4 years she's been to 5 different schools in two different cities. She's been cutting herself and often times I've seen her suffer from rage episodes where she just punches herself or the wall.. 

now, I've been advocating counseling/rehab for the past few years now. Trouble is, my mom doesn't want the trouble, my dad doesn't believe in counseling and won't pay for it. That leaves my older sister (who is crazy in love with a guy in new york - nothing else exists outside of her quest to be united with her love) and me (currently jobless, depressed and currently in another city) 

I kind of get how she feels like her druggy friends are the only ones who can understand her, we're in the front page of 'family issues magazine'.. I feel like I'm the only one who cares anymore. Everybody else is treating her like she's a bad person, that she was born that way *whispers 'cause she's adopted'

she's stopped listening to me. She has tuned everybody else out and one of these days, I'm afraid she's going to do something monumentally stupid that could land her in jail or worse in the morgue. 

TL/DR but honestly I have no idea what I'm gonna do. no one else is taking this seriously.

title: I was right about the guy who stalked me on campus, and it only took 2 years and 40+ women to share their same experiences of harassment with him
body:
Sophomore year of college, I had expressed to my professor who was my advisor at the time that I had felt as though I was being stalked. I told him that this student who had nowhere near the same schedule as I did seemed to be following me in between my classes. It made no sense, since I knew this student was in a different college than I was. I mentioned that whenever this guy saw me, he would approach me and try to talk to me. He would get much too close to comfort while talking, and he always gave me the creeps because he would ask personal questions and try to be touchy. I had turned him down before, said no to his requests for my number and I would duck out of whatever building I was in just to escape him before he noticed me because I was so uncomfortable. If he saw me and began pestering me, I would give as little information as possible because I knew if I gave him any information then he would 'coincidentally' turn up near me the next day. I'm pissed because I even had to give up going to the caf√© for a few weeks because of this person. Even months after it subsided I would still scan places for him just in case. 

There was even one time where I was at a party with my friends and he approached me, trying to dance close behind me. My two friends had to force him away from me and stand in front of me because he could not take the hint. They yelled at him over the music to stop, and we decided to leave to another party since he kept lurking around us. Guess what? He followed us there, too. 

So, while telling my advisor about these experiences, he paused for a minute and listened thoughtfully. He told me I could be exaggerating, because sometimes, he said, I overstated my experiences. He asked me if I wanted to take it up with Title IX, and I said no because I had heard it would ding my record, too. I'm on a scholarship and first generation. I wasn't sure how the Title IX office worked, and it didn't seem as though my professor did either. I didn't want to do anything that would flag my dean's attention, especially since it sounded like I was just being paranoid.

Well, today I found out that 6 charges are being pressed against this student because he has verbally, physically and sexually assaulted many females across campus. There are 6 charges, but more than 40 females have shared their stories about times they have made them feel uncomfortable. I had no idea I was not alone in feeling this way. I was right. I was not exaggerating. 

Tonight I want to tell you that if you ever feel uncomfortable, you are not wrong. It is better to be safe than sorry. If someone else tells you that you shouldn't be uncomfortable or that you are unjustified in being uncomfortable, don't listen! You don't owe the person who is making you uncomfortable the time of day, nor do you owe an explanation of why you're uncomfortable to anyone else. It should not have had to take me 2 years and 40+ women with similar stories to feel secure in my own experiences. So double down on how you feel, because you could be right, too.

title: Made an account to submit this story: I was stalked and photographed by a grocery store employee, and did something about it!
body:
I've been a lurker for years, and created an account to share my story. 

I was grocery shopping when I noticed a male employee looking at me.  You know that feeling when you know someone is watching?  I figured whatever, he wants to check me out, that's fine.  I was coming from the gym and had leggings on, maybe my behind is looking extra fab from those squats.  

I wandered from dairy to produce and notice him again, casually moving broccoli from one pile to another, glancing over at me. Maybe he's part of loss prevention and thinks I stole something??   

I end up at the bakery, make a sharp turn and almost ran into the same store employee.  I think to myself, wow, this dude works in many departments.  At this point, I know he's following me and I get that creepy feeling.  I'm done and make my way to the check-out. 

I chose aisle 12.  As I'm placing my items on the belt, I look over and there he is!!  He's shuffling through the chocolate bars at the same checkout I'm at when I notice his cell phone.  He's taking pictures of me!!!  You might be reading this thinking: "so?" "tell him to stop" or "walk away", but anyone who has been in a similar situation knows the feeling.  I suddenly went from a confident strong woman to a small shameful girl.  I wanted to get out of there as soon as possible.  

As I'm packing my groceries I decide, hell no.  I'm not letting this guy win.  How dare he follow me, take pictures of me without my permission and make me doubt my wardrobe choice.  I go to customer service, ask to speak to a manager and described the whole situation.  I was shaking and mumbling but I made it.  I explained that this is absolutely unacceptable and suggested that she review the surveillance videos and have a serious conversation with this employee.  I'm calling the store tomorrow to follow up.

title: Do first relationships always fail?
body:
I'm a late bloomer. I'm 22 and have never kissed anyone let alone be in a relationship. I had never even liked someone romantically up until this year.

There's this guy I really like and things have been feeling more intense this past couple weeks, like he keeps commenting that my clothes suit me. I have literally just been wearing tank tops and shorts, really nothing that notable , so I'm guessing he's just subtly letting me know he's checking me out? But honestly I've no idea, no guy has ever paid any attention to me.

Also he definitely knows that I like him. He'll make comments like "try not to miss me too much" when he has to leave the office. 

And seems to be trying to find any excuse for physical contact. Like the other day my leg was bouncing non stop and he jokingly said "im just gonna hold your leg down in a minute" . I thought he was kidding but then about an hour later when my leg still hadn't stopped he was like "right put your leg down cos I know it's annoying you to". So I did and I thought he was just gonna rest his arms on it as he continued to type but instead he rested one arm but was fully holding my ankle with the other.

So I feel like we are (or atleast i am) dancing around things and if/when the inevitable happens I don't know what to do.

I really like him, a lot, but he would be my first relationship. And I don't know anyone who ends up staying with their first partner. And I know its stupid but I kinda don't wanna waste it

title: Once a cheater, always a cheater?
body:
If a guy has cheated in a previous relationship multiple times (according to him bc he found out she was cheating), does that mean he will cheat on his current relationship? 

I have always thought "once a cheater, always a cheater" but this situation is different.

I can't seem to get over it because I never cheated even when I was cheated on (past relationship)

I appreciate his honesty which is why I want to fight for this relationship. However I can't get over what he did nor do I know how to alleviate my anxiety from it.

title: I had a mild anxiety attack today when my acquaintance's very public Costco marriage proposal reminded me of my own experience. Can we please normalize joint decision making when it comes to marriage?
body: This man had planned a secret proposal in a Costco, with their friends and family surprising the bride and it was captured on video and posted to Facebook with a very long description of his thoughts and feelings leading up to the event. I could not help but feel sorry for her - not because I thought she was unhappy, I don't know her at all and she seemed happy. But because it reminded me of my own proposal by my now ex-husband. He knew I was afraid of video cameras, he and I had never once discussed marriage, and I was not expecting it at all. He made a huge scene in front of our 80 person work crew and it was all filmed by a professional videographer. I could hardly breathe, I was uncomfortable the whole time, and I chalked that up to my fears. But it wasn't that..  I just didn't want to marry him. This experience proved to me that he really didn't know who I was, or didn't care because he wanted the attention.  But I said yes and went through with it anyway, because I didn't want to break up either. I was put on the spot. And once I matured and realized we weren't a good match it was years later. I know that some women would love this, the romance, the surprise. But all I see based on my experience is narcissism and poor communication. /endrant

title: People judge moms drinking too harshly
body:
I was out eating at a nice restaurant today with my wife. We had our three month old son with us. This has been the first time in a while that we‚Äôve been able to get out because we‚Äôve been so busy with work and kids.  We both decided to get a drink and the table across from us wouldn‚Äôt stop staring. The husband at the table nudged his wife and pointed at our drinks and she rolled her eyes and shook her head disapprovingly. The wife later told us we should be ashamed of drinking while we were watching a child. I didn‚Äôt say anything to her because she was leaving and her kids were there and I didn‚Äôt want to start a scene. I just couldn‚Äôt believe it. There was a table behind us. There was a single dad and a toddler. She never cared to say anything to him and he had three empty tall glasses. My wife and I only had one drink each!

 This isn‚Äôt the first time something like this has happened either (though not quite so extreme). My brother has a young baby too and he‚Äôs never experienced judgement like this before. I feel like because I‚Äôm a mom and a woman I‚Äôm treated like I‚Äôm irresponsible and can‚Äôt handle it.

title: Saved by a drunk guy
body: Couple weeks ago, I was out of town in a city on the west coast because my mom was having surgery and an extended hospitalization. I was staying alone at a hotel, being with her by day but having a real bed and shower for nights. I'm also a disgusting smoker. I had a customary spot on a well lit bench in a nearby busy park where I would smoke and unwind from the day. A slightly disheveled guy would walk by and bum a cigarette from me for the previous couple nights, say thanks and move on. One night I was sitting there and I heard someone singing "Riding Dirty" at the top of their lungs. Quickly, the singing turned into obscenities and saying "Fuck you Ni*****" repeatedly and other exclamations of the same sentiment. Being a small town girl, immediate reaction was to just sit still and not draw attention by getting up and moving away. Luckily for me, the friendly guy came walking up moments later, asked for another cigarette and hung out with me for a few minutes til angry guy left. He was like "Gotta watch out for those tweakers man. I'm just a drunk, collecting cans to buy booze." I was so grateful! And i've found a new spot to spend my time, while i'm stuck in this damn city AGAIN a month later. Thank goodness for harmless drunks.

title: My grandpa, who sexually assaulted my mom, died this weekend. I don't know how to feel.
body:
I'm not sure if I'm looking for advice. Or just to get this all out. Either way, thanks for listening. I hope this is an appropriate sub for this. I wasn't sure where else to go.

I've been no contact with my grandpa for over 5 years. We found out about a horrible gambling addiction he had for many years and, even after the family found out, he outright refused our help and refused to seek help on his own. Shortly after that, my mom revealed that he had sexually assaulted her as a teenager. It was at that point that nearly the entire family went no contact.

My mom called me this weekend to tell me that he died. All alone. He's apparently been in and out of hospital since August and asked that none of the family know about it. It sounds like the reasons he was in hospital were because he was neglecting his own health. Part of me wonders if he just wanted to die and chose to do it alone.

I haven't thought about him much since I went NC, but hearing this news has caused a whole flood of emotions. Anger about what he did to my mom and my family. More anger and confusion directed at my mom because she would let me sleep over at my grandparents' when I was a kid, when no one knew about the sexual assault except her. Did she not think that he might do something to me too? Nothing ever did happen, but I can't help but wonder what she thought about when saying yes to my brother and I having sleepovers at my grandparents' house.

And most of all, I can't shake this feeling of sadness. The sadness that I've lost my grandpa. Because even though he fucked up. Bad. I still had nearly 20 years with him as my grandpa. He never did anything to harm me personally. And I just can't shake the thought of him dying in a hospital bed all by himself. Maybe be wanted it that way. But I can't help but feel so horrible because I don't feel like anyone should die completely alone like that.

I can't make sense of my feelings. Do I miss him? Do I regret not seeing him all these years? Or am I just still so angry for everything he did and I've just buried it all these years? I just don't know how to feel right now.

Thanks for listening.

title: Why do I keep being lead on?
body:
A few months ago, I (f23) met this guy off a dating app. We texted for a while, very casually, before we actually met. I wasn‚Äôt so sure I was into him at the time.

Anyway, fast forward a month later and he asks me out so we finally meet. We had a great time. We went for dinner and I dropped him home afterwards, and we kept on talking and meeting up as time went by. I made it very clear that I was looking for something serious and didn‚Äôt just sleep around and he agreed.

After about two weeks of casual dates, he invites me to his place where one thing led to another etc and we finally sleep together for the first time. At this point everything was still fine and I was seeing him regularly, but I noticed he stopped asking me to go out on dates and just wanted me to come over and sleep with him all the time.

We had a fight about a month into dating (it was getting a little serious with us) because he cancelled on me again after he asked me to plan a night out. At that point (he had lied to me), I decided to delete his number and forget about it, which I did, and so we didn‚Äôt speak until around two weeks/10 days later. He reached back out to me BY SENDING ME A TIKTOK. Eventually we start talking again.

He didn‚Äôt understand why I was angry, said he really liked me and wanted to talk about things, that he missed me and deleted dating apps etc‚Ä¶ so I went over to his house to see him. We had a conversation and made up but then I asked a question that, in hindsight I should not have asked; if he had slept with anyone while we were not talking and he said yes. I was a bit annoyed at that (I appreciate I was in the wrong here because we weren‚Äôt talking) but we had another argument again about it, because he thought I was joking around about being annoyed and was surprised I didn‚Äôt sleep with anyone.

Anyway, this argument resulted in him saying he didn‚Äôt know what he wanted and that it was too fresh between us, fair enough. I decided I needed time to think about whether or not this was worth pursuing as I already felt like I went too far with him. So I started avoiding him and he went on a two week trip abroad.

While he was abroad, I asked him not to message me. I explained that if he wanted to go abroad and sleep with other women etc, it would be fine as we weren‚Äôt dating but I didn‚Äôt want him to call or text me during this time because I knew I would get hurt if I found out he did sleep with people later down the line.

He said no worries, I‚Äôll message you when I am back which I was fine with. At this point I was withdrawing myself from the situation anyway because I felt like he was using me. But a week before he actually came back he started messaging me again, more regularly than before, responding to me quickly and asking about me etc. i thought maybe he was finally taking me seriously and got very excited for him to come back. A day before he comes back he asks me to go see him over the weekend.

All of a sudden, after having texted me just a few hours before that he landed, goodnight and see you soon etc, he sends me a paragraph saying he isn‚Äôt looking for anything serious and sorry if he has lead me on, that he has a lot of work to do on himself.

I‚Äôm not stupid and i have had this from men before. A lot of them try to get me emotionally invested to sleep with me, and then throw me away.

I‚Äôm just confused why, after I asked him to leave me alone twice, he kept prying to come back only to decide he didn‚Äôt really want me. And i am so embarrassed, at how excited i was to see him.

Am I the problem? Why does this keep happening to me?

title: Period advice
body: I‚Äôm a trans guy and I haven‚Äôt had a period in a while (and in total I‚Äôve had like... 6? I went on birth control very early) but for whatever reason my body decided now was the time to have one again. I reallyyyy don‚Äôt like tampons just cause of personal preference but I‚Äôm having trouble making pads stay in place. I feel like every time I sit down it scrunches up and becomes useless. The wing flap things don‚Äôt seem to be working too well and I‚Äôm not sure what I can do? Just sit carefully? Any advice on picking specific brands that might be sturdier? Sorry if this question is kind of stupid, just wanted to know :)

title: How do I respond when my son's friends hit on me?
body: My oldest kid is in middle school and his social group is expanding. Recently I've been noticing some of his friends hanging out near me/near my car longer and talking to me when it didn't seem necessary. A couple weeks ago one of them apparently told my son they wanted my number, to which I laughed and told my son I would never give my number to a child and that their parents could contact me if necessary. I didn't think much of it after that but yesterday when I was picking up my son after his chess club one of the boys (around 12-13 years old) kept standing near the car and talking to us and making comments like "I should be sitting in the passenger seat", "I'll jump in and come home with you guys." My son was talking to another kid so we weren't really giving that boy any response. Then he actually leaned in my car window and brazenly asked, "So, you got a husband?" I was thrown off and kind of laughed dismissively, I think I said something like, "not anymore, kid", (which is true, I'm divorced) but it made me uncomfortably realize that I should have a plan  in place if it happens again. I don't want to embarrass my son and obviously it's inappropriate for a young boy to make comments like that, but they're only going to get older and I need to be able to nip it in the bud immediately. Do I take on a sharp tone and tell them harshly "that is inappropriate", or keep it lighter but firm? Again, I don't want to embarrass my son, he's struggled with being shy for a long time and he worked hard to get where he is now with socializing. Women who have been in my shoes, how did you handle it?

title: Does anyone else have extremely stretchy chest skin?
body:
I have Joint Hypermobility Syndrome, and I have extremely stretchy chest skin. I find it quite amusing to play with and I didn't feel shame over my chest, until today. I also have mildly stretchy skin on my arms, thighs and hands. In a hDES and Joint Hypermobility thread about stretchy skin, I posted a clip of me stretching out my chest skin. I didn't say anything more than "I have joint hypermobility syndrome, and my skin stretches [insert the rest of what I said above]". Nothing more. I did not say that it's gross, bad, or otherwise displeasing. I literally just explained my diagnosis and my stretchy chest skin clip, which was all of a few seconds long.


Someone replied to me, asking if it was my chest. I said yes. They told me I'm "so cringe and I'm not one for body shaming but this made me so uncomfortable", and that having extremely stretchy skin (I'm talking being able to pull the skin 4-5 inches away from my body) is normal, and that I am... shaming people, by showing that my chest skin is stretchy, for assuming that it may be EDS related?


I had a delightfully abusive mother and was never able to ask  questions about bodies growing up. I thought my ability to wrap my finger in skin was not the norm. No doctor has ever told me that it IS normal for me to be able to do so, and I have no baseline on what constitutes as 'normal chest skin'. 


Hence my question - is extremely stretchy skin normal on the chest? Do others have it? Is it something I'm meant to be ashamed of and never speak about? :|

title: Ex is indirectly putting pressure on me to have him back
body:
For background, I have three children, aged between 2 and 14 and several months ago their father stormed out after an argument (over money) and contacted me asking for some of his things, his passport, paperwork, clothes etc. So I packed everything up and left it in my outbuilding for him to collect.

He got very angry about all his stuff being packed up and indicated that he hadn't really intended to leave for good, just for a week or so to calm down. This is something he had done previously (his parents had an empty apartment he was able to use) so I knew that had probably been his intention but I had had enough with the relationship. He hasn't earned any sort of income for a decade, so money was tight. He is very critical of my parenting but hardly did a thing to help with the kids or around the house and constantly wanted money. He is a great cook so would help with meals, but only if he had the exact ingredients he wanted, often these were very expensive.

The final straw really was that he became convinced I was having an affair when I was at work (I work from home) and would come and sit behind me while I tried to work, staring at the computer screen and talking constantly. It was incredibly difficult to work like this.

I definitely have my faults too and I put up with a lot of this because I assumed I was equally annoying or inconsiderate and that we have to make concessions, but being accuse of cheating was the end for me. And since he left, life has been a lot easier - even with three kids. I don't feel anxious all the time.

Problem is, now he cannot stay in the apartment anymore and while he actually has the option of a free flat with some work attached, he doesn't like the location - it's 15 km from us which he thinks is 'too far'. He's dropping hints about moving in again and using the kids as a reason. He says they have suffered with him gone and I am bringing them up very badly, with too little discipline. I really don't want him back at all but I am wondering whether this is a selfish perspective and whether it would be better to tolerate his behaviour in order to let the kids grow up with two parents. (The oldest child says they don't want him back at all, the other two are too young to ask, really).

I know he will struggle on his own, but I also feel he had several months to find work/accommodation and so he doesn't \*have\* to be homeless... but suspect he could end up that way.. He is very proud and has been out of work for so long because no job is good enough. He also won\\t claim benefits because he is too proud to do so

I currently feel under constant pressure to offer him a place to stay. I feel like not to could be a selfish decision and could adversely impact him, but I am really much happier without him. The guilt is horrible.

title: Hi TwoX, I've been afraid to post here for a while.
body:
'ello readers.  I've been around here a lot of times, but I've never actually had the guts to post.  I've been subscribed for ages but again, just afraid.  You guys seems so awesome that I decided to finally brave up.  So I'll get to what I'm beating around about.  So, I'm trans, and I'm wondering how well I'd fit in around here..  I posted in a different place and I said I was still a girl in learning, and someone replied with there is always learning.  So maybe I'll never truly figure it out and just have to go forward.  But I'm rambling, and I'm just wondering aloud, is there a place for me here?  God, what a bad post.

edit: so many downvoted comments :( - but so many awesome people :)

title: Weight gain on birth control
body:
I was wondering if any of you have experienced this or have some advice. Every time I switch birth control I've gained about 15-20 pounds in a few months and have a very very difficult time losing that weight. First I tried multiple types of pills but I forgot to take those often. 

About ten months ago I switched to Nexaplon, which is the little implant that goes in your arm and lasts for three years. I've had no bad side effects like I used to get (I.e. Migraines, mood swings, loss of libido) except I gained 20 pounds again! This is such a hard thing for me because I really struggle with body image issues and now I'm 180 ponds with a frame that is at a healthy weight around 135-140. 

Since starting birth control almost four years ago I've been at least 150 pounds. Basically I'm wondering if any of you have experienced a similar issue and if you have any suggestions for how to combat this side effect. Any help is appreciated!

title: Friend's rant about abortion has confused me
body:
Had a long overdue phone chat with a girlfriend I've known for 10+ years and whom I don't see very often. One of the topics that came up was abortion, since we were talking about politics and how the Liberal Party of Canada has a policy that all of their candidates must be pro-choice. I consider myself pro-choice. She said some confusing and upsetting things about how she can no longer consider herself pro-choice because that equates to pro-abortion. Her comments honestly did make me think and I would like to do more reading on the matter but am nervous about what kind of google worm hole I'd end up in by googling abortion rights. Does anyone have reliable sources or even personal experiences they are willing to share? I wanted to refute a lot of her points but chose to say nothing at all because I didn't want to argue when I don't consider myself well read on the subject.

Some of the things she said was:
* All women feel terrible after an abortion, I know because all the women I've worked with (as a social worker) who have had an abortion regret it terribly and have depression around it.
* The morning after pill should not be advertised at our former college campus because it IS abortion
* An abortion is a serious medical procedure and regardless of ethics, it can totally mess up your internal organs and shouldn't be thought of as a simple, in and out procedure. It is invasive. 
* Abortion is frequently used as birth control in Canada, as it is free
* It is offered way too quickly to anyone considering it and can be performed on under age girls without parent consent 
* Planned parenthood goes to poor foreign countries to sterilize women

title: I just got my first pap and it hurt so much I cried üëå
body:
I expected discomfort but not that much pain. I had to tell the Dr. to stop when she first started as it hurt so much. She asked if she could try again and I was like nopeeeee. I was all shaky n started crying. I eventually calmed down tho  and she managed to try again.  

I'm 25 and a virgin so I'm wondering if that could be part of the reason it hurt so much. I don't really ever stick anything up there either, not even tampons lol. 

Anyways I feel really silly for crying at the doctors üôÉ  Have any of you had a bad experience?

title: My bf of 8 years cheated on me out of the blue. How do I get over it?
body:
I really need help I don't know what to do with myself ):


We moved in 7 months ago and I found out last week that he had been cheating on me with a girl from work for the past few weeks. I kicked him out of the house and told him I don't want to see him again. He has been lying to both of us about it, I don't even know if he was ever going to tell me.


Anyway I'm heartbroken and single for the first time ever. How do I start to get over it? I've never had to get over someone before. I know he is a horrible coward and I deserve better but I miss him. It's such a frustrating feeling.


Any tips would be appreciated <3

title: Coworker: "SMILE!!!" Comebacks???
body:
Title pretty much covers it. 

A coworker told me the other day "Smile!!!!!!" as I am literally running my ass off to get my job done. Yes, LITERALLY. (After my 8 hour shift I weighed myself and had lost 5 pounds.)
I am 25/yo female, coworker is admittedly a nice, mellow guy around 50yo; however, I was highly annoyed by his comment.

 I'm not here to look pretty. 

I'm doing my fucking job and I don't have to smile if I dont want to, and I sure as shit dont have to smile for YOU. 


I need some good comebacks for this comment. They can be anything!!!


Mt comeback was: 'YOU SMILE." He laughed and said "I am!" So I replied "Great then you can go do your job because obviously I'm busy doing mine."


Any suggestions?

title: I need a little advice and a realistic perspective
body:
Hey, this is a throwaway because I might sound a little entitled and I don't want this to get back to my partner.

I am a 27 year old female and I've been seeing this guy for under two years. Things are great in the relationship when we are together and I don't have any complaints other than this one.

My bf is my age and is very money driven. He was fairly aggressive financially when he was younger, and made quite a bit. He's an engineer and has his own company, but he subcontracts himself to a large company and he is also one of the owners (or partners as they call it). He is by far more successful than any of his partners/friends (he only really interracts with the partners and considers them friends), because he is very frugal. He has an amazing place, everything in his penthouse is gorgeous. Other than that he appears very average. He is very physically fit and healthy, but he lives well below his means. He only has a few business suits (for meetings), but he dresses average. He drives a baseline used ford car, and he has a base ford truck (when he goes to the rigs to consult). He rarely spends money on anything, and never goes on trips. he pays himself (under his own personal name) once a year on Dec 21st for $41000 and that's it.

The above was to just give you a feel for him. My issue is that all his friends spoil their gf's or mistresses and they live large. They drive Audi's and go travelling and do amazing things. He doesn't do much of that. He takes me on the odd weekend trip here and there and pays for everything but it's never expensive. I asked him about marriage and he said he has no intention of ever getting married, because he wants no external factors affecting his financial progression. I've also asked about moving in together and he is against that either. He's told me many times that I have nothing to fear because he would never cheat or abandon me, and I believe him. He doesn't interract with people unless he knows money can be made, so I know he won't cheat because his time could be better used to make money. He's told me many times that the relationship will progress when I figure out what my goals are in life and when I start working towards them. I don't really know what he expects of me in that regard. 

Am I shallow for wanting to recieve gifts once in a while? I don't necessarily need an Audi, but my car is crappy and he could definitely help me out with a new one but he refuses. His friends all shower their women with gifts and vacations and I don't get any of those perks. His friends are also not faithful and there are other issues there I guess. Does anyone feel the same way? Is it wrong that I think this? Please give me some advice, because I don't know if I should just appreciate what I have and stay with him.

title: Can you become asexual rather than being born that way?
body: Hello, I‚Äôm in my mid twenties now and haven‚Äôt felt horny in probably around 5 years. I remember the feeling; I have tons of sex toy etc from when I used to get the urge, and have had partners in the past. I can‚Äôt remember the last time I even masturbated now and honestly I can‚Äôt think of anything worse. It makes me kind of feel like a broken human. Anyway, just wondering if this means I‚Äôve truly become asexual/if this is possible? Just for some context I did onlyfans for many years and have been accustomed to the most repulsive horny men which I think has massively fed into how I feel now. It‚Äôs like anything sexual directed towards me is the biggest turn off imaginable.

title: IUD owners ‚Äî do you also get sad or disappointed by not being able to get pregnant?
body:
I obviously have an IUD to prevent getting pregnant, however, every single month before and/on my period, I go through this emotional rollercoaster due to not being pregnant. I think this is due to the fact that I don‚Äôt have to do anything to prevent getting pregnant. I don‚Äôt have to take pills or buy condoms. I just have this device in me that I don‚Äôt even pay attention to 80% of the time. In addition, since my partner ejaculates in me (I mean, that is one of the perks of having an IUD), it makes me feel like a failure for not getting pregnant, even though it‚Äôs not me, it‚Äôs the IUD that I got EXACTLY to prevent pregnancy. Am I crazy for feeling this way every month? I always wanted to have children, however, I‚Äôm still in school therefore I have to wait at least 2 more years until my partner an I could actually try for a baby. 

Am I the only one who goes through this? I feel absolutely insane.

Hey so i just wanted some advice on how to make friends as an adult . I'm 23 and have lived in the same state my whole life, I'm moving to Iowa in the fall for a job, and I'm really nervous about making friends- or trying to.

title: Should I report my hs bus driver for saying creepy and possibly sexual things to my friend and us?
body:
Throwaway for reasons,

title: How do you deal with your SO's "number"?
body:

Have you guys ran into this issue and how did you deal with it? Any advice would be greatly appreciated!

title: Serious Roommate Issues. :/ Advice?
body:
Hey 2X, sorry in advance for the wall of text. 

Everything started fine with my roommate, but after the Christmas break things are just slowly turning to complete crap. There are a lot of "negatives" about my roommate that I've just accepted as stuff people sharing a living space have to go through.

She refuses to clean anything that isn't her bedroom. So she's never swept, moped, cleaned the kitchen, cleaned the toilet/shower/bathroom, does dishes that she isn't sure she actually touched, she doesn't even throw away her food that's clearly rotting or regularly take out the trash. Anyway, we've had some conversations about it, but I just gave it up as a lost cause.

Fast forward to now, she sends me a message the other day that's "Hey, I'm subleasing my room this summer." I'm surprised and ask to who, and she says she doesn't know, she'll just post an add on Craigslist. Oh.. okay. An ad only for girls, right? No, that'll "cut her potential occupant pool in half". Which statistically I get, but I'M the one that's expected to live with a stranger, and you won't even give me a say as to who that stranger is? I mean my bedroom door doesn't even lock. I also have a cat, so I'd appreciate her including "pet friendly" in her ad.

I'm trying to figure out what the policy is with my apartment about subleasing to see if my consent is necessary. But I'm hesitant to say anything because my boyfriend's been staying with us for a couple weeks since he had a period between his lease ending and his new one starting. She agreed to this, and he's helping with bills for this time period. We almost exclusively stay in my bedroom and he's out of the apartment for work before she even gets up. I feel like arguing with her about a subleaser will result in her saying my boyfriend can't stay. I also have this irrational fear that upsetting her will result in her treating my cat badly. Or that the stranger subleaser will treat him badly.

So should I stick out the few weeks with him here and start the conversation when he's moved into his new place? I feel like I already tried to talk to her about my preferences in this situation and she dismissed them because in her mind it's "her room" which is true but I'm living here too and there's supposed to be trust between roommates.

title: I‚Äôm tired of the false equivalencies being made by conservatives right now between abortion rights and vaccines.
body:
Just posting here because I‚Äôm fired up and looking for some support. I posted the below as a response to someone trying explain the anti vaccination movement‚Äôs bodily autonomy argument by pointing out that anti-choice advocates believe fetus‚Äôs are people. Their argument was that anti-choice advocates believe the fetus‚Äôs right to life supersedes a woman‚Äôs right to choose.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not that they believe a fetus‚Äôs right to be alive supersedes the mother‚Äôs wishes, it‚Äôs that they believe the fetus‚Äôs right to be alive, before it has a heart mind you, supersedes the mother‚Äôs right to be alive. They believe that a pregnant woman is obligated to sacrifice her body and life for the potential of life, no mater what the consequences might be for her. If this were not true, they would have exceptions for things like rape, incest, viability and potential risk to the mother. 

The United States has one of the highest maternal mortality rates in the developed world, and it‚Äôs disproportionately higher for woman of color and women who live in poverty, the same people who will be disproportionately burdened by this law. 

Here is a real life example for you. My sister and her husband had been trying to get pregnant for 8 months and they finally conceived, yay! She took pregnancy tests constantly, basal temps, the whole thing. She is very well researched and careful. She found out she was pregnant at 4 weeks (like the earliest it‚Äôs possible to find out), but couldn‚Äôt get in to see a Dr until 6 weeks. Because her pregnancy is considered a geriatric pregnancy, her Dr recommend that she get all of the chromosomal tests. (Mind you, we‚Äôre already past the 6 week cut off Texas is imposing but bear with me.) She scheduled the earliest possible appointment she could (she is extremely proactive and diligent) and waited for the results. Well, the lab lost her samples, so she had to go get tested again. She got the results yesterday. She is now 15 weeks. She found out she‚Äôs a carrier for a chromosomal disease that if passed on would give the potential baby a max life expectancy of 2 years. So now her husband has to get tested (you need to get the gene from both parents because it‚Äôs recessive) but he can‚Äôt get in until Monday. Then, it takes 2-3 weeks for the test results to come back. THEN, if he ends up being a carrier (ü§ûüèΩ that he doesn‚Äôt obviously, and it is unlikely so there‚Äôs that) they would have to do more extensive testing to determine the viability of the fetus. So now we‚Äôre talking like 20 plus weeks. 

This better not fucking happen because everyone involved would be devistated, but if it turns out that my sister‚Äôs fetus is not viable or the child won‚Äôt live past the age of 2, she may not want to go through the pain of child birth just to turn around and go through the pain of loosing a child. I wouldn‚Äôt wish that fate on my worst, anti-choice enemy, and I am hoping with everything I have that my sister will not have to make that choice either.

This kind of stuff is so common. This isn‚Äôt a unique story. These are the real choices that woman are making. Abortion is complicated and personal and something we all hope we‚Äôll never have to think about. 
Someone who thinks a rapist‚Äôs 6 week old fetus is more valuable than the rape victim‚Äôs life doesn‚Äôt value life. Someone who thinks a woman should be forced to carry a beloved and wanted, yet unviable fetus to term, go through often dangerous and traumatic labor, only to then watch their child suffer and ultimately die does not value life. And furthermore, someone who refuses to protect themselves, their family, and their community from a deadly virus that has killed 658k Americans, devastated families, and forever altered all of our lives because the don‚Äôt want to get a safe, convenient, and free vaccine for no other reason than it ‚Äúbeing their right‚Äù does not value life. 

Sorry for the rant. I have feelings today.‚Äù
