title: Is there a place for men in feminism, and if so, what is it?
body:
I am a guy looking to understand what my place is in feminism (if there is one) and how I can help. 

I was confounded earlier this week by the controversy surrounded the discussion over the ESA scientist's shirt. I witnessed arguments on both sides, from people say it's just a shirt, that the fight over it isn't worth it to others declaring that it's everything wrong with scientific community today, that his decision to wear that shirt eclipsed everything he and his team accomplished. Admittedly, I thought it was a relatively minor incident, particularly when there are more salient examples of misogyny and men getting away with things (read: Bill Cosby, et al). There was one particular argument I witnessed in which some strident feminists declared that the horrifying reaction to the science journalist's tweet represents all men. That left me angry and confused because it doesn't represent all men, and if men are to be a part of the dialogue, we can't readily participate when we've already been written off. I don't mean to condescending. I only want to illustrate the frustration I feel as I try to figure out my place in the feminist dialogue.

I've heard that being a feminist is as simple as believing both sexes should be equal, but then I've heard that isn't that simple, that it's something that has to be bestowed. I thought Emma Watson's speech was particularly empowering and insightful, but than I read criticism from other feminists saying that Emma Watson either missed the mark or only slightly hit it. So the framework Watson tried to establish was too weak or not right for certain groups of feminists, so my participating in that framework doesn't count for some.

I don't know what it means to be a man and a feminist when there seems to be a number of competing ideas. How much is required of me? Am I supposed to raise hell every time I see an infraction? How much of this fight is mine, and how much of it is yours?

I want to help. I just don't know how.

title: Feeling conflicted - advice welcome
body:
So, today I (47F, white) had a couple of appointments and ended up taking the bus home afterward. There was a super friendly lady (58F, black) already on the bus and she greeted me like we were old friends calling me "sister" which felt really nice, to be honest. I wasn't sure if I should call her that in return so went with a smile behind my mask and a friendly, "Hey, girl!" in return.  She seemed happy with that so that's not the conflict, just trying to paint a picture.

So, she talked...a lot...and she was very upbeat and positive and I enjoyed listening to her. But, then, she had made a comment about how important it was to her to see the good in everyone...no matter what. And, I kind of agreed, but mentioned that I couldn't really see the good in racists, bigots, etc.

At that point, I continued listening respectfully, but some of the things she said made me feel really sad. She said that she believes that there is nothing that can be done about racists as America was founded by white men, for white men. She said that Black people were supposed to be sent back to Africa but Africa didn't want them back so they are basically stuck here. She believes the best result that can be hoped for is that we all just learn to co-exist.

Her sons are both married to white women and told her that Black men don't want to be in serious relationships or marry Black women and if they are with one, they're settling. She took this as acceptable. She is thankful that their wives "cleaned" them up and got them to start wearing pants that fit and helped them get good jobs. Not that that in and of itself is bad, but she even said that these women got her sons to stop acting like thugs which just made me feel off for some reason.

I guess, I feel really sad that she just accepts that racism is a thing and I feel like I maybe should have argued about it, but as a white woman it feels wrong to argue with a Black woman about racism. I really like her, but I just have this feeling of sadness that hasn't gone away yet even though this happened about 4 hours ago.

I'll probably run into her again at some point. Is there anything I could or should say? Or just listening and being supportive even though the idea that we should just accept bigotry of any kind and see the best in all people no matter what really rubs me the wrong way. I was tempted to say, "Wait, what about rapists and child molesters," but was afraid that I wouldn't like the answer.

Any advice or ideas would be most welcome.  No matter what, I will always be as kind and supportive as I can, but I feel like maybe there is something helpful I could say to make her see that she doesn't need to accept racism as something, I don't know, inevitable?

I hope it's ok I posted this here. This sub feels like the most supportive of all the subs I read and I feel like I'll likely get the best advice here. 

Thanks for listening!

title: Labiaplasty experience? Help with healing process? (xpost)
body:
I had labiaplasty 4 days ago and am worried about the healing process. I have a follow up appointment in 3 days.

At the moment I am still quite swollen, both minora and majora, there is very little bleeding, occasionally a small amount after urinating and drying myself, some itchiness but barely any pain. My main concern is what seems to puss seeping from the areas that were trimmed.
Being such a precious area I am not sure if I am over reacting or if this is a sign of infection and that I should get to my surgeon earlier than already booked.
I am also curious as to whether I should be showering yet as some testimonials I have read say that they were showering a day after surgery, whereas others recommend not until 10 days! I showered yesterday but the amount of puss has increased since then.
I am currently taking Diclofenacnatrium and Paracetamol for the pain.

title: Thinking about breaking up with my boyfriend over cat food
body:
Hey everybody, I‚Äôm very angry and need to vent because my boyfriend just doesn‚Äôt get it and thinks I‚Äôm ‚Äúoverreacting‚Äù about the whole situation. 

I moved in with my boyfriend a year ago and brought my 3yo cat with me. She has always been prone to urinary crystals and has had major issues with this in the past. However, since starting her up on a specialized cat food for urinary issues and also adding water to all her meals, she‚Äôs had no further problems. 

Up until recently, I was 100% responsible for all her care and was following this diet dilligently, but I ended up having to go away for 2 months due to school. My boyfriend took over her care. Before I left, I made sure to remind my boyfriend about her diet (and it‚Äôs not even that complicated‚Ä¶just a scoop of dry food and some water), and he agreed with no questions.

I came back home this past Monday, and everything seemed fine, but Tuesday morning my cat grabbed my attention by peeing blood on the floor in front of me. I immediately took her to the vet and was told she had crystals again.

I phoned my boyfriend, upset, because I didn‚Äôt know what else I could do for her anymore, and thats when he admitted to me that he hadn‚Äôt been following her diet. He had just been giving her straight kibble with no water in it the whole time I was away. I asked him why he hadn‚Äôt listen to me and he told me he ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt think he needed to do all that‚Äù and that he ‚Äúthought everything I was doing was overkill‚Äù. He then told me ‚Äúshe‚Äôs prone to crystals, we don‚Äôt know if what I did caused it‚Äù. I was so mad. I told him ‚Äúyeah, we don‚Äôt know because you didn‚Äôt listen to me‚Äù, and he immediately said I was overreacting and sarcastically apologized for ‚Äúfucking up one thing‚Äù. 

I‚Äôm still so mad. He doesn‚Äôt understand how deeply hurt I am‚Ä¶where does he get off thinking he knows better about my cat‚Äôs care than me? How am I supposed to trust him with anything‚Ä¶raise a family with him, if he treats my concerns so flippantly and dismisses them? Why doesn‚Äôt he understand that its not the fact that he didn‚Äôt fucking put water in my cats food, but all the thought processes leading up to that action that are making me upset? Idk, I can‚Äôt even look at him right now and I‚Äôm questioning everything about our relationship, as dumb as that sounds.

title: Overreacting? (Boy following me around campus.)
body:
I‚Äôll try to write out everything as clear and concise as I can, so I do apologize if there‚Äôs any errors or confusion along the way. Writing isn‚Äôt my strongest suit. 

Last week is when I started noticing something was off. After grabbing a bite to eat from the campus cafe, I went to the library to see if there were any private study cubicles to study at. When I couldn‚Äôt find any, I decided to head off to another section of the campus and noticed a guy following behind me. I didn‚Äôt think anything of it at first, because of course it‚Äôs a campus with thousands of students looking for a place to study ‚Äî but then when I continued along to other parts of the campus looking for a quiet study space he was still behind me. I went back to the library (and yes he was still following) and found a cubicle. Anytime I‚Äôd look around the corner from my cubicle I could see him walking around the bookshelves near me and that‚Äôs when I really started to get weirded out ‚Äî he just didn‚Äôt stop walking around the whole entire time. Eventually, when I was packing up and getting ready to leave he stopped and said hi to me and I said hi back and left quickly making sure he wasn‚Äôt following behind me anymore. 

Which brings us to today. After finishing my last class of the day, I quickly got a bottled drink from my school‚Äôs cafe and he saw me and followed me in there!? I quickly finished paying and went to the washroom to see if he‚Äôd follow me again (this was really dumb on my part I know).  I waited it out for five minutes, and when I decided to exit the bathroom he was there, but then left right after he saw me exit the washroom. After making such a dumb decision I decided to go to a more open public space, the library and to see if he left for good and get some study time in. But no he was there again. Still wandering up and down the library and around the shelves where I was sitting. 

When I finally got uncomfortable and got ready to leave he said hi again, and asked how I was. I quickly said hi back and brushed him off coldly. And once I started walking towards the exit of the library he was hot on my trail again. I didn‚Äôt want him to follow me home, so I just turned around and asked if I could help him with anything. He then started to ask basic questions like what program I was in, my name, what semester I was in, if I spent a lot of time in the library, what my program was about, and I was just feeling so anxious that I basically lied and told him fake answers, and that I had to go and that my boyfriend was waiting for me. 

And now after calming down, I remembered he said he's apart of a program that‚Äôs for student‚Äôs who have learning challenges, disabilities and who are learning to interact with the real world. I feel sort of like an asshole for jumping to conclusions, that he was a creep, but he might just be socially awkward and doesn‚Äôt know how to interact with other people? 

I still feel nervous about returning to campus tomorrow and I don‚Äôt want him to follow me around anymore and he made me feel uncomfortable. I don‚Äôt know am I just overreacting?  

Side Note: Not sure how important this is, but when I brought up my boyfriend was waiting for me, he cut the conversation short, so?

title: Waiter found my number after dinner and texted me to ask about the tip.
body:
I made a dinner reservation with a group of 5 girls tonight, and my friend who put the check on her credit card mistakenly thought gratuity was included because of the size of our party. None of us caught her mistake. 

Fast forward about 20 minutes, I get a text from our waiter asking if the lack of tip was a mistake or if we did not like his service. (He must have gotten my number from the reservation system I used to book the table.) He politely asked if he could add a 20% tip in case it was a mistake. I apologized and said to add the tip, but I feel like this was weirdly out of bounds. I would have much preferred to be contacted by the management, or even the host.

Side note: he made several uncomfortable sexual jokes to a table full of women and all of us felt uncomfortable with his service, so the fact that he got my number makes me even more bothered. I feel like I want to contact management and say something, but that would just be to make myself feel better, so I probably won‚Äôt. 

Would this bother you too, or am I taking it too seriously?


UPDATE: So I contacted management with something very similar to what I've originally posted here, and the female manager just got back to me. She was actually more outraged than I was. Apparently, this guy is in training and she expressed major concern for his judgment based on this feedback. She said they never would have reached out at all regarding tipping, let alone allowed the server to do it himself. She apologized profusely, and said that I "won't be seeing him again" and to contact her before my next visit. Although many of you are right that this is unlikely to be an isolated incident, I feel pretty awful for being the reason someone is let go. I'm also concerned that if he is terminated, he has my phone and likely my email - so I've blocked his number.

title: Really starting to feel the pressure
body:
Hi all! 

I hope this is the right thread to post in, if not feel free to point me in the right direction.

A little back story: I'm a 22F, live in a fairly large (also fairly liberal) city, have a job at a tech start up, and no college education. 

My boyfriend and I moved to this city a couple years ago after being together for 3 years (at the time) and things just sort of started falling into place. Well, I recently decided to completely switch my career path and enroll in college to become a K-12 teacher. This came as a big surprise to my partner but he has been amazingly supportive. After telling my family and friends about my new endeavors I got some responses that really threw me off. i.e: when will you have time to have kids, why haven't you gotten married, what if you don't make a lot of money, and so on. These responses have gotten me thinking I'm doing something terribly wrong and that things will just fail miserably.

I just wanted to ask all of you if you've experienced something like this. If so, how'd you feel about it? What was your answer to get things on the right track?

TL;DR being pressured into marriage, kids, etc. while trying to pursue a passion. Causing A LOT of anxiety and uncertainty.

title: Forced me to get double eyelid surgery
body: Recently, I went on vacation to visit relatives and little did I know that I would end up being forced to get double eyelid surgery. I guess saying "forced" is wrong because I eventually agreed, after my mom and my aunt and my grandmother kept telling me I'd look so much better and that my eyes were uneven and that I'd thank them later-- basically badgering me and taking me to a bunch of clinics. Of course, I've felt insecure about my appearance, but I've never felt the need to surgically alter myself. At these clinics, I was told that my eyes looked "sleepy" and that my eyes would look more "alert," and honestly, I've never analyzed myself to that degree. I'm so sick of these extreme beauty standards in Asia and my family's attempts to impose them on me without any respect for my thoughts. I'm really kicking myself for not being more firm, for not even making a scene at the clinic so that my family wouldn't even mention double eyelid surgery. But now I have to deal with the consequences of my(?) decision and I just don't know what to do with myself. My eyes won't settle into their final shape until 6 months later. As of now, my eyelids are kinda swollen looking and I can't seem to get myself out of my depressed state of mine. Now they're a permanent reminder of my family's control over me and that just makes me really sad. They've already made up their minds about my future in college and even threatened to not pay for college if I don't work toward med school. I feel so helpless.

title: I got followed after work. I feel so sick.
body:
I thought it was all in my head but I felt that something felt off. Now I feel terrified coming home at night.

Went to the train stop around 9pm, I was talking to my mom on the phone to let her know I‚Äôm about to board the train. Just when I was about to end the call, some man in his 40-50s bumped into me. Initially, I thought it was someone trying to pickpocket me but he just said "sorry" and I ignored the whole situation.

I boarded the train and sat but the same man sat to the seats opposite me. I didn‚Äôt think much about it until he sat way too close to me beside me. I was wearing my headphones the whole time without anything playing on the background but he kept trying to get my attention. 

He kept asking me where I live, what‚Äôs my age, where am I going. His breath stank of alcohol. I hated every moment of it. I tried saying I‚Äôm listening to a ‚Äúreligious sermon‚Äù but he didn‚Äôt leave me alone. 

I wanted to move seats but I decided to get off the next stop to take another train instead. He did the same thing. I went down a couple of stairs. He did the same thing. I went up again and this time I was freaking out. I wanted to ask for help but I didn‚Äôt know how. I was panicking. Luckily, someone I knew from university and their partner passed by. I went straight to them and told them to help me. 

We got on the train again heading back the opposite direction. The same man boarded the train and came to stand opposite us. The whole time I was shaking and the couple I was with decided we should go to the next tram. He still fucking followed us. I felt sick at this point. We got off after 6 stops. At this point, he stopped following me. I cried my eyes out. I was terrified the whole time. The folks I was with did comfort me and they made sure I got a taxi to go home. 

I‚Äôve never had anything like this before. How long was he following me before I noticed? This sicking behaviour puts women in danger when we‚Äôre trying to live our fucking lives.

title: the way men feel about ugly women makes me suicidal
body: the overwhelming majority of men think women have no worth outside of looks so if you don‚Äôt meet the minimum looks requirement you are either totally invisible or worthy of scorn. if you luck out you might get used and discarded but that‚Äôs as good as it gets. and your only options are either undergo tons of plastic surgery to maybe be good enough to be objectified or trudge through life everyday knowing half the population thinks you are worthless and nothing you do matters. it‚Äôs too much

title: My (37f) boyfriend (45m) never asks about my life or day. Feel alone and depressed.
body:
TDLR: boyfriend is very affectionate and loving (except when we are fighting) but doesn‚Äôt seem to be interested in me on a deep level. I feel lonely and depressed. 

My boyfriend of 1.5 years never asks how I‚Äôm doing about my life or day. I lost my mom in May and she and my son are my only family (I speak to very toxic racist family/I‚Äôm half black). We go out sometimes to the same restaurants (he likes) but never anything special.

He got me an anniversary present but bc my birthday was days later he didn‚Äôt do anything for me. If I try to bring up issues as nicely as possible he blows up and has a huge temper. He justifies it by saying it‚Äôs the way I bring issues up but I feel like I walk on eggshells. 

I have no family (except my son who‚Äôs going off to college in the Fall out of state) or friends (I moved here to be close to my mom new state and she passed within the year) 

It‚Äôs Xmas time and I‚Äôm sort of waiting to see how he behaves on the holiday how thoughtful he is or not to be my deal breaker. He claims he loves me so much. In other ways we are both very affectionate and loving (when it‚Äôs not a fight) and we have awesome sex. He spends a lot of time with me but we never go out, do anything special, and he doesn‚Äôt seem to care about my inner world. Im struggling with losing my mother and he never asks and I can‚Äôt really depend on him emotionally.

We live separately and he dodges future questions but occasionally brings up marriage but nothing concrete. I have to move in a few months and no talk of the future with me. Of course I‚Äôm emotionally attached and also vulnerable since losing my mother and him being really my only connection out here.

Im trying to make other connections (on bumble for friends) but it‚Äôs difficult at this age. I feel like we are hidden away from the world a bit. We do family events and holidays together (his family). I feel I can‚Äôt even bring any of this up bc he believes a healthy relationship doesn‚Äôt fight and if I bring up needs I‚Äôm just pointing out flaws, criticizing and  ungrateful but I rarely complain?? Is he just using me? I love him very much and he‚Äôs the rhe only person I get interaction with really. I feel very hurt unseen invisible and depressed.

When I was upset about my birthday he said I was spoiled and blew up on me. Im attractive hardworking w with a deep sensitive inner world I feel like he doesn‚Äôt even see or quite frankly care about seeing. I give up on men. I still feel young and have so much love and energy to give but I have never had a healthy loving relationship. 

 My mom made every holiday so magical and she‚Äôs gone  and he doesn‚Äôt even wonder how I‚Äôm doing. It makes me feel so alone and like he doesn‚Äôt even see the special qualities I have. Just a convenience. When I try to tell him my struggles he insinuated I‚Äôm weak and tells me to toughen up when he wouldn‚Äôt be able to handle half the things I have been through in my life nor does he know bc he doesn‚Äôt seem to interested in my past my present or our future. He wanted this relationship and tells me he wants long term but where?? 

Sorry all of this overwhelms me with my normal life and it makes me just want to end it all sometimes bc I feel so alone in this world.

title: I'd just turned 16. This was my first time.
body: I tried posting this on twitter with the #metoo hashtag but honestly, it's being used so much nobody will probably ever read it there. My boyfriend suggested I post my story here instead.  I was at a birthday party at a friends place. I'd just turned 16 about a week or so before. I had to sleep over at her place. At the party, there was this middle eastern guy that was about 20 or so. He was being flirty and talked to me a lot, but I had no interest in him. That night I got really drunk. Birthday girl and some other person slept in her room. I had to sleep on the couch in the living room. The couch was this long one with a corner in the middle, so two people could sleep there without touching eachother. The middle eastern guy had to sleep on the other side of the couch. When we went to bed, there was no one else in the room besides me and him. The guy started touching me and tried to kiss me. He opened my shirt and started pulling off my pants.  I'd never been with anyone before. I was a virgin.  I told him no. He'd answer with something like "come on.." and then pulled them off anyways. I was scared and drunk. I didn't know what to do. I was mentally aware but felt cognitively slow (if that makes sense). The guy pushed me down and forced himself inside of me. It's one of the most painful experiences i've ever had - I wasn't wet at all and never wanted this. I remember staring at my knee that would slam against the side of the couch, maybe in an attempt to put my mind on something else other than what was happening. I was embarrassed about the sound. I didn't want anyone to think I was having sex so I put my hand under my knee to soften the sound so nobody would hear. I didn't want anyone to know. The guy finished inside of me. Multiple times throughout the night, he'd come over to try to touch me again. I wrapped my blanket tightly around me and wouldn't let him touch me again. I stayed awake the whole night in case he'd come back. I was just waiting for it to be morning, so I could go home. The next morning, my mom picked me up. I asked my mom if she could get me a morning-after pill. She didn't really ask questions, just took me to the pharmacy to get one. I guess she didn't want to bother me with it in case I was embarrassed, and honestly I wasn't ready to tell her either. I didn't tell anyone about the experience, not the birthday girl, the parents of the birthday girl, or anyone in my family for a while. I blamed myself. I thought it was my own fault. Why didn't I fight back or scream or anything? All I did was say no and then just lie there. At the time, I didn't think this was rape. I thought this was how sex was supposed to be. I'd have nightmares about it almost every night. I'd toss and turn in bed. I had many sleepless nights and I cried a lot. I was scared of having sex ever again.  Half a year later, I went to Copenhagen with my sister. I'm a lot younger than my siblings. They kind of 'felt too grown-up' for me to tell them about something like this. Me and my sister shared bed and I'd still have these nightmares. I'd be restless and move around in the bed. My sister thought it was annoying and told me to stop. I didn't really know how to feel, being yelled at for it, but I knew I couldn't just stop it, so I decided to tell my sister how I had this terrible sexual experience and the memory wouldn't go away. She asked me if I was lying. I've never lied to her. It definitely wasn't what I needed to hear as the first thing - with her being the first person I opened up to. I broke down crying and ran to the toilet and sat in there. She came out there and explained to me that it sounded more like rape. I guess it was hard for her to believe? We talked about it for a bit. She told me I absolutely wasn't at fault and I should stop blaming myself. Realising that actually felt relieving in a way. I was blaming myself for the experience but I shouldn't. I wasn't at fault. I was a very young girl, drunk and I'd said no. He forced himself onto me. He did something wrong.  A year later, I finally got the courage to tell my mom. It's been 7 years now and I've never told my dad. I can't get myself to tell him, but I also feel like maybe he deserves to know. He's always been an amazing dad.  I tried having sex a few times afterwards. It wasn't good at all. I couldn't relax. It wasn't intimate. I was just lying there and felt nothing. Must've been a lame experience for the guys as well, cause I felt pretty dead inside while it was going on. It wasn't until I met my first real boyfriend 3 years later I realised how it's supposed to be and feel - when someone is patient and gentle with you.  I never reported the guy. I never asked my friend for his name. I don't even want to know his name. I just want to forget. I did ask my friend if she still hangs out with him. Maybe I would've told her about it if she'd said yes, but she said she hadn't talked to him since the party. That was good enough for...

title: A Victim of Toxic Positivity
body:
I was in a committed relationship with someone I thought was absolutely wonderful. Until I realized he wasn't. He was the sweetest man who treated me like a queen. But it took a long while to realize the queen could have "good vibes only." It was tiny little things throughout the years that added up to the realization that I was not allowed to be a full human in that relationship. My boundaries were given serious discussion and thought. Only to have it disappear once the conversation was done. It's taken me years to come to this realization. The walking on egg shells, made to feel like I was losing my mind, the rug would once in a while be pulled from under me, all because he was utterly non-confrontational to the point where our relationship was "good vibes only". 

Now anytime I see those words I want to fly into a rage. I taste the bitter and cancerous taste of it in my mouth. All the frustration, the anger, the grief, the inability to stand up for myself (wasn't allowed to) bubbles up like Vesuvius looking for Pompeii. On paper, he never did anything *wrong.* He checked all the boxes and lit up my world. We traveled the earth together, exploring and adventuring. We were building an incredible life together. Until facades started to crack. And I woke up one day realizing that he may never had laid a hand on me but he crushed my spirit and destroyed my self esteem instead. One tiny subtle little bit at a time. 

Now I've been spending years putting back the pieces of myself. And staying away from any and all who cannot handle confrontation. I want to tell all of them that life is about confrontation. You confront your demons, you face your hell, you challenge yourself, otherwise *you do not grow.* I don't handle confrontation well (who does?). I shake with it. I have to chew it over and over in my mind, on paper, practice and then proceed. But it needs to happen. Sometimes I want to face him and calmly tell him - I am not a coward. *But you are.*  However I am sticking to my last missive to him. That I hope never to see or hear from him again for as long as I live. 

And I keep thinking. I am not the only woman to go through this. I am not the only one not allowed to be upset, to be angry, to be frustrated. I am not allowed to be a full human, a full person. I am so done with that. Those "good vibes only" trope can go shove it.

title: I'm absolutely speechless right now
body:
Just had a discussion with my 60 year old mother that's left me angry and hurt and confused. 

She was telling me about this "thing" on the news she saw that really offended her. I don't watch the news because I'd rather watch things that don't depress me. So I asked her what it was.


It was a story about the protests Australia is having after the fallout of the Brittney Higgins confession. My mother is offended that these women are openly discussing rape and sexual assault. 


I'm 35 and spent 2 years being raped regularly by a boyfriend because I was brought up to believe that's what relationships were. 


I said to her that maybe if rape was more openly discussed i wouldn't have been raped for 2 years. This is something she didn't know about. She changed the subject. Because women shouldn't be discussing these things. 


I've always known she's been a "she was asking for it" thinker when it came to rape, but this is different. 


I know it's a generational thing. But it hurts.

title: I finally understood why I don't smile anymore
body:
My parents always tell me I was a happy baby/toddler and laughed all the time. I distinctly remember giving my biggest smile to strangers when we went out for walks, and they always smiled back. I remember it felt nice to have a stranger smile back at me. But nowadays I actively try to keep a serious face while I'm walking down the street.
So, the other day I was wondering when I stopped smiling at people and why. When did I start to make an effort not to smile? Maybe I should try smiling again. And then it hit me. I don't know exactly when I stopped but I guess it was around the same time (and the same reason why) I started to get hesitant to say good morning to strangers on the street. I didn't want they to think I was leading them on. I didn't want men tho think I was leading them on. So I learned to ignore everyone and look mad as I walk down the street - so I wouldn't be carltcalled or stared at too much. 
As I grew up I noticed more and more men staring at me. I even remember when I was waiting for my mom to pick me up at school and a van full of 40-something men stopped at the red sign and shamelessly stared at 15-year-old me. It made me uncomfortable enough that I decided to get out of there. Normal-child me would have smiled and waved. But that didn't even cross my mind at the time. I was embarrassed, uncomfortable and afraid. And that happened directly in front of my school.
I'm sorry for the rambling I just got really upset that I can't smile to strangers anymore.

title: I was raped by my ex and have almost no support
body: I feel pretty grossed out, and I suppose I‚Äôm lucky that I was half-asleep and pretty high. My ex has tried to make amends (sending me money, not speaking to me unless it‚Äôs an important matter, etc.), but overall, he‚Äôs getting more support than I am. I‚Äôve told a few people, and he has as well, but everyone seems to be more worried for him than me. If I talk about the instance, most people just say ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fucked up‚Äù and still remain friends with him. I‚Äôm not going to try to have him arrested, because I‚Äôm so tired, and this is just one more thing that has happened. He called me crying, saying how sorry he was and how he wished people would support me more. To top it off, his mom gave me money and is trying to give me updates on her son‚Äôs condition. Saying he‚Äôs going to therapy, saying he was diagnosed with BPD. This situation just sucks for me right now.

title: My mother who survived late stage breast cancer 7 years ago, might have ovarian cancer now. For the first time ever, I hate my two X chromosomes
body:
So yea.. Not much to be said.

She's free of breast cancer recurrence but her ovaries are slightly enlarged.

Her gynecologist said it might be a late side effect of Tamoxifen (pills that decrease estrogen levels), a medicine she took to prevent breast cancer reoccurence, but just to be sure, he ordered her to do a bunch of tumor markers.

Once again, we're doing the waiting game. I'm having flashbacks to 7years ago when she was first diagnosed with breast cancer.

I don't think I can do this again.

I'm severely depressed. I can't watch my mum go through this again.

I hate being a woman.

I hate it.

title: How many tries did it take for you to get your first job?
body:
I've been applying for jobs for almost 1 year now ... I was 17 but I'm now 18. I've gotten 7 interviews but never got hired. 

Latest one was Subway .. I went up there everyday for 2 weeks (still applying to other places). I got an interview from the manager. She genuinely liked me, wanted to hire. Asked me to write down my availability + phone number. and said she would call me back .. she never called. 

I went up there again and she said yah get a job next Tuesday. I went up there and she said they were full staffed. 

I'm so upset I'm shaking. I'm really trying not to cry. This makes 7 interviews I've failed. I'm really I'm so frustrated. 

In my home, no job means no college. No college means you can't live with us .. I graduate in January. I'm scared for my future.

title: I reported my PhD advisor for harassment and nearly lost my graduate career over it. Informal AMA inside.
body:
Throwaway here, otherwise regular reader of TwoX.

I am a PhD student at a major public research university. My (now former) PhD advisor had an extramarital relationship with an undergrad who was paid to work in our lab and given many special privileges as a result of her relationship with the professor. When I let the undergrad (someone I considered a friend) know that I was aware of their relationship out of concern for her, the professor began a campaign of retaliation that eventually drove me out of the lab and led me to reporting the way he was treating me and his relationship to the department head. He also repeatedly sexually harassed other female members of the lab. I was effectively removed from the department after making this report.

Sexual assault between students is very prominent in the national spotlight right now, but I believe the focus on the undergrad assault problem has allowed some universities to turn a blind eye to the fact that their own professors can be guilty of sexual misconduct as well. When professors engage in sexual misconduct it can cut a wide path of destruction, even when a physical assault hasn't happened. This professor's actions ultimately cost him his job, close to a million dollars in grant money (all returned to funding institutions), 2 grad students were left without labs, 2 grad students were fortunate enough to be able to graduate early, 1 lab manager was unemployed, and 8 undergrads were left without a lab.

I am now working within my university to try and improve reporting and investigation procedures and to find protections for STEM graduate students who live and die by their advisors so that grad students don't have to choose between reporting misconduct and potentially ruining their own careers to do so or just dealing with a hostile environment.

So AMA about what it was like going through the (now 2 year long) process, what I'm doing about it now, or about being a female graduate student in biomedical science. Or ask me something random. I was going to write up the whole story of what happened as a sort of catharsis, but I figured it might be more useful to others who might have questions about what happens in similar situations to try it this way.

*I'd be happy to verify details with mods.

**Detail edit:** I did not arbitrarily decide that this relationship constituted some sort of sexual misconduct based on offending my delicate sensibilities- our university defines any person in a supervisory or managerial role (teaching, employment, or mentorship) that has a relationship with a subordinate to be engaging in misconduct. 

I also did not report the relationship on purpose. I tried to report the harassment and discrimination I witnessed and received, but in my meeting with the department head I made an offhand comment about his relationship with the undergrad. You see, the professor had told other grad students that he had disclosed the relationship and my comment to the DH was something about being surprised that they didn't care more about it. Turned out they cared a lot about it and my comment was the first time they were hearing about it because the professor lied about having disclosed it. So I did not get jealous and scorned and tattle about a relationship, I accidentally reported that part.

________________________________________________________

Night time edit: I'd like to thank people who asked questions, supportive or in opposition to my actions. I don't know if I did the right thing. I appreciate the discussion and the opportunity to talk about what happened.

I am a little disappointed in the minority response that I am a life ruiner. This is why people don't speak up when they're in actual hostile work environments. What I did was talk about things that this guy *actually did* and somehow it's supposed to be my fault that things went south? How about laying some responsibility at the feet of the perpetrator of the harassment and discrimination? Jesus.

title: Some men are truly something else
body:
So this situation just happened :D I‚Äôm sorry for my bad grammar, English isn‚Äôt my first language. 
I met a guy, who‚Äôs like 4 years older than me, we go to the same uni. He seemed nice, although at our first meeting he told me something quite personal - that he used to have some mental problems. A red flag (I mean, who tells something like that to someone they‚Äôve known for like an hour), but okay, I‚Äôm usually the type who lets some things go, so that‚Äôs what I did. I mentioned that I have a lot of unfinished work and he offered to help me, so I agreed. I mean why not. In the end we‚Äôve met up 3 times. During this time I‚Äôve found out that he doesn‚Äôt get along with people in his group (he talked like he‚Äôs better than them), doesn‚Äôt have friends outside of uni. That concerned me, because it‚Äôs kind of unusual to have absolutely no one. I‚Äôve offered to introduce him to some interesting people, but he declined because ‚Äúi don‚Äôt really need anyone, I‚Äôm content talking just with you‚Äù. At that point in time I‚Äôve known him for less than a week, so it‚Äôs kind of weird that he said that. But once again, I‚Äôve let that go. And the thing is, when talking to him in real life, he seems chill, but online is when the creepy stuff happens. 

I‚Äôve mentioned to him that I‚Äôm the type who sometimes disappears, so it‚Äôs quite usual that I don‚Äôt answer for some time (it can happen for a few days, I just need to get my social battery charged up :D). So this Saturday I needed to go to uni to see a professor and give him my work, but I‚Äôve overslept, so obviously didn‚Äôt go. Woke up to like 10 missed calls from him. Apparently he went to the auditorium where the seminar is held and didn‚Äôt see me there, so he decided to blow my phone up. I‚Äôm a headman in my group and have to see the deputy dean quite often (some organization matters), and he knew that. So he threatened me that if I didn‚Äôt pick up his call, he‚Äôll go to him. So that was something, made me hella uncomfortable. We still haven‚Äôt even been acquainted for a week! And later, on Sunday, I told him that I was gonna disappear again. That day he texted me that he‚Äôs never going to get used to my disappearances (as if we‚Äôve known each other for years), called a couple of times. I ignored all of that, didn‚Äôt answer because I truly wasn‚Äôt in the mood for that bullshit. Monday he texted me that I‚Äôm annoying him (as in making him go crazy with rage), had 16 missed calls. Not gonna lie, this made me hella anxious, that‚Äôs when I told my friends about this whole situation. They were immediately alarmed and rightfully so. On Tuesday I had to go to uni because of some physics labs and he knew that. So when I was on my way there he kept blowing up my phone, texting shit like ‚Äúlabs!!!!‚Äù. And then he literally texted me ‚ÄúI fucking hate you‚Äù. And then still called. And said that I fucking annoyed him so he‚Äôs going to the deputy dean. This shit would be hilarious, if it wasn‚Äôt that scary. One of my friends took me to a place where I can buy a pepper spray and taught me how to use it properly. I truly don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on inside that guys head, but showing up to my seminars when he doesn‚Äôt even have any lessons that day just to check if I‚Äôm there, threatening me with the deputy dean? telling he fucking hates me but still trying to contact me? I swear, this kind of behavior doesn‚Äôt even seem realistic. 

Thankfully, one of my friends can be quite harsh and can tell someone to fuck off. So she took my phone and started texting him back with the intention of getting him off my back. And I‚Äôm glad she did that, because I would‚Äôve gone about this way softer. When she told him that he‚Äôs being a creep and the way he‚Äôs acting is not normal, he just ignored all that and asked if I went to the uni to that physics lab. what. the. fuck. She kept on going, saying that ignoring what she said wasn‚Äôt gonna get solved anything, he still kept on deflecting, never explained his i fucking hate you, still tried to find out if I went to uni that day. I made my friend stop texting him, so his last questioned went unanswered. Currently this is the end, but god I‚Äôm so anxious going to uni now, he can easily find me and I REALLY don‚Äôt want to accidentally cross paths with him

title: Hey twox, I think I was drugged yesterday while I was visiting my bf at work and I'm not sure what to do...or what I'm supposed to be doing.
body:
Yesterday, I had some free time during the day so I decided to visit my bf at work. He works at a hardware store in the "bad" part of town, but it was daylight so I walked over and surprised him. 


He only had like an hour and a half before he finished work so I decided I'd stick around and wait for him to finish and we'd walk back home together. 


Here's where it starts getting weird. I was feeling fine when I got to the store. I mentioned I was hungry and he showed me where they kept the coffee. I drank a cup and sat down in a chair in the front part of the store to do some work on my laptop. I finally got bored and grabbed some more coffee and walked around the store until it was close for him to go. 


Then I had to use the bathroom, so I left my stuff (backpack, coat and coffee) with him up on his podium thing and asked him to watch it while I went. 


By then, it was time for him to clock out and he came back with my stuff to the area where you clock out, but he had left the coffee cup on the podium. It's just a cup btw, and has no cover thing on top of it. 


The podium is out in the middle of the store, next to the registers and anyone can walk by it easily. I wanted to tell him to go back and grab it real fast, but I didn't and so I waited for him to clock out for a few minutes in the back, and then decided to go back and grab it myself. 


I grabbed it and start sipping it, and he comes out from the back and we start walking back home. I drink about half of it, and then it's cold so I throw the other half away. About five minutes after I started drinking that cup though, I start getting really giggly. Which isn't really that strange to either of us at the time, because I can get really giggly/hyper sometimes for no reason.


But then things get really weird, even for me. I get super tired and lay in the bed almost paralyzed. And I'm starting to say delusional things.. Like how he's an angel and how I must have died and gone to heaven. And it's not like in a cute way. I really did believe it. And then, we start getting touchy (sorry if tmi) but a friskiness starts followed by some intense orgasms. By then, I'm so tired I can't even speak properly. I keep zoning out and start feeling paranoid and some anxiety hits. I'm seeing shapes on the wallpaper patterns. My jaw gets all clenched. Like really clenched. Like every time I try to keep it still, it snaps closed. I'm slurring my words like I'm drunk and can't form proper sentences.


By then, I tell him I really don't think I'm okay. I tell him it's not like other days where I'm just zoning out. We have a hunch that something must have happened to the coffee while we had left it unattended at the podium. Anyways, I get some bad nausea and vomit a little, drink some water and ride out the night. 


Today, my bf goes to work and asks the lost prevention team(security) to check the footage to see if anyone had messed with my coffee on the podium for those few minutes. They take a look at it and tell him there was a man who walked by and "waved his hand over it" for those 2-3 minutes while we were gone.


They said there was no one else who came near it, but then go on to say they say they aren't even sure he had done anything, because according to them, he was really "inconspicuous" about it. They said he had just walked by and waved his hand like he was scratching his head when he came near it. 


It just doesn't make sense to me. It was barely busy when my bf and I went to the back of the store and left the coffee. A lot of the registers were open, so that there would be no real reason to walk by the podium. And we were only gone for like 5 minutes tops, so what are the chances of someone just walking by and waving their hand in front of the coffee during that time by chance?


They also said they had seen him in the store before. To me, this means that he might be familiar with the store and known where the cameras were and what to do to not look too suspicious. To them, they're saying they can't do anything until the guy walks into the store again. They said they'll watch him if he does come in again but pretty much, it's out of their hands until he comes back in again.


I just don't know what to do now. All I know is that I was not feeling okay after I left that store. And I was lucky enough to have my bf with me to walk me home and make sure I was okay.


I don't want whatever had happened to me to happen to some other person who may not have someone to walk them home or make sure they are okay...

title: Brothers anger ends up costing me my confidence
body:
My relationship with my brother isn't exactly healthy, but I can rest assured that a lot of it is due to his underlying issues that involve anger. We used to argue a lot as kids, which would often turn into physical fights, something I guess he hasn't grown out of. We're both in our 20's now (he's two years older than me), and have had pretty much the same upbringing. Without going into too much detail, growing up was hard at times and we had to deal with a lot, more than the typical kid, but I guess there's just some things he hasn't let go of, and for the lack of a better term, he increasingly shows signs of a typical victim mentality. 
Anyway, fast forward to two days ago (which is by no means the first time that this has happened) we got into a heated argument, he completely loses his temper and hurts me pretty bad. As a result, I've got some pretty gnarly bruising on my arms and wrists, a bump on the head, a perforated eardrum from when he punched me on the ear, and some minor scratches. I just picked up some antibiotics for my ear from my gp, where I had to lie and say it was an accident (completely ridiculous by the way, I should NOT have to be acting like the victim of domestic abuse at the hands of my brother!)

Apart from the physical aspect of his actions, it's the words that really hurt the most. He says the most soul crushing, unforgivable things that completely destroy my self esteem and make me want to just give up. It's no secret that words stick with you, but this just feels so wrong, so unforgiving. 

I just can't sleep, on top of everything else this is the last thing I need. I feel so horrible, I want to say numb but I'm in physical pain and my I can hear my stupid ear! (I can hear my ear, it ain't right!) 

Apologies in advance for the atrocious spelling and granmer, it's really late and I'm on my phone :/

title: UPDATE #1: 18/yo, PREGNANT, and scared out of my mind.
body:
Hey friends,

So as I stated in my last post, I'd be making the long drive home from school this weekend to talk things out with Mom and boyfriend. I'm back at school now and wanted to share a small update. 

Something I forgot to mention in my last post is that I'm anywhere from 6-8 weeks pregnant. My date of conception is pretty iffy at this point. 

Unfortunately, while we did talk, I wasn't really able to reach a decision. We've laid out our options, which I'll lay out for you, too (in no particular order): 

**1)** Abort. I still feel like this would be best, although devastating, for everyone involved. Emotionally devastating, but the best option in terms of my physical health and finances. Boyfriend has said that while he would *not* support my decision, he *would* support me emotionally and be there for me. But he feels like whenever he looks at me, he would resent me for murdering our unborn fetus, and that obviously hurts. But I understand where his pain is coming from, although I don't agree with his views. 

**2)** Bring to term, give away for adoption. (This one's a 2-parter.)  

 -He has a best friend that he goes to school with whose parents are very much wanting to adopt a baby... And when they found out that she has a friend who is expecting a baby (though they don't know who it is specifically), they really wanted *this* baby. However, my opinion towards his friend is pretty negative, because every time I've met her or interacted with her, she's been very rude and just plain crappy towards me. I understand this is probably a really petty reason for me to shy away from this, but I just guess I'd feel uncomfortable for half of my flesh and blood being with the family of a girl who is very unkind to me. I haven't met the rest of the girl's family, or her parents. 

 -Place for adoption with a random family. I favor this option more. I'm warming up to it. As I understand it, open adoptions are pretty much the norm these days? I think I may be comfortable with that, with occasional updates and maybe visits. I feel in my heart that a more equipped family would be better for caring for a child more than me. In fact, I know that's the case. I know adoption is a hard decision, and this of course would require me to take a semester off for school next semester (my due date is estimated around the end of September/beginning of October) for the birth and recovery (although it's possible I could at least take a few online classes, or enroll with a university more local to home? -- I'd have to look into that more.) I'd love to say I'd be able to go back the following semester (Spring 2016) but realistically, I don't know if I'd be strong enough physically or mentally to do that yet. And giving birth seems super scary, in my opinion!

**3)** Bring baby to term, raise it with boyfriend (and possibly mother). Boyfriend had the idea of my mom moving in with us while we took care of a baby, because ironically, my mom got pregnant at 18 as well. She's raised babies all her life. I'm her third child. I told him that I wouldn't want to put all that responsibility on her, and I'd feel awful about that. But she seemed enthusiastic about that, and very willing to help. So I have some mixed feelings about that. I just still don't think I'm ready to be a momma. I've never really been good with children. This December, just 2 months ago, was the first time I interacted with a newborn with a friend of mine had her baby. I had no idea. He cried as soon and as long as I held him! 

So, here we stand, still unsure. **Thank you so much** for everyone who commented and reached out to me on my last post. I didn't get back to everyone, but I read everything, and all the insight helped me so much. 

**TL;DR: Still no decision reached yet. I still feel that abortion would be best. BUT, I'm warming up to the idea of giving it away for adoption, because almost every family out there would be a better family for this child than I would be, for sure. Keeping it and raising it myself is pretty low on the list.**

title: Beware the self proclaimed male feminist.
body:
Honestly, I‚Äôm just ranting here, but I also want to warn others about an issue that I‚Äôve come across throughout my life: the self proclaimed feminist.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong. I‚Äôm a feminist and my male partner is one too. However, my ex and some other men I‚Äôve met in the past claimed to be feminists, when in reality, they were far from it. You see, they used feminism as a badge of honor, a bragging right, a way to appear more attractive to women. 


And boy, have I been fooled.

I‚Äôve dated this one guy for years who liked to think he was woke af but actually treated me like shit. Eventually, he wore me so down that I stopped wearing makeup, stopped dressing up, he kept me from speaking to other people at parties,  insulted me, isolated me, spoke down to me, mansplained, threatened me, traumatized me and been pressured me into sexual acts that I wasn‚Äôt comfortable with.

It wasn‚Äôt a fun ride. 

It‚Äôs weird. I was in another abusive relationship before the ‚Äúself proclaimed feminist‚Äù: That ex was conservative as can be. And I thought to myself after: You know what? This will never happen to me again because now I know the signs. 

But my second ex‚Äôs ‚Äúnice guy‚Äù-demeanor blinded me. And this is what makes these memories so difficult to carry around with me. Because I know this man will fool other women in the future. 

Therefore, I've taken a look back at this Fake Feminist Man and tried to identify the warning signs that I could have seen.

So ladies, if the ‚ÄúFeminist‚Äù Man you've just started dating showcases some of the following traits then he might be a phony:

- He expects an award for being a decent person. Respecting women is great, but a real feminist would never expect anything in return for basic human decency.

- He brags about eating üê±. Sorry to break it to you, but that doesn‚Äôt make you a feminist.

- He acts like he knows what women want & need BETTER than the women themselves. For instance, my ex would harshly judge any woman who liked taking raunchy photos/videos of herself (e.g. for OF) or who wore sexy clothes and/or makeup or got tattoos because ‚Äúnot a single woman does these things for herself‚Äù. True Feminist Men let women do what they want with their bodies.

- He mansplains in general. 

- He truly believes that men & women cannot be platonic friends. A real feminist would not see every woman they come across as their next sexual conquest, would they? 

- He puts other men down because they claim to be the only one that could love you for who you are. And ALL other men are misogynistic. He, on the other hand, is your savior.

- He judges other people (especially women) for being sex-positive. 

- He is intimidated by your success. 

- He doesn‚Äôt take your wants seriously. 

- Although he admits that household chores are everyone‚Äôs business, he utilizes weaponized incompetence. You are 26 and don‚Äôt know how to peel a potato, really? 

- Beware of ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a feminist, BUT‚Äù

- He judges your taste in pop culture/music etc. BUT gets offended when you don‚Äôt like his favorite band or whatever. 

- He amplifies the rumour that only ‚Äúalpha-males‚Äù can be sexist. Look, my ex was SO mad that I was abused by a conservative man before him. He said things like ‚ÄúOf course he‚Äôs the type of man to do that.‚Äù. This same guy ignored my verbal no and took raunchy pics of me without my consent. Rolling my eyes at the irony helps with the trauma.

- Has ever muttered the phrase "real women have ______‚Äù

- His feminism is not intersectional. What are his opinions on LGBTQ+, Black rights etc.? 

- Although he keeps saying that r*pe is bad, he victim blames. 

In the end, people can claim to be anything. I‚Äôm not saying that men cannot be good feminists or good allies, but we should always let actions speak louder than words. Stay safe.

title: Constantly accused of being male or MtF transgender bc my voice is deep
body:
Venting mostly.

I am a cisgender female. I dress relatively feminine and have natural curves. I don't feel like I behave or seem like I'm particularly masculine. But, I've always had a deeper voice since I was a kid. This has brought on a lot of difficulties and rude behavior from people who were bewildered at the idea that a girl could have a deeper voice. I already struggle with interacting with people to an extent because I'm shy and get sexually harassed often, but the ones who hear me speak and can't handle it make me feel sick. Some examples:

* When I was in 6th grade I asked for a classmate's phone number to chat in an effort to make friends. When I called, her father answered and blew the fuck up at both of us because he thought I was a boy. Classmate showed me to her dad like... six months later when there was an event at school. I'd about blocked it out of my mind at that point; he had a weird sheepish grin and weakly said sorry.

* Middle school is of course awful for many people; for me it sucked being mocked and treated like a pariah so often just because I had a deeper voice and gave a shit about school. I wanted to transfer schools but all of the eligible schools in my district were pretty awful tbh, and I felt like I couldn't confide in my parents. We were never really close or discussed feelings unless it was in a more negative light, and I generally had the mindset that I have to endure things that I don't want to no matter how miserable I am. So ultimately I became cynical and withdrawn, my grades fell, and they wrote me off as being spoiled and lazy with a bad attitude, while peers would call me negative. Lots of angry crying!

* Small children often flat out exclaim I sound like a boy or ask if I am one. If I deny being one they will not believe me. If I try to joke about it, it's still embarrassing and I don't want to be mean to a little kid or otherwise confuse them about gender shit and possibly lead them to make bad assumptions.

* I've had parents stop in their tracks and stare at me when I was in high school. One, albeit trying to be nice, remarked about my 'smooth baritone' voice.

* If I go to bars there have regularly been guys who ask if I am transgender, usually after trying to flirt with me. Sometimes I would go to gay bars and get asked this, and they're nice about it, but definitely had been told 'your body is great, those are good hormones/implants' until I corrected them. 

* When I went on a trip with friends last year and went into a bathroom after a bit of wine tasting, I approached the stalls and realized they were both occupied. I quietly whispered to myself 'oop, both occupied'. One of the women in the stalls immediately loudly said "WHAT? IS THERE A GUY IN HERE??" so I replied "NO I JUST HAVE A DEEP VOICE" and she went "oh", and a woman who was at the sink just kind of chuckled and said "come on, remember diversity" or something along those lines. Accusing lady gave me a nervous smile when she left the stall and I just scoffed at her.

* Phone calls suck, even if I say my very feminine name and use feminine prefixes and pronouns, I've had callers insist on calling me 'sir' or seem confused that I am referring to myself and am not speaking on behalf of myself. I work remotely and even though I've been on the same team with the same people for six months, the project manager randomly referred to me by saying 'his ticket' last week.

But yeah I don't know. I'm just tired of it. I try not to take it personally. It's not like I sound like Dr Girlfriend from Venture Brothers (but obviously it wouldn't matter even if I did). These people question my gender/sex more than I ever thought to. I've tried to train my voice to sound a bit higher, but even when I use my 'higher' voice then it also sounds kind of off to others I guess, as I've had people straight up laugh in my face or ask if I have strep throat when they would hear me speak in this tone.

That being said, I've had people compliment my voice too and describe it as sexy or a radio voice, so it hasn't been a completely awful experience, but it seems like it's often a weird lust for or an extreme hatred of my voice when indifference would be great.

tldr i'm a cis woman, my voice is very deep and people have been weird/mean about it my entire life and now i'm crazy, why can't they chill out and mind their gd business ugh

eta: thanks all for being supportive. I do like my voice and don't wish to change it as much as train it, if that makes sense. just fyi to anyone who may think I have a problem with being called trans, I have no issue with those that are trans & genderqueer, and it doesn't upset me if people think I may be. I get that people may wonder and not think about how it may seem to me. We're all people. Sometimes it can be a funny experience and I try to go with the flow. Mainly it is just frustrating when people get in my face about it, mock me, or don't believe me when it just wasn't their business in the first place. I apologize if anything I said seemed to imply this.

title: Male got aggressive, screamed, and threatened me in a coffee shop I frequent. People are telling me to get over it.
body:
This happened yesterday and I haven't slept most of the night. I just took some of the beta blockers I have handy today to give my heart and adrenaline system a break.

So to start, I may possibly be omitting some things because I am autistic and have a very strong freeze response, as well as documented history of temporary dissociative memory loss under stress which I tend to recover later. I do see a therapist regularly, and I've yet to see her about this but I will do that. 

So I made my order yesterday and went off to the side. I realized I was struggling with my cups so I went back to the counter to ask for a tray. The male who looked to be in his 40s was in the middle of his order, with a toddler aged child next to him. 

Now, I'm generally known to be very polite, but I do struggle with etiquette in these situations so I usually go by most common social observations. I've had people just go in front of me or call the cashier over as they may be working on mine, so I was wondering if I could do the same. I hadn't said anything yet to the cashier and she had her back to us, when the male to my side said something about waiting for him to finish the order to me. 

I informed him that I already placed mine and just needed something (and presumably the cashier would figure it out herself what order she wanted to go in). He immediately escalates by raising his voice and turning to me and saying he doesn't care. I don't think I was able to say anything else after because one, screaming is like a bomb to my face because of my sensitivity, and two, he began screaming into my face, advancing towards me, definitely in my space at that point, and yelling at me to get away from him and his child. He said he will stab me. He was much taller than me, looked like he was about to strike me, I left very quickly in fear of my safety. 

I have this whole feeling of unreality because this has never happened to me before, especially in a place that's public. I felt weak, overpowered in every way from his shouting over every word of mine with my ears ringing and advancing on me and threatening me while somehow using his child as leverage. I take care of my elderly grandparents and I can't imagine ever near assaulting someone for what exactly?

I did call the police, but as the cctv footage I obtained from one store later that day showed, he realized I was doing that when he saw me outside on the phone and had hidden and then changed direction in order to lose me giving them directions on where to find to him. I am still waiting on whether Dunkin will give me their footage. As the police took an hour to come in the end, by that time I had made my way to the police station a few blocks away and filed a report. All it says is Harassment. When I'm literally now looking at every single person's face when I was avoiding that before to make sure he doesn't see me before I see him. I have actually never felt such overwhelming rush of violent threat personally directed at me in such close range. I take the subway regularly and faced threats there, personal ones based on skin color, but even that never caused this kind of trauma.

Every person I've talked to so far about this has said it's not worth my time to pursue and that this happens constantly. I believe it. The one silver lining was that as I've been asking every store to share their footage of him walking down the block, they have expressed a very unexpected amount of sympathy and kindness and understanding, many sharing the same situation. Actually all women telling me, one showing me footage, of their harassment and how nothing was done.

But just because I "didn't lose a leg" as one family member told me, doesn't mean I'm going to do nothing and hope never to see him again in my own neighborhood. I'm going to see how much clear pictures I can get, update the police with them who will likely do nothing but that's okay, hang up posters all around with his face and an amount offered for his name which I will consider how to transact safely, and if all goes my way, pursue a civil case for the amount of therapy I'm now going to pursue. (I'm taking this as my sign to finally try out ketamine therapy since it will not be safe once I begin my newly prescribed thyroid medicine). 

I know a lot of people will say I'm overreacting but I am genuinely built differently and it took me a long time to get as much confidence as I do have in public because noise, confusing unscripted situations, threats, difficulty with speech due to sensory processing. I shouldn't be the one being afraid in my own neighborhood, he should now feel hunted, and he should not be free to use his kid as a justification for being a active aggressor. This is truly the therapy that works best for my personality - doing something, and I've been doing this my entire life from standing up to school bullies in childhood.

title: A tale of toxic masculinity by my manager who sexually assaulted me.
body:
Long time listener, first time caller.

tw: sexual assault

I‚Äôm a server at a popular live music bar.
In January, I was sexually assaulted by a coworker at a holiday party. For the purpose of this story, we‚Äôll refer to him as ‚ÄúH‚Äù. H has a reputation with many people where I live for being a slimy bastard who manipulates women. I noted this immediately and tried my very best to stay away from him. I had quite a few drinks at our holiday party and wasn‚Äôt of sound enough mind to deny his advances. He kept insisting that I come home with him and wouldn‚Äôt stop touching me (grabbing my breasts and feeling around my genitals) after trying to get away from him. I didn‚Äôt report him to management because it‚Äôs a small business and H has a lot of seniority and is well-liked; I didn‚Äôt think it would do any good.

Fast forward a few months, our bar is purchased by a company that owns several bars in the area. The management at the time is forced to resign and H is made the general manager of the bar. I was very angry but continued working there because I needed the money. I also happen to love all of the other employees at the bar, the clientele, the performers... and I didn‚Äôt want to leave that behind and let this scumbag win.

Prior to the assault, I started talking to one of the house performers at the bar (we‚Äôll call him A) and H took it upon himself to draw a competition from it. H began trying to bet A on ‚Äúwho would fuck me first‚Äù and insisting that he was going to ‚Äúget with me‚Äù to him. After H assumed the management position, A and I started dating. H didn‚Äôt take kindly to this and began targeting me by making me do the most difficult jobs consistently and holding me to higher expectations than other employees.

The final straw was pulled when he denied a request off that I placed a full month in advance to attend the wedding of a good friend. I almost never ask for time off, and if I do, it‚Äôs for a damn good reason. Two other coworkers (one of which, I am certain placed their request off after I did) got that day off and I was scheduled.

I am heartbroken to leave a job I love so dearly but thankful and grateful to close a dark chapter that shattered my spirit in so many ways.

Thanks for reading. Love and light to all.

title: Feel like my friends abandoned me after I got married
body:
Throwaway because my friends know my real account. I realize I may be wrong, but I really feel like I've been abandoned. Growing up through school I was a loner and as such, I only had a handful of friends. We were very close, like sisters, all the way from kindergarten up to when I got married. I asked them to be in the bridal party, and since I knew it would be a strain on finances, I simply gave them a color and said, buy a dress, doesn't matter where you get it. I asked them to be in the wedding two years before the ceremony would take place. We got up to the very end of the planning process and none of them had bought a dress. They hadn't even looked. One person, my bestie, came through and purchased hers like a month before the wedding. The rest would not. Being that we were so close to the day and I was panicky, I went ahead and purchased four new gowns, forsaking my good photographer in the process and settling for a new photographer. None of them attended or helped out with the bridal shower or bachelorette party, which dumped all of that on my maid of honor, after they agreed to help her. 

On the day of the wedding, they showed up. I handed out the gifts I had painstakingly chosen and wrapped for each if them. All they did was complain. I decided to let it go and enjoy my wedding. I won't go into detail, but let's just say they completely let me down. I was angry and stopped talking to them for a while. When I started talking to them again, I made it clear how hurt I was, and that I expected to be paid back for their dresses. They all agreed to pay me back. 

I got my pictures back, and was just devastated. She missed so many of the ones I asked for, that can't be redone. None of them showed my husband smiling. There isn't a single photo of me with my family. I feel like if I had been able to keep my good photographer, I would have those pictures. 

Now it's been two years since all of that went down. I still haven't done anything with the pictures because it makes me so sad to look at them. None of my friends have given me a single dime back, nor any apology or anything. They have all gotten married, had kids. I wasn't invited to any of their weddings, not even my bestie. I wasn't told when they got pregnant or had their kids. I've repeatedly asked to hang out and catch up, no response. I feel like after I got married, they felt I wasn't good enough anymore. I wasn't a bridezilla, I was actually pretty laid back until the last month. I didn't push them to do anything besides get a dress. I don't know any reason they'd be upset with me. I can't get an answer out of any of them to even try to restore our friendship. 

Even now, I'm angry that they've given up on me. They don't seem to care. I don't think I've done anything to deserve it. I know people grow apart, but this is different. They're avoiding all contact with me. I feel so alone.

title: IT as a female SUCKS
body: I‚Äôm 18, recently got into the IT field and I‚Äôm also majoring in it as well. I work for my university‚Äôs IT Service Desk while I study so I can get a grasp for the field while making some money. There‚Äôs two females that work there, one being me. I feel ridiculed every time I ask for help, either with my homework or with a work related issue. Today, I couldn‚Äôt figure out a really complicated python question for extra credit, and got made fun of my two of my male coworkers. They even asked why I was majoring in IT anyways if I couldn‚Äôt figure it out, or know some things about python. This class is an intro course!! It‚Äôs my second semester!! They‚Äôre both juniors, way ahead of me. They both tried to figure it out  (and couldn‚Äôt) and I just left work crying because I was so upset. This happens so much I can‚Äôt deal with it anymore. I want to switch majors and transfer schools, I HATE this. I know IT was a male dominated field, but I didn‚Äôt expect to get straight up talked down to and put down because of it. I hate this.

title: Today a man threatened to kill me because I wouldn‚Äôt talk to him.
body:
At lunch time today I was waiting for my boyfriend outside a bank. It was relatively busy out when I noticed a man staring at me from the other side of the street. I moved to get away from him and he followed me. He kept staring at me and kept moving closer and started shouting at me.

Honestly, I was terrified. I‚Äôve had some bad experiences with men before and I just froze up. He crossed the street and stood in front of me, still shouting at me, asking why I wasn‚Äôt talking to him. He said to me that he was going to slit my throat because I wasn‚Äôt talking to him. I couldn‚Äôt move I was so scared.

The man then punched an ATM and smashed the screen. I started crying, and I felt so helpless. 

My boyfriend came out of the bank and we managed to get away unharmed, but I keep having panic attacks. I feel so scared and ashamed. This is not okay. I don‚Äôt feel safe going outside. 

I just needed to vent.

title: Reconnected with a male friend and am now remembering why we stopped talking
body:
I recently connected with a male friend after years of not speaking. We live in different states. Things have changed. I am married and have a kid. He is divorced and a single dad. He says his wife abandoned them. We have a lot of conversation about our kids since they are of similar age. 

Then he starts being creepy. Starts making sexual remarks to me. Why does he think this ok? Starts asking me questions that I ignore and change topics, and he‚Äôs telling me that I‚Äôm not answering questions. 

Then I remember why we stopped talking. 
I used to visit family where he lives. We were both single at the same time and we made out in his car. We talked a bunch and on my next visit it was implied that something more would happen. I went to his house and his whole mood changed. Our friends left and he was really cold. We were watching TV and the rest of this is a really blurry memory (easily over 12 years ago). I remember his pants off and him saying something about how he can just get what he wants from me. Somehow I am in his bed and he penetrates me. I move away and he does it again and says I am wet. He does not have a condom so that‚Äôs the reason I give when he tries again. He says something about me not trusting him to pull out. Eventually I sleep since I don‚Äôt want to go back to my relative‚Äôs house and wake them up in the middle of the night. I leave the next morning and we don‚Äôt talk again minus some penis joke text some time later that I call him on and he responds ‚Äújust a joke‚Äù. 

Now I‚Äôm sad that I have to remember all of this again. I can remember how he tasted and how he felt, and I can‚Äôt sleep.

title: Exhausted
body:
I‚Äôm exhausted. I had an argument with an extremely racist male neighbor last night. The conversation became heated and I chose to walk away, and while I was walking away he (in his drunken glory) threw a full can of beer at me. It didn‚Äôt hit me so it‚Äôs not assault and it may or may not have been caught on camera. 

Basically, I have no recourse other than to move according to the police. A judge would not consider charges bc it‚Äôs such a minor incident.

But it‚Äôs not minor to me, I have been hit,  raped, assaulted, had drinks thrown at me, poured on me, and numerous other  negative experiences with men. 

This post is just for venting purposes, I am exhausted and over it.

title: Clogged the toilet at boyfriend's house (which is also his parents' house) couldn't find the plunger and follow with panic attack for a perfect evening.
body:
I was hanging out at my boyfriend's house and he lives with his parents. I was feeling really sick to my stomach so I went to the bathroom to make it feel better. Well I had to use tons of toilet paper and it clogged the toilet. I'm sure you'll understand my decision to use a throwaway for this

A short, illogical background: I have an extreme fear of clogging toilets because I'm sure people will hear me unclogging their toilet, maybe I won't be able to unclog it and I have to let them know! What if I don't have the internal gumption to do so and just leave it then freak out all night about how I'll become that "massive shit, toilet,  clogger girl that we don't invite to parties anymore." Any number of things could go wrong!

Anyways, most normal humans have a plunger under their bathroom sink or at least somewhere logically close to their toilet. I guess no one in my boyfriend's family is sane, human and/or logical. 

Thus begins the start of a poop induced panic attack.

Mortified, I go to my boyfriend's room and ask where they keep the plunger. He said his parents' bathroom so I searched but to no avail. Who has two toilets and no plunger by either? I come back and start full on crying, freaking out and babbling incoherently about toilet fears, embarrassment, and asking him to ask his parents where it is.
