title: My Son was raped and we're struggling.
body:
I wasn't sure where I could discuss this, and I hope it's okay if I talk about our situation here. I'm a mom of three boys and a girl. My twins who are 26, my third son who is 23, and my young daughter, 12. They're all precious to me and I'm so proud of them. I was relatively young (22) when I married my husband and had our first children, but more than anything I love being a mom and raising my twin boys was such an amazing experience, and my husband and I always planned on three children, and after three years we welcomed our youngest son into the family. By nature my third son 'C' was so gentle, well-behaved, creative and a little shy, in contrast to the boisterous and outgoing personalities of his older brothers, 'A' and 'B' (daughter is D, and the fact their first names are in alphabetical order is entirely coincidental). All in all he was an extremely happy boy. By the time our boys were 14 and 11, hubby and I agreed on having one more child, and I finally had a daughter, which I was ecstatic by to have a little girl. Around that time, C started to become a lot more introverted and unsociable. He was so excited about being a big brother, and he's always so protective and caring of D, she thinks the world of him, so I knew jealously didn't alter his behavior, but he at an age where puberty was starting to hit so I wasn't really alarmed. However through his teen years he appeared to be getting worse. His grades were falling, he didn't appear to have many friends, and he was so reserved and secretive and he rarely spoke. He was never aggressive, he just always appeared to be sad. I was worried that he was being bullied be he wouldn't talk to me, every time I asked it was always just "I'm alright" and "I'm doing fine" followed by a false smile. I tried my best to help him, and he did pass school and went on to college, and for awhile it seemed like he was doing better to come out of his shell but there was still always part of him on the defence. When he was 22 he came out to me as gay, and I was honestly so relieved when he did because I thought he was finally opening to me and that this was the reason growing up seemed so difficult for him. He's fully out and open to everyone now, and seemed somewhat happier but he still had a very quiet and reserved side to him that at this point I believed was just his nature, but he was still really struggling in college and depressed. Last year after arriving home from work, my husband told me that C was upstairs and he had something extremely important to tell me. We went to his room and he was distressed and in tears, trying to hold it together. After a little time he finally confessed that he was assaulted sexually when he was 11. I don't know many details, all he's told me so far is that it was more than one stranger, and that it was violent. I cried so much with him, and I of course told him that this happens to so many people, it happens to children, it happens to men and it is never the victim's fault. He's seen a doctor, and he's been seeing a therapist for about 2 months now, but I can tell this is so hard on him. He still tries to put on a happy face most of the time but he's struggling. Every day I'm so afraid for his safety and well-being. 

I'm finding this so difficult to cope with myself. I feel like a failure for not protecting my child. I should of seen all of the early signs that something wasn't right. I want to be able to fix this, I want him to have his childhood back, but I know I can't do that, and it makes me feel useless. I'm ashamed of myself, I'm hurt that he felt like he couldn't trust me enough to tell me when he was still 11. I don't know how to fix an adult. I don't know what I'm asking for here either, I just need to cry and vent. Does anyone have advice on coping? Or is there anyone else here any experience with being the parent of a rape victim? 
I love him so much it hurts. 

Edit: I truly want to thank everyone who responded with such kindness and excellent advice. On my off breaks I have been looking into counselling for Myself and C's dad. This weekend we will have a serious discussion about our options. My Son is a strong, nurturing, intelligent and beautiful young man and while I know No one can take on and fight this turmoil for him (even though he needs a break), he won't be alone. We will support and love him. His best friend knows as well, so he has support outside this household too.

title: I think I'm losing my mind. Need to vent incoherently to feel better.
body:
I'm at a loss here. I have been in a relationship with the same guy for nearly four years and I'm experiencing a lot of issues. I know it's normal to discover that one's partner is imperfect, but I'm at a point where the "imperfections" are wearing on me. Since I don't post often, here's some background:

I am a 27 year old female, he's a 31 year old male. We met at my place of employment when I was still working in bars. I'm in an office now and I work hard at my job. I have bipolar disorder, am a survivor of assault, and am actively trying to cope with these things. 

In any case, I'm starting to think I'm losing my mind here and I guess I just need confirmation that I'm not alone with the boyfriend-related things that are driving me nuts. Sorry in advance for the rant. Here's the list:

1. He will argue for the sake of arguing. Seriously, he'll argue about how I put his clothes away when I'm the only one who does it. 

2. He expects me to call him, then has nothing to say.  Um, I pretty much hate being on the phone unless there's a good amount of conversation going on. 

3. He lies to my face about ridiculous things and then tries to backpedal when I catch him in it. Yet he still thinks I'm the one to be wary of (probably a result of his parents'divorce)

4. On more than one occasion, I've caught him looking at porn in the same freaking room I'm in/looking at other women when we're out together. I hate to be judgy, but I can't help but feel like that's really pathetic. It's also really offensive and disrespectful to me that he'd behave that way around me. Of course, I'm of the mindset that he can't possibly love me if he hates women enough to objectify an entire gender at every opportunity. 

5. He's a lazy, unmotivated slob with no future- which it's something I could overlook pretty easily if #4 didn't grind my gears so much... But his behavior is really starting to rub off on me. 

6. I love him but I don't want to live with him anymore. He's a totally horrible roommate. 

7. Going back to the porn, I'm sure that's the main reason why he never initiates any physical activity with me anymore. 

I feel gross and unappreciated. Do you think there's any way to save this or should I cut my losses and move on? Is it reasonable that I'm annoyed/bothered by his behavior that it makes me really question being around him? Sometimes I look at him and he just looks like another person, nothing special... Like the emotional connection has shorted out. 

Sorry for rambling. I just need to sometimes. Bring on the downvotes for my hatred of pornography use by my boyfriend and his other misogynistic tendencies.

title: I'm finally going to share my sexual assault story with my partner of 2 years. I need some support.
body:
*Trigger warning* *Abuse*



As the title states. This is my main account and I've decided I have no reason to hide. 

I've been with my partner for around 2 years. He's really great and makes me feel calm and loved. We are looking at getting a new place together and the topic of proposing has come up once or twice. But our relationship has felt a bit off recently, and it's ME. I've been guarded and in my own head. He says that he isn't sure what I'm thinking and can tell I'm dealing with something but figured it was due to stress from a recent surgery and the pandemic in general. 

But it's because I've never shared my story of the abuse I faced in my last relationship. I've had about a million opportunities to tell him and could never get the courage or find the 'right time' but it's affecting me so much lately, I feel like I'm going to explode.

My ex would abuse me in my sleep. I researched his behaviour early on in the relationship and learned about something called sexsomnia. He was never diagnosed over the 7 years we dated but I always made the excuse that he had a 'medical condition'. I couldn't talk to anyone because I rationalized it as his business that I didn't have a right to share. I was an idiot. He was never fully conscious while he assaulted me, at least to my knowledge. I would wake up in the morning if I slept at all, to him happy and rested, seemingly unaware of what the fuck he did to me the night previous. I would share with him what he did and his usual response of "so sorry!" eventually turned into just straight up blaming me for him being repressed sexually, y'know what could I expect when he wasn't getting any?! (I have Endometriosis and sex is never a guarantee day to day, my pain always interfered.) It escalated over the years and by the end of our relationship just the thought of him touching me in anyway shape or form disgusted and horrified me. I cringed when him or anyone touched me. I eventually women'd up and got the fuck out of that relationship, but never took the time to heal and never looked back.

I didn't think I was being abused at the time, but after working with a therapist I realized he was *never actually diagnosed*  by a medical professional. He actively and knowingly violated me for years. And blamed me for it.

My partner deserves to know before we get deeper into this. I finally texted and told him I needed to share something with him tonight so I couldn't wuss out and not say anything again. I'm freaking the actual fuck out and I don't know how to tell him. I wanted it to be in person so that if he had questions I could explain myself. If anyone has any advice or is willing to share their story, I would be eternally grateful. Thanks for reading if you took the time xo.

TLDR; I want to share my sexual assult story with my partner before our relationship gets more serious.

title: I'm not sure where to post this, but I need some help and advice. I'm in my 20s and I want/need a hysterectomy.
body: I've asked this here before, but was met with a lot of vitriol, but I'm hopeful I can explain my situation better and be met with more advice than down votes. If there's a better sub to post this in, please redirect me and I'll cross post. When I was 12 years old I got my first period. I spent three days lying on the bathroom floor, alternating between throwing up and sitting on the toilet, unable to think clearly I was in so much pain. By the fourth day, I took 4 ibuprofen in a row and was able to get up. I started going through a rather interesting puberty when I was around 13. My voice broke and deepened. I began growing a beard and hair on my chest and stomach. My acne went bonkers. My boobs grew in, oddly. They are not full, and even if they stayed this small, they are stuck at a rather immature, half grown in phase. From age 12 to age 17, I thought everyone had to leave school when they got their period. I thought everyone was overdosing on pain killers as their cramps started at their backs and went down to their feet. I thought everyone had killer hot flashes. But then I went to college and found out none of that was the norm. First gynecologist visit. I talk about my body hair, my facial hair, my random periods (one month, skip two months, then get it one week then a week later get it again), the pain I had during sex, how scary it was to poop while on my period because it hurt so bad, etc. She decided to take an ultrasound of my ovaries. My ovaries are littered with cysts. But it's not the worst she had seen. And it didn't explain all of my symptoms. Most, but there were a few lingering. So they do another ultrasound, looking not at my ovaries but around my uterus and surrounding organs. What they find isn't pretty. It's endometriosis. I was having such horrible pains because it's attached itself to everything. It wanted to be friends with all the organs I guess -.- I get put on birth control to help control it. We try a lot of different medications. My ovaries are making testosterone, my utuerus is acting clingy to all my organs and the symptoms go away while I'm on it,the second I miss a pill/meds or try to stop it, I'm back on the floor 12 years old, wondering why it hurts this bad. I'm sorry if I'm ranting. I'm trying to give the full picture. I desperately wanted to be a mom. I knew even when I was young, I wanted to become a mommy and have kids. Thats' what I put up with it. Those periods were worth it because one day they'd result in children and I'd be happy. I kept telling myself, as I slept with ice packs and I popped pills, one day I'd look back and be grateful. Then my gynecologist tells me, with PCOS, endometriosis and type 1 diabetes of my entire life, I should not have kids. That I should consider a hysterectomy. I might be infertile. Even when off birth control, sometimes I've had unprotected sex and I have never gotten preggers. I've used plan B before, but not every time, and even statistically, on birth control you'd think it'd at least happen once in 7 years of being sexually active and not 100% sexually protective. But now, even if I did get pregnant, I likely wouldn't survive the pregnancy. My diabetes is a bitch to control, my hormones even controlled make it go wild. I'd have to get an abortion, because I don't think or trust my body to survive that. This utuerus isn't even safe for me to have, why would it be safe for a child? It kills me saying this. Writing it all out and admitting that I spent years of my life convinced all the pain was worth it. Now every period is a new agony. It's an agony knowing it's not worth it. Years of pain, hot flashes, cramps that rival contractions, and now three different doctors have all recommended hysterectomies to me. I've been friends with older women, childfree, who had endometriosis, not even diabetes and PCOS just endometriosis and they say it was the best decision they ever made. It tears me up, but I know it's what would improve my life. Going through a period is hell. If I miss a single pill, bam bleeding. Bam cramps. Hot flash! cramps, irritable, anger, frustration. The hysterectomy doesn't tear me up, but facing the reality that I will never get pregnant on my terms or be able to be healthy with it is frustrating. I reacted to this by becoming as masculine as possible. It's only now I've come to terms that I may lose the possibility of pregnancy that I've accepted being feminine. Three doctors. I need to find a new ob/gyn who will do this to me, and I just don't know what to do. It's hard enough to find a doctor who will do this to a 40 year old. Why should it be like this? Why should I be reminded every month that my body can't do what I always wanted? Who do I talk to? How do I get them to listen? Can I ask them to let me keep my ovaries? The last doctor said to take out my uterus but to leave my ovaries, as they aren't too bad now (the cysts are less than there was before). I would have to keep taking hormones but I'd no longer bleed. I'd no longer have to fear the off-chance they're wrong and I get pregnant and then die. I don't know. I'm tired. I want to not be in pain for most of the month. I want to live my life. I want...

title: Guy jokingly told me he wanted to rape me...
body:
So today I was at work (I work on my college campus) and two guys I've talked to a few times came in.  I was helping one of them with what he needed, and was chatting and making jokes with them at the same time.  Eventually we had everything sorted out, so the guy who needed help (we'll call him Guy 1) went to sit down in the "lobby" which is a few yards away from my desk.  His friend (he'll be Guy 2) stayed at my desk to talk to me.  Guy 1 said something I didn't understand, and this is how our conversation went.....

Me:  What did you say, Guy 1?

Guy 2:  He said he wanted to race you.

Me:  Like... in his car?

Guy 2:  Yeah!.... at least, I think so.  He might have meant the OTHER 
four letter R word he could do to you.

Me:  .... Uhm, I would really hope he wouldn't want to do that to me.

Guy 2:  Hey Guy 1, did you want to RACE her... or do the other four-letter R word to her?

Guy 1:  Oh, I want both.

....... and then he looked and smiled at me in a sly way.  I felt like I had to try and be professional because I was at work, so I responded (also keep in mind I'm absolutely SHOCKED anyone would ever say this to me) by saying, "Uhm... wow.  Okay, don't EVER say anything like that to me again."  They both just laughed it off and kept trying to make conversation with me.  I think they could tell I was upset, so they eventually left.

I'm just extremely upset.  I was shaky the rest of the day, and one of my supervisors thought I should report it.  Another of my coworkers told me I needed to calm down because, "he meant it as a compliment."  But what kind of compliment is that?

I guess I'm looking for advice.  What do I do?  Should I talk to him?  Should I ask the school counselor for advice?  I feel very uncomfortable and don't even want to go to the class I have with him.

title: He sent my nudes to other people...
body:
So to preface this, I'm a 16 year old girl who lived in Australia at the time of the nudes but have since moved to the east coast of the US. He is 17.

I know sending nudes is bad and dangerous and I probably shouldn't have done it.

I have a large group of guy friends from different schools, and there was a guy I had a thing with for a while, I really did trust him. After a while things got sexual, nudes were sent (mutually) and he screenshotted them, I brushed it off because I trusted him. He begs for nudes and stuff pretty often, and I've also told him some personal stuff.

I was talking to one of my guy friends earlier today, and he randomly asks me if I know the guy (who I had been talking to for a while) and starts begging me to block him. Turns out he's been screenshotting some of the more personal stuff I've sent him (including nudes) and made fun of me about things like my depression in a group chat of about 30 guys and has been doing this since we first started talking.

He has the audacity to post my nudes, and not the messages of him begging for them, he posts some of the more personal things I've told him and doesn't include the messages of him baiting me and egging me on.

I don't know what to do, I really don't and I'm so upset, I thought I was careful, I thought he was trustworthy. I already have trust issues and this is so damaging and I feel so terrible.


edit: The fact that we live in different countries now means that I don't think I can do anything...

title: My boyfriend‚Äôs ex keeps texting him and it makes me feel horrible
body:
[19F] so my bf and I have been together for almost a year, long term, complex relationship with a long past. Literally haters to lovers type of things. Something really strong. I trust him and I know he‚Äôs not going to do anything.

He has this one ex who he dated for only a month almost a year ago. 

His ex first texted him a while after we got together, they texted for a bit and he told her he has a thing with me (we weren‚Äôt official yet) but not in a way she got the hint. Afterwards he blocked her and they didn‚Äôt talk for a while, that was more than half a year ago.

Two months ago she texted him again through her friend‚Äôs account (because she‚Äôs blocked everywhere) and asked him for closure. He talked with her a bit and told her he‚Äôs taken (we were official so he literally wrote her he‚Äôs in a happy, healthy relationship) then blocked her again and her friend‚Äôs account and asked her not to contact him again. 

A few days ago she texted him AGAIN, now being more bold and telling him she‚Äôs still in her mind. We once joked about sending her a picture of us the next time she texts, but I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable with that because I thought it‚Äôd be super insensitive.

His ex had a complicated life and she suffers from multiple mental illnesses, so I‚Äôm being more sensitive about it but still, I get sick to the stomach when it happens. I‚Äôm very insecure about myself and I‚Äôm trying my best to be the best girlfriend and I can‚Äôt help but think she‚Äôs so much better than me. I struggle with expressing and talking about how I feel and the fact she just can say it through text makes me feel horrible that I can‚Äôt. I can‚Äôt be affectionate as she is and she might‚Äôve been a better partner than I am. I literally have these thoughts everytime it happens despite knowing my boyfriend loves me and that he‚Äôs not going anywhere. And it makes me feel like a bad gf and a horrible person. 

He told me about everytime she texted him and showed me the conversation before deleting him saying he wants her out of her life and regrets the relationship with her, so it‚Äôs not his fault that I‚Äôm super insecure and get panic attacks everytime it happens. I literally feel sick to my stomach and can‚Äôt eat anything and I feel like it impacts me too much and I don‚Äôt know what to do. Any advice?

title: It‚Äôs hard to get out of valuing yourself by only your physical attractiveness as a woman
body:
I just suddenly felt overwhelmed and needed to rant about this concept me and many other women out there probably feel as well. 

I don‚Äôt even know how it came to be, or how I even came to this conclusion, but I remember in middle school, I started to think the reason my crushes never liked me was because I wasn‚Äôt pretty enough. Everyone was going through puberty at that time and I was expecting my breasts and everything to grow in like everyone else, or even like the women I saw on TV. Unfortunately, my genetics didn‚Äôt get that far, so I‚Äôll be forever sitting at an A cup with a body like an upside down triangle. I started to become so appearance obsessed and make assumptions that all men wanted were women who were attractive and pretty, nothing more. In high school it got even worse, as all my friends started to get guys asking them out and getting boyfriends when I was stuck feeling socially anxious and alone. I started asking myself what it was they had and I didn‚Äôt, and of course I ended up thinking it was my physical attractiveness.

From that point on I developed body dysmorphia. I would cry about my ugliness and disgust for myself alone at night. I hated myself. I would switch back and forth for wanting to be thinner or wanting to be curvy. My weight fluctuated between starving myself and binge eating junk food. 

I‚Äôve become better, but even now, 6 years later, I can‚Äôt help but place all my value in my appearance. I spend so much money in cosmetics and clothing, thinking I‚Äôll get hired for being pretty (pretty privilege) or that I‚Äôll make more friends simply for being more attractive. I think that if I were a certain level of attractiveness, maybe I would get cat-called so much more like other women talk about. But all of these concepts contradict my beliefs in attractiveness not being as important in others - it‚Äôs just myself. 

I don‚Äôt think about other things I have to offer as person. I don‚Äôt even think I have anything to offer. I think my personality is weak and boring. All I‚Äôm ever focused on is how pretty I am because that‚Äôs all everyone, especially men, seem to care about. I hate this cycle and I hate everything I‚Äôm perpetuating, but I don‚Äôt know how to get out of this. 

If you made it this far, thanks for listening.

title: I am the only woman in my sub-department (Engineering field) and today I was lectured about Pregnancy in a meeting with all male colleagues (advice please)
body:
So as I said before, I am an engineer and I work in a male dominated department.  During a department meeting today about our "Master Schedule" for upcoming projects, my direct supervisor made a comment about my reproductive age and asked me if I had any plans of getting pregnant, as it would take a considerable about of time to plan around and he wanted know ASAP. I thought this was wildly inappropriate. (a little background- I am married, but currently have no intention on having a child in the near future- not that it's any of my colleagues' business)

I was caught off guard, but I immediately felt deep shame and embarrassment over such a flippant remark simply because I am of "reproductive age". (28).  Everyone in the room sort of went silent but it was awkward and it made me feel so angry because I work with other engineers in my age group and I know damn well they are not receiving the same lecture because they are men. I was so taken aback that I sort of just mumbled a response about not having any plans on that matter, but now that I'm sitting back at my desk I am mortified and wish I could have thought of something better to say like, "I have an IUD but I'll be sure to notify you when it's removed!!!!"

Do you think I should let this go?  Do I go to HR?  Is this even a big deal? It just made me feel like a liability instead of a capable employee and it has been incredibly frustrating to articulate my feelings into words on this matter.

UPDATE EDIT: Hello everyone, thank you so much for all of the advice and anecdotes, the outpouring really made me have more confidence in my feelings, which I often times downplay because I do not want to be accused of being overly emotional or inferior to my mostly male colleagues.  I talked privately via phone with my boss who is off-site at a project and then to a conference tomorrow.  I told him I wanted to speak with him about how I felt the "Master Schedule" meeting went and that I needed to address some issues with him.  He agreed to speak with me person to person, first thing Monday morning.  I hate to have this stew all weekend, but I didn't want to go into details on the phone. He also suggested that a third party be present, because even though he didn't directly say it, I think he knows why I want to talk to him. I also contacted the ombudsperson at my institution, and they took my report, the attendance list of the meeting, and offered to facilitate a 1:1 meeting and suggested that if I am still not satisfied with the results, I can go to HR.  So, I will take the weekend to breathe deep and write down exactly what I want to say and how. I appreciate all of the feedback, navigating a career can be difficult, but I am not going to let this one incident keep me from being in the role that I love and worked so hard to achieve in the first place.

title: Issues with Stepdad
body:
I'm a 22 year old female living with my parents. I came back after college just until I find a job and save up for my own place or find a roommate.  I had a great time at college and it was an experience for me to "grow" and change.  Now that I'm back home, my parents do have more rules.  Recently I went out to a party to meet some friends and Uber-ed over.  My 60 year old Step-Dad saw me leaving the house in a what he felt was an outfit too revealing, but I went out anyway.  (I'm really skinny with C cups and big hips--I've worked hard in the gym and sometimes like to show off when I go out!).  Long story short, and why this is a throw-away act, he told me to come out into the living room when I woke up. My mom wasn't around, she had left to do some errands.  He told me we "had to talk" and he set down on the couch and told me he was "dissapointed yada yada", and then he kind of pulled me over his knee and began to spank me 4 times.  At this point I was kind of in shock. To make matters worse I was wearing only pajama pants and a shirt (I'd just woken up). He told me not to do it again and I ran back into my room.  

I want to go to my Mom about this, but part of me says to keep it quiet. I have mixed emotions about this as I've only known my step-dad for about 5 years. I now feel uncomfortable living there.

title: I (29M) Got My Heart Broken By the First Girl I ever Opened Up to
body:
I wanted to make this post because I am in a lot of pain after things ended with a girl I had been seeing for a few months

For context, I dated a lot in college but was emotionally unavailable during that time due to early childhood trauma and being on SSRIs and ADHD medication my whole life. I never really learned to feel feelings until I went off meds after college. I also got Lyme disease after college and didn‚Äôt date from 24-29 because of it. So I had never truly opened my heart to someone until I got off meds, treated my Lyme, and did a ton of work in therapy.

Fast forward to March 24‚Äô - I met this beautiful girl through a mutual friend and we went on a few dates and hit it off pretty well. I invited her over for dinner on the second date and cooked her a really lovely meal which she enjoyed! We had been flirting over text prior and it seemed like we were both of the mind that physical intimacy was on the table that night, but I didn‚Äôt plan to have sex because I wanted to take it slower. We made it to the bedroom and she informed me that she had an STD, to which I didn‚Äôt really know how to respond. We were both drunk at that point and I got excited, ignored my original intentions, and tried to have sex anyway without really asking her about her condition, which was not smart I realize. I struggle with ED and even though I didn‚Äôt intend to have sex with her, I was able to get it up so I figured ‚Äúoh shit I have to act on this moment, but as I was about to engage, I couldn‚Äôt and I mentioned I got ‚Äúthrown off‚Äù by her comment and we decided to just cuddle instead. I followed up with her the next day and tried to be as much of a gentleman as I could, explaining that it takes a while for me to be vulnerable and I wanted to take it slower with her, but I had a lapse in judgement that night. 

We ended up going on a few more dates and finally engaging in physical intimacy. She also told me at one point after the STD mixup that she liked being single.

After our fourth date, I started being more intentional with her - being more forward about seeing her, and dropping in nice comments into what was mostly sexual banter between us. She didn‚Äôt respond well to that, even noting that one of my nice comments ‚Äúwas the worst thing I‚Äôve ever said‚Äù.

Come the fifth date, she is super distant and even says to me ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to ghost you after this‚Äù, and made it clear that she didn‚Äôt want me to meet her friends either. After that date I followed up with her to explain how I was feeling, and we decided to move on.

I can‚Äôt help but feel like I was ‚Äúfuck-zoned‚Äù and thrown away by this girl who I really fell for, and in the end she was super unkind to me. Our mutual friend told me from the start that he was worried about how she might treat me, but I ignored him because I was smitten with her.

This was two weeks ago and I am still in a ton of pain. I wanted to post this here to try and get a feminine perspective on the situation. Thank you!

title: My period is 2 weeks late & angry at my BF of 5 months. Please help.
body:
Hi all, 

In short, because of some very stupid decisions made during sex between my boyfriend and me, there is a chance I am pregnant (I'm 18 years old). Please, please don't bash me for this because I already feel terrible. My boyfriend and I have been together 5 months and usually have sex with condoms (even so, he's not allowed to come inside me). Sometimes, though, in the heat of the moment we'll have sex without condoms... I've had to take Plan B about 4 times in 3 months! Usually this happens because we'll be messing around and he slowly puts it inside of me without a condom but the consent is murky, and this past time I'm not sure I've consented to him putting it in me without a condom. 

But now my period is 2 weeks late and I am incredibly angry at both him and myself... angry at him for not putting on condoms and angry at myself for allowing it to happen and not saying "no". I've already taken 3 pregnancy tests that all said not pregnant but I'm still terrified because I took those only a few days after possible conceptions. 

I'm even angrier because while he's a sweet, respectful guy, if I do have to get an abortion there's a chance he'll be states away and not physically be there for me. He'll be with his family in New York while I'm stuck with the physical pain and worry in a southern state that hates abortions and girls who get abortions. I don't have anyone to turn to if I need a ride or a stay after getting a medication abortion. My boyfriend is willing to drive down a few cities to help me out as long as he's in the same state but I'm angry at him for not willing to help me out if he's in a different state. I'm angry because it's mostly his fault (I say mostly because I didn't explicitly tell him NO) for not using a condom this last time, and for not going out of his way to buy a plane ticket and find a way to get to me if I do end up having an abortion. 

Please, please help me with some advice... do I stay with my boyfriend? What do I do about the potential abortion? Is he terrible for not willing to leave states if I get an abortion or am I expecting too much? Thank you.

title: Any advice for a young mother who wishes to give up her life and her job and house and her 8 year old daughter for a month to travel abroad?
body:
I am 25 years old I have an 8 year old daughter whom I split custody with her father. I work as an RN working on my BSN. I rent a nice house for us. Ultimately I want a home and family. But to cut the story short. I just got broke up with and ...this is a repeated pattern. I'm ready for a change. As much as I want to stay here and find love its not happening. So I'm ready to travel. I really need someone to talk to. I have no idea what Im doing or where to go.  I have already talked to a friend who will let me stay in his house for 2 months while I continue to work and save up money. I realize I have a car payment/insurance, two cats and a cell phone bill that I will need to pay at least three months in advance. 
This is the hardest decision I have ever made, but I need advice and encouragement. 
I assume I will be able to do my online  courses from abroad. 
Is there anything I should prepare for?

My next steps include. Telling my landlord about this plan ( he wont' be happy)

And telling my boss I need a month off of work. ( A very feasible possibility)

Packing up all my stuff 

And then ulitimately leaving my daughter for 30 days while I do what I need to do in order to discover what will make me happy

I mainly want to know how to use my cell phone. I called my Us cell company. I have a galaxy s7. I was told about how expensive it can be. So I thought maybe I could just maintain that line..while getting a rental? Or possibly even buy a phone card?

My next dilemma is where I'm going to go or stay. As a smaller female.. I am scared for my safety but right now .. I just want to take that risk to see Rome  and also travel to France as well. I thought about couch surfing. Are country to country flights cheaper within Europe? Any advice is very much appreciated. Leaving my daughter is so hard for me to do. She is the only one I have in my life. My mother is not  there for my and my father is dead. But i'm so depressed I feel I HAVE to do  this to make myself happy.

title: I can't get over my ex...I can't move on in life
body: My ex and I broke up about 8-9 months ago (October 2016) and I can't get over it. I've attempted another relationship since then but it just doesn't compare to what I had. I thought I would marry this ex. This is the second time in my life, over the course of 11 years I thought I would marry someone. I'm losing hope. I don't think I'll ever find someone. Please help, I don't have any hope and it hurts...

title: In this time and age, women who are trying to escape abusive relationships can no longer afford escalated rent by themselves.
body: I am currently trying to escape. I will figure it out. But an example is an apartment that a couple I am friends with recently left (2/2), they were paying $1500 a month. Which I could skimp and afford by myself. It is now (LESS than a year later), $2200K. What are people like me supposed to do, when rent and real estate is so incredibly inflated? I simply CANNOT stay with my abuser but I feel stuck.

title: I'm done with people pleasing
body:
So my dad just called me to tell me he won't be coming to my birthday party.

It's too stressful because there will be many people (10) and a cat. Yes, a cat. 

And no, it's not about his and his wife's young dog they can't seem to handle but don't want to be taken care of somebody else for a few hours /s.

But the main reason is, my mother's husband (my parents divorced when I was three years old) is an asshole and my dad "just can't cope being around someone who said bad things about him." To be clear, they never had an open conflict. It was just my brother who told my dad my "stepdad" talked shit about him.

Yeah, dad. 

I faced my abuser who molested me from age 8 to 12 every single day and had to pretend I'm totally fine with him being around for at least 20 years.

This abuser happens to be my brother.

I am told to face my bully who happens to be my step sisters boyfriend at christmas, because he changed and am told to get "over the past".

So my dad asked "I hope it's not too bad that we're not coming." with a shaky voice. And I inititally thought "poor dad, it's okay, don't cry, it's just my birthday".

But instead I said "I accept your decision but I am not going to pretend that I'm not sad."

He started to complain, said things about the relationship with my mom and so on...I interrupted him and said:
"I don't wanna hear these old stories. I accept your decision, but I don't understand it. You said you want to be honest, so am I. I am very sad. We both have to live with that."

I feel like I'm overreacting. My life has always been about my depressive and alcoholic mom and my brother, who is a drug addict now and seems to make me responsible for his miserable life, because I "apparently asked for it" when I was young.

I'm done with this shit. I'm not saying "Everything is fine, I understand" anymore. Maybe I'm unreasonable and unfair towards my dad. But I'm hurt that after two years without being able to attend my birthday, he won't be coming. 

I'm just done being understanding towards everyone in this family while spending time with me is treated like a task.

I'm sorry if this post doesn't fit the sub and also if it is kinda hard to read, english is not my first language. There happened a lot more in my family which I cannot write down in one posting. I just needed to vent. Maybe someone can understand.

EDIT:

Thank you everyone for replying. It really helps me in this process to heal and start distancing myself from this.

title: School staff member looking at my chest area.. Need advice!
body: I don‚Äôt know if this is the right space to ask this but I really need help, so I am a 14F (9th grade) and there is this person who works at my school, i‚Äôm not really sure what she works as but i mostly see her in the deans office half of the time. When i was walking to class, she asked if i needed a bra, I told her no and that they made me uncomfortable so I don‚Äôt wear them as much. She kept pressing about it and said that she looked at my breasts yesterday but didn‚Äôt say anything. I was very uncomfortable at the fact that a grown woman was staring at my breasts two times in a row, She told me that she‚Äôll get me one knowing that I told her specifically that they just made me uncomfortable and I don‚Äôt wear them as much. There‚Äôs no dress code for this or anything, just don‚Äôt wear anything inappropriate basically. I was wearing a black shirt that covered basically everything and I don‚Äôt do anything to pull attention to my chest area. so, another day comes  and it‚Äôs really embarrassing because she literally put bras on her computer and called me over to her computer when there‚Äôs people in the office who can see and tell me to choose one that I would want, and she just kept pressing about this and pressing over and over again. It has overwhelmed me a lot. So, when the package arrives, she gives it to me infront of like two other students in the office and another person who works there, so i‚Äôm feeling a bit humiliated already. She tells me to try them on, I go in the bathroom and i try it on and it is extremely tight and uncomfortable. Before that, I asked her if i had to try them on because in my head i would much rather just try them on at home in a private space. She tells me yes and that she‚Äôll love me forever if i do. I tried it on and yeah it was uncomfortable. So, I just leave the package on her desk and quickly leave because I am feeling overwhelmed and embarrassed. I didn‚Äôt leave the bra on because of how tight it was so i just put it back in the bag and left. The next day, I tell her that it was uncomfortable because she had found me in the hallway and she told me to come to her office again next Thursday to pick out another few. this has been going on for weeks and like she just won‚Äôt stop even after I show her my uncomfortableness. I told my mom about it the first time it happened and my mom agreed with her, my dad was the only one who found this weird. I asked my boyfriend what should I do and he told me that I should just deal with it. I mainly wear baggy clothing and I remember she called my mom and told her that if she noticed that I wasn‚Äôt wearing one then boys could‚Äôve been looking at my chest too. so I have been self-conscious about my chest ever since and I don‚Äôt leave anywhere without a jacket on even in hot weather. I barely know this woman , I only spoke to her a few times throughout middle school, but it was never like being THIS comfortable with each other. she won‚Äôt stop and it has made me not want to come to school because I know that she‚Äôs going to make a comment about my breasts, because now that‚Äôs the only thing she‚Äôs even talking to me about. so I hope I‚Äôm not just being dramatic, but I really do need advice on how to navigate this because I‚Äôm very uncomfortable with this whole entire situation and I don‚Äôt know who to turn to.

title: Alone and pathetic on my birthday.
body:
I'm really just looking for a little sympathy here. My boyfriend of two years broke up with me yesterday. My birthday is today and we had made plans to go out to dinner tonight, so naturally I didn't have any sort of back up plan. My family all thought I was doing things with friends and my friends all thought I had plans with my (ex)boyfriend.

I'm just so sad and bummed. I feel like I can't say anything to anyone without sounding whiny so I thought I would try to vent here. I feel really lonely and terrible. 

Help :c

**edit: Thank you so so so much for all of your kind words and ideas. I'm going to try very hard to not let myself stay depressed and down. My birthday is my day and it's what I make of it. (even though it's the day after!) You're all so very wonderful and the responses mean a lot.**

title: How do women find the time and energy to do their hair and makeup most days?
body:
Lately I‚Äôve been really wanting to straighten my hair, but with work and life I just can‚Äôt find the time to take 45mins-1 hour to do it (my hair is really thick and really curly). Not only that, but I sweat a lot at the gym and my hair curls back up again so I don‚Äôt see the point if it‚Äôs only gonna last a few hours before I ruin it.

Most mornings I just shower, cloth myself, eat something, and rush off to work. I get too exhausted to spend time on myself and I consider the gym time on myself really. 

My lack of put-togetherness lately has been killing my confidence. I struggle a lot with self esteem, and try to hold back from falling into deep bouts of depression nearly every other day. I‚Äôm doing okay, but I‚Äôm just going through the motions and rushing to the next thing in my day. It amazes me the women I see who have kids, workout, work, go to school, do it all and still have time to get their hair, nails, and makeup done, with the tan to go with. I always assume they must be lagging in some area in their life because there‚Äôs no way they can do it all. It turns out, there are a lot of superwomans out there, and I‚Äôm just projecting my insecurity of not having myself together on others.

Anywho, enough with the sad fest. What are some tips and tricks you guys have to keep yourselves looking presentable most of the time, even when you have a million other things going on?

title: Planning to divorce my husband and need reassurance that I'm not a monster
body:
I'm happy to answer questions in the comments...the gist of it is that I've (35f) been with my husband (48m) for almost 13 years, married 10. You can see that there is a significant age gap and I was VERY young (22) when we met. For a long time he was my best friend and I was head over heels in love with him, but in the last few years I've just felt...nothing. I feel no connection with him other than him being someone I mostly get along with. I want to make it clear right away that he is not a terrible person, he is not an abuser, and I don't hate him. However...I don't think he's someone I can have a future with anymore.

A few (not all) of the major issues:

\- he is very irresponsible with his finances. He has no savings and tons of medical debt that he is actively ignoring.

\- his health is terrible. He has uncontrolled type 2 diabetes with his sugars typically in the high 200s - 300s. He is experiencing complications such as severe neuropathy, loss of eyesight, minor cuts turning into severe infections, etc. He almost lost his entire foot in May due to a raging staph infection stemming from a tiny cut he couldn't feel because he can't feel most of his feet. He has made no lifestyle changes in an attempt to control his diabetes and it continues to get worse. It also affects our sex life as he struggles with ED and often can't get hard.

He has also neglected his dental health to the point where he is missing most of his teeth, and the remaining teeth are broken and rotting. He is not able to afford dentures because he spends his disposable income on take-out food and items for his hobby. I knew about his teeth when we met and it was never an issue of appearance, but after 13 years of inaction I am fed up with hearing him complain and cry about it.

\- he is extremely untidy to the point of being filthy. I am not a neat freak, but I grew up in a hoarded house infested with mice and bugs, and need to keep my surroundings reasonably neat for my mental and physical health. I certainly create my own share of clutter, but I also do the majority of the cleaning: laundry, dishes, cat box, garbage and recycling, sweeping/vacuuming, changing bed sheets, cleaning the bathroom and kitchen, etc. He will occasionally do one or two of these things, and considers his weight pulled. Again...this has been happening for 13 years. We have fought, discussed, made deals, and it goes back to the same old unequal division of duties. Simply going on a cleaning strike is not an option for me.

\- We both suffer from depression and anxiety. I am diagnose with Major Depressive Disorder and Generalized Anxiety Disorder. After ending up in the hospital in 2016 I have worked very hard to get better, and it's been mostly successful. I'm on medication and have adopted lifestyle changes that benefit my mental and physical health. My husband, after 9 years of me begging him to get help, was put on a starter dose of Prozac and stopped taking it after 2 weeks. He has not sought any kind of therapy, medical or otherwise, since then. His outlook on life is extremely negative and he feels personally victimized by any inconvenience, big or small. He is paranoid, distrustful, and feels that people in general are terrible. He relocated from his home town to live with me and has made no local friends in the 12 years he's lived here. My friends have, after a decade, stopped trying to invite him to things or include him in plans because 99% of the time he declines. He is now convinced that they all hate him, which is not true. I see my friends regularly and will go on trips without him, which upsets him but he also won't come with.

I guess my issue is that despite all of this, he's not a bad person and I know he loves me in some capacity, but at this point I feel that I can't grow as a person or accomplish my goals when having to deal with the things he refuses to deal with. I don't want to be widowed at 40. I don't want to have to take care of someone due to their blatant self-neglect. I have health issues of my own that I am being VERY pro-active about and the divide just seems to get bigger and bigger. I also can't continue doing the lion's share of maintaining a home, physically or mentally. I need someone who is a true partner, and I don't have that in him anymore.

title: Abusive ex hacked into old dating profile and is baiting men to harass me. Terrified and alone.
body:
When I was 19 and fresh out of inpatient treatment, I met a 25 year old man on Okay Cupid. I wasn't in a place to date him seriously, as I was transitioning from having no control at all (treatment) to finally figuring myself out. However, he pressured me again and again to date exclusively, and we ended up in a two year, horribly abusive relationship. 

The first red flag:  one of the first times I spent the night, after passing out drunk, he took my phone and went through all my texts. A male friend texted me. In the morning, he threatened to kick me out. 

This set a precedent for the rest of our relationship; he systematically found any social media account I had ever had, read what he wanted into my email and texts (male friends texting me; e-mails from photographers asking if I was comfortable with nudes) and would harass me about the information found afterward. When I say harass, I mean unending verbally abusive texts about me being a slut, untrustworthy etc, him never being able to trust me again. Calls and calls and calls. Unending. When I once told him I was changing all my passwords, he told me that was unacceptable because he "needed" them in order for me to prove I was loyal to him. 

I never cheated once. Not after he fucked me multiple times while I was passed out (I remember waking up in bed next to my best friend to him thrusting inside of me). Not after he shamed me for my clothes, telling me I was eliciting too much male attention with this shirt. That dress. Those shoes. Not after reducing me to only my sex. Not after shaking me and intimidating me during our arguments. 

And then it came. Two years, a horrible eating disorder, shattered self-esteem later...we broke up. I thought I could finally rest and order myself together like I've honestly needed to since I was 19. Nope. Last night, he broke into an old dating site of mine. He swept through everything. He texted me non-stop about what I whore I was. Said he was glad to know he was right all along, that I wasn't to be trusted and I betrayed him. Note: every message sent on that dating profile occurred after our break up. Further note: his betrayal refers to us talking about how we would use the time a part to work on ourselves and become healthier people. A part of that was not pursuing anyone romantically (though no mentions of sexually). I wasn't pursuing anyone. I have very low self-esteem and when I am alone I use online men to validate what I perceive to be a disgusting, unloveable girl.

He has locked me out of it so I can't delete it. I have been getting increasingly sexual text messages from men I don't know all day. I am afraid he is impersonating me and baiting them into harassing me. I am so overwhelmed. 

On top of this, I have a severe eating disorder and social anxiety, which our two years together only made worse (i.e. him reducing me to only the sex I was or was not having). I feel worthless. I feel afraid, of him, and of his words - what if he's right and I really am just a whore? I honestly don't know what to do.

title: I am a healthy weight, but mom won't stop body shaming me?
body:
I normally don't post things like this, but I have nowhere else to go. I am 5 ft 3 in and around 130 lbs. I'm home from college for winter break, and am at a loss. My mom, who has always body-shamed me and told me to lose 5-10 lbs, is more aggressive than ever about it. I'm getting married in 5 months, and she is constantly on me about my weight and my 99 lb sister has also started a little too, albeit more gently. My own father even told me I could stand to "lose a few pounds" and my mom even cried when she saw me in my wedding dress, not because I was beautiful or grown up, but because I had "gained so much weight." My wedding dress is a size four and fits me perfectly. I've always had body image issues (wonder why lol) so I have been trying to practice body love and list out things I do like about myself, and this morning was feeling pretty good about my body. I casually remarked that I'm skinny and my mom immediatly retorted "you aren't skinny. You aren't fat, either, but you're definitely not skinny." Then she plays the victim when I get upset and says I'm "too sensitive." Our family dynamic is very involved, so I can't just walk away without being guilted by everybody in my family and breaking my mom's heart, because she honestly believes she's helping me. I have tried everything and am at my wit's end here. I'm afraid I won't feel beautiful in my wedding because of the constant put-downs. I can't bring this up with my fianc√© either, because he is already about to tell my family off, which would alienate us both because my family is very traditional. Any advice on how to move forward?

TL;DR: I am healthy but whole family, especially mom, keeps body shaming me.

title: Getting my second ever pap tomorrow. So freaking scared.
body:
I got my first pap smear at 18. I was a virgin at the time. I asked my mom beforehand if it would hurt and she said "no, you'll just feel a little pressure." 

I went in totally unprepared and it was honestly the most painful thing I've ever experienced. I know that sounds super wimpy, to say the most painful thing I've ever experienced is a pap smear. But it was awful. I cried hysterically the whole time, was literally screaming in pain. It felt like I was being stabbed with a knife in my vagina. My results were normal, so that was good. But I honestly felt traumatized from it. I know that sounds silly. 

After that, I refused to get another one. Almost seven years have passed since my first one. I turn 25 next month. 

Just recently I had my first appointment with a new doctor, a woman (last one was a man, and he *was* a great doctor, I don't hold the pap experience against him. Only reason I have a new doctor now is because he retired). When I told her my last pap smear was almost seven years ago, she recommended I get another one asap. So I have one scheduled for tomorrow. 

I'm literally terrified. My doctor told me sometimes just having a woman do the procedure can make it less stressful, and she also offered to give me Xanax beforehand. I appreciate that, but I also don't know if it will help. 

My only hope is that since I've been sexually active for a few years now, it won't be as painful as it was when I was a virgin. 

Does anybody have any advice on how to mentally prepare myself? I don't have any issues with abnormal pain during sex or anything, no issues like vaginismus or anything like that. So I don't know why the first one was so painful.

title: How to trust my boyfriend again after lying?
body:
I've been dating my boyfriend, M, for a little over a year now, and we have a really strong relationship, and we're really serious about each other.

We're both in our late teens, about to graduate, and we still live with our parents. We skype every night to go to sleep(because we're one of those clingy couples that's with each other every second of the day), but M technically has a "bedtime", mostly because his parents don't want him up all night playing video games and stuff, or being loud, while they're trying to sleep. 

So, M always told me his bed time was 10, and he would get back on his laptop after his parents were asleep. But it turns out, for months, he's been lying to me, his bedtime was actually 10:30, and he never payed attention to whether or not his parents were asleep when he got back on the laptop. I found out because we aren't secretive(or so I thought), and we know eachother's passwords, and often leave our stuff logged on on eachother's laptops. 

So I saw his facebook. He was talking to a group of people, and during that conversation he decided he would make a gif of something. When he "got back on" around 11, he told me he was talking to those people(said he started talking to them when he was talking to me), and was going to make a gif. He stopped messaging me for about 10 minutes to "make the gif". But it was already made. He just went through the process of pretending, to hide that he was online from me. 

I confronted him, and I think he came clean(I don't know if he's lying about anything else), and admitted that he'd been doing stuff like this for months. 

But the thing is, is he doesn't really have a reason to lie(he said he thought I would "get mad"), even if he wanted to be on the internet without talking to me for like an hour or something, I wouldn't care. We're clingy, but I'm not controlling. 

And also, I haven't brought it up to him because I just realized it, but a lot of the nights he couldn't "get back on the computer" until 12 AM - 1 AM in the morning. Which always sucked because I like going to sleep at an okay hour. He originally said he wanted an hour to himself, but a lot of times he takes 3 hours, and I don't understand.

There was no reason to lie, but he did it for months, we've also had lying as an issue before(about small things, but I would talk to him about how it's not okay, because I literally don't lie to him about anything). 

Anyways,  I'm sorry this is so long, but I don't know how to trust him. This is eating away at me. I already have a lot of trust issues(he's not even aware of this, because I've done nothing but 100% trust him from the start), and anxiety, and I can't focus on anything but this. He  was lying for *months*. And he didn't even have a reason to. It just makes me think, what'll happen when he does have a reason?

Anyways, sorry this is so long, and thanks, if you read the whole thing... but how do I trust him again? It wasn't a huge lie, but it's so hard to get over for me.



Edit; look, everyone here is down voting me and saying I need to give him space(which I do, he is the clingy one), but I was originally asking how to get over it. I know it's not a big lie, but it hurts a lot, and I love him, and don't want to doubt him. But that's all. I tried to give some backstory, but everyone's jumping on me being overly attached, but really the reason we spend so much time together is because he wants to be together every second. And while I'm not against it, I'm not the one who is not allowing alone time. If someone could please answer my original question, how do I get over him lying to me, and trust him 100% again?

title: Terrified for Internal Ultrasound!! Help :(
body:
A few weeks ago I found out I was pregnant. I have only ever been with one person sexually and I have never been to an obgyn. Tomorrow is my first appointent and they have "US endovag ONLY" listed for my ultrasound on mycharts and I have been in panic mode ever since. I was kind of expecting it but having a stranger stick a wand in me or their fingers even or even just looking at me is a fear worse than death for me. Does anyone have any advice that would help me calm down a little or help me through it? my bf and I are going out to watch a movie and eat dinner after to distract me but i am still so terrified by the thought of someone looking at me or sticking something in me. 

Everyone keeps telling me now that I am pregnant its not about me anymore and I know I have to go in for this ultrasound to make sure my baby is okay but it doesnt make it any less terrifying. Everyone tells me its not a big deal and downplays my emotions but god im mortified anf i dont know what to do. I guess wish me luck. a little overdramatic i guess but when i found out i sobbed and had a panic attack for an hour and a half. never been touched nonconsentually but for some reason people keep assuming this is my problem when i tell them im terrified. thank you all for your help!!

title: I don't know if I should leave my terminally ill husband.
body:
I'll try to be as detailed as possible/try to explain as best as I can but I'm forgetful and might have to edit to elaborate.

I'm in an abusive relationship; my husband is physically, sexually, mentally and financially abusive. I'm 19 years old and my husband is 30. we met and started dating when I was underage (I was 14) but I was isolated and alone, none of my family cared about me so I didn't have anyone to tell me that maybe this relationship was wrong. We got married the week I turned 18, and this January, we moved up north, close to the border of Canada, in the middle of nowhere. And I mean NOWHERE, the nearest store is 15 miles away, the hospital is even further and I'm wheelchair bound and can't drive.

so I'm trapped and isolated, and I have a 3 year old son, and an 8 month old baby (both are his kids). and this week, I found out that I'm pregnant. so I'm feeling even more trapped, especially because I don't work and he makes all the money. even if I could physically leave, I have kids, I'm pregnant, I'm disabled and I didn't graduate high school so my job choices are slim to none.

for more context, I'm disabled because, over the last couple of years, he has repeatedly dislocated my hips. And, the last time he did it, when we moved, he kept me from getting medical treatment, so the bone started dying. there's no way to reverse it, just slow it down and help deal with the pain, which I can't do either because he won't let me go to physical therapy.

also, I can't go on birth control. the pill has really adverse and severe side effects, and Im very forgetful so I miss days, which negates the whole point of taking it. and this pregnancy actually happened while I was on the IUD, so even long term birth control doesn't work. I dont know why. and because I can't go on birth control, I have had multiple pregnancies, one after the other, but most have ended in miscarriage because of all the stress and physical abuse.

BUT, the main reason leaving has been an option recently is because in March, my husband was diagnosed with something terminal and was told that he probably had 2 years left. 5 maybe; a 20% chance he'd make it to five years. and I dont know if I should just stay with him for the rest of his life, or if I should just leave him. it would seem cruel to leave him while he's sick, but he's not himself lately because of the medicine he takes. I managed to get a job babysitting my neighbors kids (its only 20 dollars a day but I can take my kids with me) without him noticing because he's either at work or asleep. that never would have happened before; he's always maintained a firm grip on my freedom and finances.

so, like I said. I don't know if I should leave while I can or just wait it out. it seems cruel to leave. but there's always a possibility he'll make it to 5 or even 10 years, and if he continues to be as abusive as he always is (or even worse), I'll probably die from the physical abuse (he's actually nearly killed me multiple times and my throat is permanently damaged because of it).

edit: the one thing I forgot to mention was that I have reported him multiple times to the police and to doctors. every time, he managed to get the police to believe him and not me, even when I was a minor. he'd purposefully hurt me in ways that looked like self injury because I have a history of depression and suicidal tendencies. he even once had me involuntarily committed to a mental hospital after I tried to leave him; he had told the doctors that I was suffering from postpartum psychosis (this was after I had my 8 month old) and they believed him because he works in the medical field.

edit 2: this is a crosspost r/relationship_advice

title: We took the decision to have an abortion in a panic and now my wife focusses her sadness as anger towards me. I need help to safe our mariage and family.
body:
To give you all the background this is going to be a long story, but your help will be most appreciated.

We are a married couple, 34 and 37 years old, with two beautifull children, almost 2 and 4 years old. We are from western Europe, but now live in Japan. We came here 1,5 years ago for my job, a big opportunity to create more security for our family, but my wife had to give up her job for my career. This is not the issue, we have been very happy for the last 18 months here, but it is important to realise that she made a great sacrifice for my career and financial security for us as a family. 

After a great holiday back home with a lot of hapiness came the shock. After not getting her period we became worried and a few days later found out that my wife was pregnant. Both her and mine initial reaction was panic. I will try to describe why we panicked. It is very expensife to have a child in Japan and even though we have some savings, they would be completely wiped out by having another child. Also it is very impractical to have 3 children in Japan, this country is not set up for large families. We both felt that the strain this would put on our family would be very big and that we would be able to offer our 2 children much less. Then I mean things like going to the park, sports lessons, music lessons and international school. Then there is the medical condition of my wife, she has chronic high blood pressure and the previous 2 pregnancies have been anything but easy. The whole generation of her father has died before the age of 45 (all 7 brothers and sisters!). Somehow this was only a concern for me and she did not take this into consideration. 

Both our initial reaction was this is never going to work and that we need to have an abortion (we are from a liberal country and are not religious and she had an abortion 12 years ago when we were students). We discussed the situation and what to do for a few days and my decision tended to take an abortion. I made it clear to her at that point that thats how I felt and that I felt this way mainly because of her health. All the operational and financial issues can be solved, but i have a real fear that she will lose a few years of her life by having another baby. My biggest fear our whole marriage is losing her and being left alone with 2 children that we love dearly. I also told her that it was in the end her decision as it is her body and she would have to do all the work, whatever way we would go. Her decision was then to take an abortion, and to do it fast. So one week after finding out we were pregnant she had an abortion. This in itself was a very unpleasant experience. I could not be with her (not allowed by the clinic) and the staff only speaks Japanese, and she doesnt.

Now we are 3 weeks further and the problems this has brought along are much bigger then I, and her, expected. Obviously she was very sad with what happened and the regret is very big for her now. I also have some regrets, for me the decision was something like 60/40. The problem is that her pain and sadness has taken the form of anger towards me and in a lesser extend to our whole family. She says that when she sees me, she is reminded of her loss and that she feels that I have taken something away from her. Also she can not really enjoy time with our 2 children. She still loves them and takes care of them, but she says the hapiness is gone. I really want to help her with her pain, but she will not open up to me emotionally. I am afraid if we can not get this fixed it will break us apart and we will all lose what we love most. 

I have many regrets now. I should have told her about my worries for her health and life before and we should have discussed about having a 3rd child much sooner. We have been really stupid not really talking about this. I feel now that it was better to keep this baby. It would have been hard, but the current threat to our hapiness is much bigger. 

I would really like your advice in how to deal with this situation. How can I help my wife, and how can I reestablish an emotional connection with her? If you have any more questions about our lifes or situation, please ask, I will be very open. This is a throwaway so I dont have anything to hide.

title: My boyfriend of 7 years left me today because I wouldn't perform oral sex on him.
body:
CW: Sexual assault, men

Throwaway.

I don't know where to start, I'm pretty angry and sad because I thought this was *the one* (I know, I'm dumb). We were together for 7 years (HS sweethearts) and in our 20's, we lived together for 5 years and have 2 dogs. Last night I went to sleep cuddled up on him like always, everything was normal yesterday and today suddenly I got hit by the "talk" after lunch.

So he's always loved the idea of blowjobs but since I was his first gf he's never gotten one, because my boundaries state that I DO NOT DO BJ'S. Why? Because I was forced to give them to entire groups of boys in junior high, I was coerced, they had pictures of me naked that I sent to someone I trusted. It started out with only one guy but he brought friends once and so on and so forth. I don't really want to go into any more detail. The issue is solved, police were involved.

He knows this is what happened and the reason I don't want to give BJ's anymore, at first he was ok with this but sometimes he would slip and ask me if I'd be willing to try it, I always said no. He respected that for like 3 years until late 2019 when he asked again and I again said NO. It made me sad, I would instantly cry when he brought it up and last year was no exception even though it had been so long since the last time.

Today he sat me down and asked me if I still felt this way and when I said I did he asked me to try therapy. I asked for what? I don't *need* therapy, I just want to keep penises away from my god damn face. He said this was selfish and that if I'm not willing to fix my problems with penises that we could no longer be together, then he got up and left, told me to think about it and he will be back tomorrow.

He said he read various posts online about people in unfulfilled marriages and partnerships where everyone always replied to the OP that they should dump their partners because life is too short or something to be sexually unsatisfied. I don't think this is fair, it can't be that important to want to leave me. I'll do literally anything else he asks in the bedroom except for this, how can it be a dealbreaker?? Not like I'm not having any sex at all with him.

Anyhow I'm super frustrated and don't really have anyone to talk to about this, it's just too humiliating. If anyone can offer advice I'd be truly grateful. Thanks TwoX.

title: Friend got with me while I was Overdosing and I don't know what to do....
body:
About a month ago, just after christmas, I found some klonopin in a draw. I called up my best male friend at the time and told him to bring some weed over. I told him how much I was taking (around 3mg without tolerance) and he met me at my house. He forgot the weed so I instead suggested we drink. I ended up having about 10 shots of gin, and he had around 7-8. As well as this, my stupid barred out brain told me to take a bunch of Tramadol and other assorted medications, Trazadone, a pack of hayfever meds etc... (I was in a very bad place and have struggled with my mental health for a while).

Anyway, as would be assumed, I blacked out after that and have literally no memory of anything- until I was riding my bike along a highway at 2am to his house (I don't know why, I think he told me to). Once I was there I realised that I was no longer in my previous outfit, and was not wearing a bra or underwear under my clothing. Asking him about it, he told me we had made out and I had given him Oral, and my clothes had been taken off.

This was especially disturbing to me as I have never ever been into him or any other man, and have identified as a lesbian since I was around 12 years old, which we talked about alot and was very very clear to him. He, on the other hand, had made uncomfortable comments in the past about how I looked, and how pretty I was etc. I then blacked out again and remember waking up in my bed. I once again questioned him about what had happened and he responded with meme-y smiley faces and a comment of "8/10 Blowjob very good". He also told me that he had said no at first to "my initiation" and then "let it happen". I have zero trace or memory of this happening whatsoever.

From here, I felt very uncomfortable so I blocked him, and the next day I found a video he had recorded of me on my phone. It was him saying: "I'm here with Glass-Session-1198, say it, say the word, 3,2,1, say consent" to me. In the video I cannot keep my head up and cannot speak properly, but he is able to.

I sent him the video and asked for an explanation, where he stated I was begging him to do stuff and he had rejected me several times before "giving in". Again, he watched me take several sleeves of medication and knew I was very very gay and not at all interested in him. He then claimed that I had done harm to him instead of the other way round.

PS. I have stopped abusing pills, and I am underage, and so is the boy. He took me to his family christmas etc and we had sleepovers before this. I have tried my hardest to lay this situation out as bluntly as possible, as he goes to my school and seeing him makes me panic really bad. I don't know what to do and as a young girl I would really appreciate some help and advice.

title: I need help. I don't remember anything from a drunken night.
body:
