The night prior I remember having one mixed drink, 2 shots, and played one round of beer pong. I know how much liquor I can handle and that was no where near the amount that makes me black out.
We made a beer run and got back and I noticed that this guy that I've met once before was there. Our last encounter was not very pleasant, in fact it was very strange. He got really pissed off that I didn't want to sleep with him. I tried to avoid him as much as possible. Next thing I knew I woke up next to him the next morning naked. As i was putting my clothes back on I noticed that my shoe was completely broken, the whole strap was 100% detached. 
I don't remember fucking this guy at all and that makes me so uneasy! I remember one snippet but it feels like a dream so I don't know if this actually happened or not, but I'm having flashbacks where I'm laying on my stomach and he's on top of me with his hand covering my mouth. Like I said, I don't know if that actually happened or not it feels like a dream. I feel so disgusting and violated. I came home that day and spent about an hour in the shower but I still can't stop thinking about it. 
I'm making this post because I was clearly intoxicated but I wanted to know your guys thoughts on intoxication and consent. Do you think someone who's obviously under the influence can give consent?

title: I was sexually assaulted by another girl when I was young- get the feeling it‚Äôs antifeminist to discuss and doesn‚Äôt fit cultural narrative of men hurting women. Ashamed.
body:
Throwaway acct. Sorry.




When I was 10, something happened with a 13 year old family friend‚Äôs daughter. It‚Äôs only recently that I‚Äôm able to identify it as assault rather than just an early sexual experience.




I‚Äôll spare the details, but I will say that I thought she was cute and I just wanted to cuddle and maybe kiss. Instead, she did something unwanted and something, er, tore. I thought I had started my period but I didn‚Äôt actually get it for another three years. Yet, I also experienced my first orgasm, and she told me not to tell anyone or they would think I was gay. (Spoiler alert, I am *now*, but I didn‚Äôt want to be that then!)




I tried to talk to my wife about this, but she just said, ‚Äúwell, shit happens.‚Äù I can‚Äôt blame her, because she was abused by a male relative for *years*, so what happened to me is probably just a normal childhood day for her.




But the thing that bothers me now is that I can‚Äôt talk about this, even with MeToo having happened. It‚Äôs seen as normal and brave for women to expose and discuss the men who assault them- but where does the LGBT community fit in? I also feel that current discourse around sexual assault tends to paint women as blameless, like victims. 





So what can one do when a woman or girl *is* the predator? I even struggle with the language surrounding what happened. I can‚Äôt exactly call it rape because of the lack of, er, a penis.




Has anyone had a similar experience?

title: I watched The Invisible Man (2020) with my husband, only to realize that my father has been abusing my family all these years
body:
English is not my first language so please tolerate my grammar mistakes. 


It is a rather simple horror movie, girl was abused by her boyfriend/husband, ran away, he did everything to make her life in hell so she would go back to him. 



My husband and I talk a lot when watching movies at home, the kids are sleeping, that's our chance to drink a bit and the F word, freedom time.



Anyway, at the beginning of the movie, I was telling my husband ‚Äúoh that's exactly what abusive people do‚Äú ‚Äúhe is isolating her from her friends and family, typical‚Äú, then I suddenly realized, that's what my dad been doing to us (mom, my brother and I)!!!!



Specially she said something like, if he doesn't like what he thinks that you are thinking, he would be very upset. 



I almost scream and said, that's what my dad does too!



I am not close to my dad, growing up he made a lot of money, we lived a pretty good life, nothing fancy. He spent a lot of money for me, for medical and schools, my health was not good when I was growing up, I love books, he let me buy a lot of books. At the same time, while we did live a somewhat privileged life, we were not allowed to go out. Going out with aunts and uncles  on a Saturday morning for a Cantonese breakfast? No, stay home, you shouldn't hang out with them, a waste of time. Going to a classmate‚Äòs birthday party? No, well I don't mean no but you better think about it, you might regret it, you better stay home and study. 



The worst was when my grandma (my mom‚Äòs side) passed away, my brother and I were not allowed to the funeral. Why? Outside is useless, stay home. 



Long time ago, he asked me to ‚Äúopen my heart‚Äú and told him what my dream was. He was all nice and sincere, I said I wanted to be a movie director, then his face literally changed, he yelled, said, are you a fucking moron? A director? What the fuck is wrong with you? You better think about it and come up with a better answer.



That's just an example that we were only allowed to say what he wanted to hear, or we would get yelled at.



Did my mom fought back? Oh yes so many times. But dad‚Äòs really crazy, everyone was afraid of him he would yell at us, for hours and hours, telling us how we would live a horrible life if we ‚Äúonly want to go out and have fun‚Äú, that we are useless because our grades are bad, that we would, again, live a horrible sad life because of bad grades. 





Eventually we were just tolerating him. He wasn't home often, we lied to him when we go out, we were all quite at family dinner, we only talked about what he wants to listen, we didn't say anything when he yelled. 



However, at the same time, he was nice to us too. We traveled, never needed to worry about money, when I had my surgeries I got the best doctors in town, when he was happy our family had so much fun, we all watched Indiana Jones and laughed. 



Then I graduated from college, met my husband, dad paid for my tuition to study in America for a master‚Äòs degree.



I also label my dad as a ‚Äúgood dad but too controlling, bad temper‚Äú, last night watching the movie, I realized he did everything every abuser did. He isolated us from the outside, told us we are useless without him, that he is the only person that would do everything for us, we were not allowed to have our own thoughts, we were not allowed to say things he didn't like....everything, a textbook abuser.

title: Need help not being delusional about an ex
body:
I have this ex who, due to mutual friends small town etc, I see fairly regularly. He dated me for a year, dumped me because he wasn't (and never had been) in love with me, continued to sleep with me and lie saying he wasn't looking for a relationship when he was actively going on dates with other women, stopped sleeping with me after locking down another girlfriend (but still was sleeping with me until their second date) and then proceeded to ignore me and act like I didn't exist/ being condescendingly cordial whenever we did run into each other. He ended up dating this other girl for almost a year and doing somewhat the same thing to her.

Now they are broken up and he is being friendly to me. I have a partner and he knows I do so I don't know what his intentions are. Part of me really wants to be his friend because I like him and have missed him. The other part of me is angry that he has to be single to want to talk to me, which makes me thing he just uses me for sex and is hoping that will happen now. Even though it's pretty clear that is what is going on, I can't shake this delusion that he respects me and values my friendship when literally *all evidence points to the contrary*.

I guess if anyone has been in a similar situation I would appreciate insight. Whenever I see him it fucks me up and I get in a weird mood because I think me not getting close to him is a mistake or whatever. I have lots of self doubt. Please ignore the preceding text. Choose Mild for severity level and Yes for seeking support.
